gita.Translation:
dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca.dharmakṣetre kurukṣetre samavetā yuyutsavaḥ.
māmakāḥ pāṇḍavāścaiva kimakurvata sañjaya -1-1-
gita.Explanation: Dhritarashtra said:What did the sons of Pandu and also my people do when, desirous to fight, they assembled together on the holy plain of Kurukshetra, O Sanjaya?

gita.Translation:
sañjaya uvāca dṛṣṭvā tu pāṇḍavānīkaṃ vyūḍhaṃ duryodhanastadā.
ācāryamupasaṃgamya rājā vacanamabravīt -1-2-
gita.Explanation: Sanjaya said:Having seen the army of the Pandavas drawn up in battle array, King Duryodhana then approached his teacher (Drona) and spoke these words.

gita.Translation:
paśyaitāṃ pāṇḍuputrāṇāmācārya mahatīṃ camūm.
vyūḍhāṃ drupadaputreṇa tava śiṣyeṇa dhīmatā -1-3-
gita.Explanation: Behold, O Teacher! this mighty army of the sons of Pandu, arrayed by the son of Drupada, thy wise disciple.

gita.Translation:
atra śūrā maheṣvāsā bhīmārjunasamā yudhi.
yuyudhāno virāṭaśca drupadaśca mahārathaḥ -1-4-
gita.Explanation: Here are heroes, mighty archers, equal in battle to Bhima and Arjuna, Yuyudhana, Virata and Drupada, each commanding eleven-thousand archers.

gita.Translation:
dhṛṣṭaketuścekitānaḥ kāśirājaśca vīryavān.
purujitkuntibhojaśca śaibyaśca narapuṃgavaḥ -1-5-
gita.Explanation: Dhrishtaketu, Chekitana, and the valiant king of Kashi, Purujit and Kuntibhoja and Saibya, the best of men.

gita.Translation:
yudhāmanyuśca vikrānta uttamaujāśca vīryavān.
saubhadro draupadeyāśca sarva eva mahārathāḥ -1-6-
gita.Explanation: The strong Yudhamanyu and the brave Uttamaujas, the son of Subhadra and the sons of Draupadi, all of them, divisional commanders.

gita.Line1: अस्माकं तु विशिष्टा ये तान्निबोध द्विजोत्तम |
gita.Line2: नायका मम सैन्यस्य संज्ञार्थं तान्ब्रवीमि ते ||१-७||
gita.Translation:
asmākaṃ tu viśiṣṭā ye tānnibodha dvijottama.
nāyakā mama sainyasya saṃjñārthaṃ tānbravīmi te -1-7-
gita.Explanation: Know also, O best among the twice-born, the names of those who are the most distinguished amongst ourselves, the leaders of my army; these I name to thee for thy information.

gita.Translation:
bhavānbhīṣmaśca karṇaśca kṛpaśca samitiñjayaḥ.
aśvatthāmā vikarṇaśca saumadattistathaiva ca -1-8-
gita.Explanation: Yourself and Bishma, and Karna and also Kripa, the victorious in war; Aswatthama, Vikarna and so also the son of Somadatta.

gita.Line1: अन्ये च बहवः शूरा मदर्थे त्यक्तजीविताः |
gita.Translation:
anye ca bahavaḥ śūrā madarthe tyaktajīvitāḥ.
nānāśastrapraharaṇāḥ sarve yuddhaviśāradāḥ -1-9-
gita.Explanation: And many other heroes also who are determined to give up their lives for my sake, armed with various weapons and missiles, all well-skilled in battle.

gita.Translation:
aparyāptaṃ tadasmākaṃ balaṃ bhīṣmābhirakṣitam.
paryāptaṃ tvidameteṣāṃ balaṃ bhīmābhirakṣitam -1-10-
gita.Explanation: This army of ours defended by Bhishma is insufficient, whereas that army of theirs defended by Bhima is sufficient. Or, This army of ours protected by Bhishma is unlimited, whereas that army of theirs protected by Bhima is limited.

gita.Translation:
ayaneṣu ca sarveṣu yathābhāgamavasthitāḥ.
bhīṣmamevābhirakṣantu bhavantaḥ sarva eva hi -1-11-
gita.Explanation: Therefore do you all, stationed in your respective positions in the several divisions of the army, protect Bhishma alone.

gita.Translation:
tasya sañjanayanharṣaṃ kuruvṛddhaḥ pitāmahaḥ.
siṃhanādaṃ vinadyoccaiḥ śaṅkhaṃ dadhmau pratāpavān -1-12-
gita.Explanation: His glorious grandsire (Bhishma) , the oldest of the Kauravas, in order to cheer Duryodhana, now sounded aloud a lion's roar and blew his conch.

gita.Translation:
tataḥ śaṅkhāśca bheryaśca paṇavānakagomukhāḥ.
sahasaivābhyahanyanta sa śabdastumulo.abhavat -1-13-
gita.Explanation: Then (following Bhishma) , conches and kettle-drums, tabors, drums and cow-horns blared forth quite suddenly and the sound was tremendous.

gita.Translation:
tataḥ śvetairhayairyukte mahati syandane sthitau.
mādhavaḥ pāṇḍavaścaiva divyau śaṅkhau pradadhmatuḥ -1-14-
gita.Explanation: Then, also Madhava and the son of Pandu, seated in their magnificent chariot yoked with white horses, blew their divine conches.

gita.Translation:
pāñcajanyaṃ hṛṣīkeśo devadattaṃ dhanañjayaḥ.
pauṇḍraṃ dadhmau mahāśaṅkhaṃ bhīmakarmā vṛkodaraḥ -1-15-
gita.Explanation: Hrishikesha blew the Panchajanya and Dhananjaya (Arjuna) blew the Devadatta and Vrikodara (Bhima) , the doer of terrible deeds, blew the great conch, named Paundra.

gita.Translation:
anantavijayaṃ rājā kuntīputro yudhiṣṭhiraḥ.
nakulaḥ sahadevaśca sughoṣamaṇipuṣpakau -1-16-
gita.Explanation: King Yudhisthira, the son of Kunti, blew the Anantavijaya; Nakula and Sahadeva blew the Sughosha and the Manipushpaka.

gita.Translation:
kāśyaśca parameṣvāsaḥ śikhaṇḍī ca mahārathaḥ.
dhṛṣṭadyumno virāṭaśca sātyakiścāparājitaḥ -1-17-
gita.Explanation: The king of Kashi, an excellent archer, Shikhandi, the mighty commander of eleven thousand archers, Dhristadyumna and Virata and Satyaki, the unconquered;

gita.Translation:
drupado draupadeyāśca sarvaśaḥ pṛthivīpate.
saubhadraśca mahābāhuḥ śaṅkhāndadhmuḥ pṛthakpṛthak -1-18-
gita.Explanation: Drupada and the sons of Draupadi, O Lord of the Earth, and the son of Subhadra, the mighty armed, blew their respective conches.

gita.Translation:
sa ghoṣo dhārtarāṣṭrāṇāṃ hṛdayāni vyadārayat.
nabhaśca pṛthivīṃ caiva tumulo.abhyanunādayan (lo vyanu)-1-19-
gita.Explanation: That tumultuous sound rent the hearts of (the people of) Dhritarashtra's party and made both heaven and earth reverberate.

gita.Translation:
atha vyavasthitāndṛṣṭvā dhārtarāṣṭrān kapidhvajaḥ.
pravṛtte śastrasampāte dhanurudyamya pāṇḍavaḥ -1-20-
gita.Explanation: Then, seeing the people of Dhritarashtra's party standing arrayed and the discharge of weapons about to begin, Arjuna, the son of Pandu, whose ensign was a monkey, took up his bow and said these words to Krishna (Hrishikesha) , O Lord of the Earth!

gita.Translation:
hṛṣīkeśaṃ tadā vākyamidamāha mahīpate.
arjuna uvāca.senayorubhayormadhye rathaṃ sthāpaya me.acyuta -1-21-
gita.Explanation: In the midst of the two armies, place my chariot, O Achyuta, that I may behold those who stand here desirous of fighting and, on the eve of this battle, let me know with whom I must fight.

gita.Translation:
yāvadetānnirikṣe.ahaṃ yoddhukāmānavasthitān.
kairmayā saha yoddhavyamasmin raṇasamudyame -1-22-
gita.Explanation: In the midst of the two armies, place my chariot, O Achyuta, that I may behold those who stand here desirous of fighting and, on the eve of this battle, let me know with whom I must fight.

gita.Translation:
yotsyamānānavekṣe.ahaṃ ya ete.atra samāgatāḥ.
dhārtarāṣṭrasya durbuddheryuddhe priyacikīrṣavaḥ -1-23-
gita.Explanation: For I desire to observe those who are assembled here for the fight, wishing to please in battle, the evil-minded sons of Dhritarashtra.

gita.Translation:
sañjaya uvāca.
evamukto hṛṣīkeśo guḍākeśena bhārata.
senayorubhayormadhye sthāpayitvā rathottamam -1-24-
gita.Explanation: Sanjaya said: Thus addressed by Gudakesha, O Bharata, Hrishikesha, having stationed the best of chariots between the two armies;

gita.Translation:
bhīṣmadroṇapramukhataḥ sarveṣāṃ ca mahīkṣitām.
uvāca pārtha paśyaitānsamavetānkurūniti -1-25-
gita.Explanation: In front of Bhishma and Drona, and all the rulers of the earth, he said, 'O Partha, behold these Kurus gathered together.

gita.Translation:
tatrāpaśyatsthitānpārthaḥ pitṝnatha pitāmahān.
ācāryānmātulānbhrātṛnputrānpautrānsakhīṃstathā -1-26-
gita.Explanation: Then Partha saw stationed there in both the armies, fathers, grandfathers, teachers, maternal uncles, brothers, sons, grandsons and friends too.

gita.Translation:
śvaśurānsuhṛdaścaiva senayorubhayorapi.
tānsamīkṣya sa kaunteyaḥ sarvānbandhūnavasthitān -1-27-
gita.Explanation: (He saw) Fathers-in-law and friends also in both the armies. Then the son of Kunti, seeing all these kinsmen thus standing arrayed, spoke thus sorrowfully, filled with deep pity.

gita.Translation:
kṛpayā parayāviṣṭo viṣīdannidamabravīt.
arjuna uvāca.
dṛṣṭvemaṃ svajanaṃ kṛṣṇa yuyutsuṃ samupasthitam -1-28-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said: Seeing these my kinsmen, O Krishna, arrayed, eager to fight,

gita.Line1: सीदन्ति मम गात्राणि मुखं च परिशुष्यति |
gita.Translation:
sīdanti mama gātrāṇi mukhaṃ ca pariśuṣyati.
vepathuśca śarīre me romaharṣaśca jāyate -1-29-
gita.Explanation: My limbs fail and my mouth is parched, my body quivers and my hair stands on end.

gita.Line2: न च शक्नोम्यवस्थातुं भ्रमतीव च मे मनः ||१-३०||
gita.Translation:
gāṇḍīvaṃ sraṃsate hastāttvakcaiva paridahyate.
na ca śaknomyavasthātuṃ bhramatīva ca me manaḥ -1-30-
gita.Explanation: The Gandiva-bow slips from my hand, and my skin burns all over; I am also unable to stand and my mind is whirling round, as it were.

gita.Translation:
nimittāni ca paśyāmi viparītāni keśava.
na ca śreyo.anupaśyāmi hatvā svajanamāhave -1-31-
gita.Explanation: And I see adverse omens, O Keshava. Nor do I see any good in killing my kinsmen in battle.

gita.Line1: न काङ्क्षे विजयं कृष्ण न च राज्यं सुखानि च |
gita.Line2: किं नो राज्येन गोविन्द किं भोगैर्जीवितेन वा ||१-३२||
gita.Translation:
na kāṅkṣe vijayaṃ kṛṣṇa na ca rājyaṃ sukhāni ca.
kiṃ no rājyena govinda kiṃ bhogairjīvitena vā -1-32-
gita.Explanation: For, I desire not victory, O Krishna, nor kingdom, nor pleasures. Of what avail is dominion to us, O Govinda? Of what avail are pleasures or even life itself?

gita.Line1: येषामर्थे काङ्क्षितं नो राज्यं भोगाः सुखानि च |
gita.Line2: त इमेऽवस्थिता युद्धे प्राणांस्त्यक्त्वा धनानि च ||१-३३||
gita.Translation:
yeṣāmarthe kāṅkṣitaṃ no rājyaṃ bhogāḥ sukhāni ca.
ta ime.avasthitā yuddhe prāṇāṃstyaktvā dhanāni ca -1-33-
gita.Explanation: They for whose sake we desire kingdom, enjoyment and pleasures stand here in battle, having renounced life and wealth.

gita.Translation:
ācāryāḥ pitaraḥ putrāstathaiva ca pitāmahāḥ.
mātulāḥ śvaśurāḥ pautrāḥ śyālāḥ sambandhinastathā -1-34-
gita.Explanation: Teachers, fathers, sons and also grandfathers, maternal uncles, fathers-in-law, grandsons, brothers-in-law and other relatives.

gita.Line2: अपि त्रैलोक्यराज्यस्य हेतोः किं नु महीकृते ||१-३५||
gita.Translation:
etānna hantumicchāmi ghnato.api madhusūdana.
api trailokyarājyasya hetoḥ kiṃ nu mahīkṛte -1-35-
gita.Explanation: These I do not wish to kill, though they kill me, O Madhusudana, even for the sake of dominion over the three worlds; how much less for the sake of the earth.

gita.Translation:
nihatya dhārtarāṣṭrānnaḥ kā prītiḥ syājjanārdana.
pāpamevāśrayedasmānhatvaitānātatāyinaḥ -1-36-
gita.Explanation: Killing these sons of Dhritarashtra, what pleasure can be ours, O Janardana? Sin alone will be our gain by killing these felons.

gita.Line2: स्वजनं हि कथं हत्वा सुखिनः स्याम माधव ||१-३७||
gita.Translation:
tasmānnārhā vayaṃ hantuṃ dhārtarāṣṭrānsvabāndhavān.
svajanaṃ hi kathaṃ hatvā sukhinaḥ syāma mādhava -1-37-
gita.Explanation: Therefore we shall not kill the sons of Dhritarashtra, our relatives; for how can we be happy by killing our own people, O Madhava?

gita.Translation:
yadyapyete na paśyanti lobhopahatacetasaḥ.
kulakṣayakṛtaṃ doṣaṃ mitradrohe ca pātakam -1-38-
gita.Explanation: Though these, with their intelligence clouded by greed, see no evil in the destruction of the families in the society, and no sin in their cruelty to friends.

gita.Translation:
kathaṃ na jñeyamasmābhiḥ pāpādasmānnivartitum.
kulakṣayakṛtaṃ doṣaṃ prapaśyadbhirjanārdana -1-39-
gita.Explanation: Why should not we, who clearly see evil in the destruction of the family-units, learn to turn away from this sin, O Janardana?

gita.Translation:
kulakṣaye praṇaśyanti kuladharmāḥ sanātanāḥ.
dharme naṣṭe kulaṃ kṛtsnamadharmo.abhibhavatyuta -1-40-
gita.Explanation: In the destruction of a family, the immemorial religious rites of that family perish; on the destruction of spirituality, impiety overcomes the whole family.

gita.Translation:
adharmābhibhavātkṛṣṇa praduṣyanti kulastriyaḥ.
strīṣu duṣṭāsu vārṣṇeya jāyate varṇasaṅkaraḥ -1-41-
gita.Explanation: By the prevalence of impiety, O Krishna, the women of the family become corrupt; and women being corrupted, O descendent of the Vrishni-clan, there arises intermingling of castes (VARNA-SAMKARA)

gita.Translation:
saṅkaro narakāyaiva kulaghnānāṃ kulasya ca.
patanti pitaro hyeṣāṃ luptapiṇḍodakakriyāḥ -1-42-
gita.Explanation: 'Confusion of castes' leads the slayer of the family to hell; for their forefathers fall, deprived of the offerings of PINDA (rice-ball) and water (libations).

gita.Translation:
doṣairetaiḥ kulaghnānāṃ varṇasaṅkarakārakaiḥ.
utsādyante jātidharmāḥ kuladharmāśca śāśvatāḥ -1-43-
gita.Explanation: By these evil deeds of the 'destroyers of the family, ' which cause confusion of castes, the eternal religious rites of the caste and the family are destroyed.

gita.Translation:
utsannakuladharmāṇāṃ manuṣyāṇāṃ janārdana.
narake niyataṃ vāso bhavatītyanuśuśruma -1-44-
gita.Explanation: We have heard, O Janardana, that it is inevitable for those men, in whose families the religious practices have been destroyed, to dwell in hell for an unknown period of time.

gita.Line1: अहो बत महत्पापं कर्तुं व्यवसिता वयम् |
gita.Translation:
aho bata mahatpāpaṃ kartuṃ vyavasitā vayam.
yadrājyasukhalobhena hantuṃ svajanamudyatāḥ -1-45-
gita.Explanation: Alas! We are involved in a great sin, in that we are prepared to kill our kinsmen, from greed for the pleasures of the kingdom.

gita.Translation:
yadi māmapratīkāramaśastraṃ śastrapāṇayaḥ.
dhārtarāṣṭrā raṇe hanyustanme kṣemataraṃ bhavet -1-46-
gita.Explanation: If the sons of Dhritarashtra, weapons-in-hand, slay me in battle, unresisting and unarmed, that would be better for me.

gita.Translation:
evamuktvārjunaḥ saṅkhye rathopastha upāviśat.
visṛjya saśaraṃ cāpaṃ śokasaṃvignamānasaḥ -1-47-
gita.Explanation: Having thus spoken in the midst of the battle-field, Arjuna sat down on the seat of the chariot, casting away his bow and arrow, with a mind distressed with sorrow.

gita.Translation:
OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu
brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde
arjunaviṣādayogo nāma prathamo.adhyāyaḥ -1-48-
gita.Explanation: Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA, in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the first discourse ends entitled: THE YOGA OF THE ARJUNA-GRIEF

gita.Translation:
sañjaya uvāca.
taṃ tathā kṛpayāviṣṭamaśrupūrṇākulekṣaṇam.
viṣīdantamidaṃ vākyamuvāca madhusūdanaḥ -2-1-
gita.Explanation: Sanjaya said: To him who was thus overcome with pity and despondency, with eyes full of tears and agitated, Madhusudana spoke these words.

gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
kutastvā kaśmalamidaṃ viṣame samupasthitam.
anāryajuṣṭamasvargyamakīrtikaramarjuna -2-2-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said:< 2. Whence is this perilous condition come upon thee, this dejection, un-Aryan-like, heaven-excluding, disgraceful, O Arjuna?

gita.Line1: क्लैब्यं मा स्म गमः पार्थ नैतत्त्वय्युपपद्यते |
gita.Translation:
klaibyaṃ mā sma gamaḥ pārtha naitattvayyupapadyate.
kṣudraṃ hṛdayadaurbalyaṃ tyaktvottiṣṭha parantapa -2-3-
gita.Explanation: Yield not to impotence, O Partha! It does not befit thee, Cast off this mean weakness of heart! Stand up, O Parantapa (O scorcher of foes) !

gita.Line2: कथं भीष्ममहं सङ्ख्ये द्रोणं च मधुसूदन |
gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.
kathaṃ bhīṣmamahaṃ saṅkhye droṇaṃ ca madhusūdana.
iṣubhiḥ pratiyotsyāmi pūjārhāvarisūdana -2-4-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said: How, O Madhusudana, shall I, in battle, fight with arrows against Bhishma and Drona, who are fit to be worshipped, O destroyer of enemies!

gita.Translation:
gurūnahatvā hi mahānubhāvān
śreyo bhoktuṃ bhaikṣyamapīha loke.
hatvārthakāmāṃstu gurūnihaiva
bhuñjīya bhogān rudhirapradigdhān -2-5-
gita.Explanation: Better indeed, in this world, is to eat even the bread of 'beggary' than to slay the most noble of teachers. But, if I kill them, even in this world, all my enjoyments of wealth and desires will be stained with blood.

gita.Line2: यद्वा जयेम यदि वा नो जयेयुः |
gita.Translation:
na caitadvidmaḥ kataranno
garīyo yadvā jayema yadi vā no jayeyuḥ.
yāneva hatvā na jijīviṣāmaḥ te.
avasthitāḥ pramukhe dhārtarāṣṭrāḥ -2-6-
gita.Explanation: I can scarcely say which will be better, that we should conquer them or that they should conquer us. Even the sons of Dhritarashtra, after slaying whom we do not wish to live, stand facing us.

gita.Translation:
kārpaṇyadoṣopahatasvabhāvaḥ
pṛcchāmi tvāṃ dharmasammūḍhacetāḥ.
yacchreyaḥ syānniścitaṃ brūhi tanme śiṣyaste.
ahaṃ śādhi māṃ tvāṃ prapannam -2-7-
gita.Explanation: My heart is overpowered by the taint of pity; my mind is confused as to duty. I ask Thee. Tell me decisively what is good for me. I am Thy disciple. Instruct me, who have taken refuge in Thee.

gita.Translation:
na hi prapaśyāmi mamāpanudyād
yacchokamucchoṣaṇamindriyāṇām.
avāpya bhūmāvasapatnamṛddhaṃ
rājyaṃ surāṇāmapi cādhipatyam -2-8-
gita.Explanation: I do not see that it would remove this sorrow that burns up my senses, even if I should attain prosperous and unrivalled dominion on earth, or even Lordship over the gods.

gita.Line3: न योत्स्य इति गोविन्दमुक्त्वा तूष्णीं बभूव ह ||२-९||
gita.Translation:
sañjaya uvāca.
evamuktvā hṛṣīkeśaṃ guḍākeśaḥ parantapaḥ.
na yotsya iti govindamuktvā tūṣṇīṃ babhūva ha -2-9-
gita.Explanation: Sanjaya said: Having spoken thus to Hrishikesha, Gudakesha, the destroyer of foes, said to Govinda I will not fight; and became silent.

gita.Translation:
tamuvāca hṛṣīkeśaḥ prahasanniva bhārata.
senayorubhayormadhye viṣīdantamidaṃ vacaḥ -2-10-
gita.Explanation: To him who was despondent in the midst of the two armies, Hrishikesha, as if smiling, O Bharata, spoke these words.

gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
aśocyānanvaśocastvaṃ prajñāvādāṃśca bhāṣase.
gatāsūnagatāsūṃśca nānuśocanti paṇḍitāḥ -2-11-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said:You have grieved for those that should not be grieved for; yet, you speak words of wisdom. The wise grieve neither for the living nor for the dead.

gita.Line1: न त्वेवाहं जातु नासं न त्वं नेमे जनाधिपाः |
gita.Line2: न चैव न भविष्यामः सर्वे वयमतः परम् ||२-१२||
gita.Translation:
na tvevāhaṃ jātu nāsaṃ na tvaṃ neme janādhipāḥ.
na caiva na bhaviṣyāmaḥ sarve vayamataḥ param -2-12-
gita.Explanation: It is not that at any time (in the past) , indeed, was I not, nor were you, nor these rulers of men. Nor, verily, shall we all ever cease to be hereafter.

gita.Translation:
dehino.asminyathā dehe kaumāraṃ yauvanaṃ jarā.
tathā dehāntaraprāptirdhīrastatra na muhyati -2-13-
gita.Explanation: Just as in this body the embodied (soul) passes into childhood, youth and old age, so also does he pass into another body; the firm man does not grieve at it.

gita.Translation:
mātrāsparśāstu kaunteya śītoṣṇasukhaduḥkhadāḥ.
āgamāpāyino.anityāstāṃstitikṣasva bhārata -2-14-
gita.Explanation: The contacts of senses with objects, O son of Kunti, which cause heat and cold, pleasure and pain, have a beginning and an end; they are impermanent; endure them bravely, O descendant of Bharata.

gita.Line1: यं हि न व्यथयन्त्येते पुरुषं पुरुषर्षभ |
gita.Translation:
yaṃ hi na vyathayantyete puruṣaṃ puruṣarṣabha.
samaduḥkhasukhaṃ dhīraṃ so.amṛtatvāya kalpate -2-15-
gita.Explanation: That firm man whom, surely, these afflict not, O chief among men, to whom pleasure and pain are the same, is fit for realising the Immortality of the Self.

gita.Line1: नासतो विद्यते भावो नाभावो विद्यते सतः |
gita.Translation:
nāsato vidyate bhāvo nābhāvo vidyate sataḥ.
ubhayorapi dṛṣṭo.antastvanayostattvadarśibhiḥ -2-16-
gita.Explanation: The unreal has no being; there is no non-being of the Real; the truth about both these has been seen by the Knowers of the Truth (or the Seers of the Essence).

gita.Line1: अविनाशि तु तद्विद्धि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् |
gita.Translation:
avināśi tu tadviddhi yena sarvamidaṃ tatam.
vināśamavyayasyāsya na kaścitkartumarhati -2-17-
gita.Explanation: Know That to be Indestructible by which all this is pervaded. None can cause the destruction of That --- the Imperishable.

gita.Translation:
antavanta ime dehā nityasyoktāḥ śarīriṇaḥ.
anāśino.aprameyasya tasmādyudhyasva bhārata -2-18-
gita.Explanation: They have an end, it is said, these bodies of the embodied-Self. The Self is Eternal, Indestructible, Incomprehensible. Therefore, fight, O Bharata.

gita.Line1: य एनं वेत्ति हन्तारं यश्चैनं मन्यते हतम् |
gita.Line2: उभौ तौ न विजानीतो नायं हन्ति न हन्यते ||२-१९||
gita.Translation:
ya enaṃ vetti hantāraṃ yaścainaṃ manyate hatam
ubhau tau na vijānīto nāyaṃ hanti na hanyate -2-19-
gita.Explanation: He who takes the Self to be the slayer and he who thinks He is slain, neither of these knows. He slays not, nor in He slain.

gita.Line2: नायं भूत्वा भविता वा न भूयः |
gita.Translation:
na jāyate mriyate vā kadācin
nāyaṃ bhūtvā bhavitā vā na bhūyaḥ.
ajo nityaḥ śāśvato.
ayaṃ purāṇo na hanyate hanyamāne śarīre -2-20-
gita.Explanation: He is not born, nor does He ever die; after having been, He again ceases not to be; Unborn, Eternal, Changeless and Ancient, He is not killed when the body is killed.

gita.Line2: कथं स पुरुषः पार्थ कं घातयति हन्ति कम् ||२-२१||
gita.Translation:
vedāvināśinaṃ nityaṃ ya enamajamavyayam.
kathaṃ sa puruṣaḥ pārtha kaṃ ghātayati hanti kam -2-21-
gita.Explanation: Whosoever knows Him to be Indestructible, Eternal, Unborn, and Inexhaustible, how can that man slay, O Partha, or cause others to be slain?

gita.Translation:
vāsāṃsi jīrṇāni yathā vihāya
navāni gṛhṇāti naro.aparāṇi.
tathā śarīrāṇi vihāya jīrṇāni
anyāni saṃyāti navāni dehī -2-22-
gita.Explanation: Just as a man casts off his worn out clothes and puts on new ones, so also the embodied-Self casts off its worn out bodies and enters others which are new.

gita.Line1: नैनं छिन्दन्ति शस्त्राणि नैनं दहति पावकः |
gita.Line2: न चैनं क्लेदयन्त्यापो न शोषयति मारुतः ||२-२३||
gita.Translation:
nainaṃ chindanti śastrāṇi nainaṃ dahati pāvakaḥ.
na cainaṃ kledayantyāpo na śoṣayati mārutaḥ -2-23-
gita.Explanation: Weapons cleave It not, fire burns It not, water moistens It not, wind dries It not.

gita.Translation:
acchedyo.ayamadāhyo.ayamakledyo.aśoṣya eva ca.
nityaḥ sarvagataḥ sthāṇuracalo.ayaṃ sanātanaḥ -2-24-
gita.Explanation: This Self cannot be cut, nor burnt, nor moistened, nor dried up. It is eternal, all-pervading, stable immovable and ancient.

gita.Translation:
avyakto.ayamacintyo.ayamavikāryo.ayamucyate.
tasmādevaṃ viditvainaṃ nānuśocitumarhasi -2-25-
gita.Explanation: This (Self) is said to be Unmanifest, Unthinkable and Unchangeable. Therefore, knowing This to be such, you should not grieve.

gita.Line1: अथ चैनं नित्यजातं नित्यं वा मन्यसे मृतम् |
gita.Translation:
avyakto.ayamacintyo.ayamavikāryo.ayamucyate.
tasmādevaṃ viditvainaṃ nānuśocitumarhasi -2-25-
gita.Explanation: But even if you think of Him as being constantly born and constantly dying, even then, O mighty-armed, you should not grieve.

gita.Line1: जातस्य हि ध्रुवो मृत्युर्ध्रुवं जन्म मृतस्य च |
gita.Translation:
jātasya hi dhruvo mṛtyurdhruvaṃ janma mṛtasya ca.
tasmādaparihārye.arthe na tvaṃ śocitumarhasi -2-27-
gita.Explanation: Indeed, certain is death for the born, and certain is birth for the dead; therefore, over the inevitable, you should not grieve.

gita.Translation:
avyaktādīni bhūtāni vyaktamadhyāni bhārata.
avyaktanidhanānyeva tatra kā paridevanā -2-28-
gita.Explanation: Beings unmanifest in the beginning, and unmanifest again in their end seem to be manifest in the middle, O Bharata. What then is there to grieve about?

gita.Translation:
āścaryavatpaśyati kaścidenam
āścaryavadvadati tathaiva cānyaḥ.
āścaryavaccainamanyaḥ śṛṇoti
śrutvāpyenaṃ veda na caiva kaścit -2-29-
gita.Explanation: One sees This as a wonder; another speaks of This as a wonder; another hears of This as a wonder; yet, having heard none understands This at all!

gita.Translation:
dehī nityamavadhyo.ayaṃ dehe sarvasya bhārata.
tasmātsarvāṇi bhūtāni na tvaṃ śocitumarhasi -2-30-
gita.Explanation: This, the Indweller in the body of everyone is ever indestructible, O Bharata; and, therefore, you should not grieve for any creature.

gita.Translation:
svadharmamapi cāvekṣya na vikampitumarhasi.
dharmyāddhi yuddhācchreyo.anyatkṣatriyasya na vidyate -2-31-
gita.Explanation: Those men who constantly practice this teaching of Mine, full of faith and without caviling, they too are freed from actions.

gita.Translation:
syadṛcchayā copapannaṃ svargadvāramapāvṛtam.
sukhinaḥ kṣatriyāḥ pārtha labhante yuddhamīdṛśam -2-32-
gita.Explanation: Happy indeed are the KSHATRIYAS, O Partha, who are called to fight in such a battle, that comes of itself as an open-door to heaven.

gita.Line1: अथ चेत्त्वमिमं धर्म्यं संग्रामं न करिष्यसि |
gita.Line2: ततः स्वधर्मं कीर्तिं च हित्वा पापमवाप्स्यसि ||२-३३||
gita.Translation:
atha cettvamimaṃ dharmyaṃ saṃgrāmaṃ na kariṣyasi.
tataḥ svadharmaṃ kīrtiṃ ca hitvā pāpamavāpsyasi -2-33-
gita.Explanation: But, if you will not fight this righteous },, then, having abandoned your own duty and fame, you shall incur sin.

gita.Translation:
akīrtiṃ cāpi bhūtāni kathayiṣyanti te.avyayām.
sambhāvitasya cākīrtirmaraṇādatiricyate -2-34-
gita.Explanation: People too, will recount your everlasting dishonour; and to one who has been honoured, dishonour is more than death.

gita.Line2: येषां च त्वं बहुमतो भूत्वा यास्यसि लाघवम् ||२-३५||
gita.Translation:
bhayādraṇāduparataṃ maṃsyante tvāṃ mahārathāḥ.
yeṣāṃ ca tvaṃ bahumato bhūtvā yāsyasi lāghavam -2-35-
gita.Explanation: The great battalion commanders will think that you have withdrawn from the battle through fear; and you will be looked down upon by them who had thought much of you and your heroism in the past.

gita.Line2: निन्दन्तस्तव सामर्थ्यं ततो दुःखतरं नु किम् ||२-३६||
gita.Translation:
avācyavādāṃśca bahūnvadiṣyanti tavāhitāḥ.
nindantastava sāmarthyaṃ tato duḥkhataraṃ nu kim -2-36-
gita.Explanation: And many unspeakable words will your enemies speak cavilling about your powers. What can be more painful than this?

gita.Line1: हतो वा प्राप्स्यसि स्वर्गं जित्वा वा भोक्ष्यसे महीम् |
gita.Translation:
hato vā prāpsyasi svargaṃ jitvā vā bhokṣyase mahīm.
tasmāduttiṣṭha kaunteya yuddhāya kṛtaniścayaḥ -2-37-
gita.Explanation: Slain, you will obtain heaven; victorious you will enjoy the earth; therefore, stand up, O son of Kunti, determined to fight.

gita.Translation:
sukhaduḥkhe same kṛtvā lābhālābhau jayājayau.
tato yuddhāya yujyasva naivaṃ pāpamavāpsyasi -2-38-
gita.Explanation: Having made --- pleasure and pain, gain and loss, victory and defeat --- the same, engage in battle for the sake of battle; thus you shall not incur sin.

gita.Line1: एषा तेऽभिहिता साङ्ख्ये बुद्धिर्योगे त्विमां शृणु |
gita.Line2: बुद्ध्या युक्तो यया पार्थ कर्मबन्धं प्रहास्यसि ||२-३९||
gita.Translation:
eṣā te.abhihitā sāṅkhye buddhiryoge tvimāṃ śṛṇu.
buddhyā yukto yayā pārtha karmabandhaṃ prahāsyasi -2-39-
gita.Explanation: This, which has been taught to thee, is wisdom concerning SANKHYA. Now listen to the wisdom concerning YOGA, having known which, O Partha, you shall cast off the bonds-of-action.

gita.Translation:
nehābhikramanāśo.asti pratyavāyo na vidyate.
svalpamapyasya dharmasya trāyate mahato bhayāt -2-40-
gita.Explanation:
In this there is no loss of effort, nor is there any harm (production of contrary results).
Even a little of this knowledge, even a little practice of the YOGA, protects one from the great fear.

gita.Translation:
vyavasāyātmikā buddhirekeha kurunandana.
bahuśākhā hyanantāśca buddhayo.avyavasāyinām -2-41-
gita.Explanation: Here, O Joy of the Kurus, Kurunandana, there is but a single-pointed determination; many-branched and endless are the thoughts of the irresolute.

gita.Translation:
yāmimāṃ puṣpitāṃ vācaṃ pravadantyavipaścitaḥ.
vedavādaratāḥ pārtha nānyadastīti vādinaḥ -2-42-
gita.Explanation: Flowery speech is uttered by the unwise, taking pleasure in the eulogising words of VEDAS, O Partha, saying, There is nothing else.

gita.Translation:
kāmātmānaḥ svargaparā janmakarmaphalapradām.
kriyāviśeṣabahulāṃ bhogaiśvaryagatiṃ prati -2-43-
gita.Explanation: Full of desires, having heaven as their goal, they utter flowery words, which promise new birth as the reward of their actions, and prescribe various specific actions for the attainment of pleasure and Lordship.

gita.Translation:
bhogaiśvaryaprasaktānāṃ tayāpahṛtacetasām.
vyavasāyātmikā buddhiḥ samādhau na vidhīyate -2-44-
gita.Explanation: For, those who cling to joy and Lordship, whose minds are drawn away by such teaching, are neither determinate and resolute nor are they fit for steady meditation and SAMADHI.

gita.Translation:
traiguṇyaviṣayā vedā nistraiguṇyo bhavārjuna.
nirdvandvo nityasattvastho niryogakṣema ātmavān -2-45-
gita.Explanation: The VEDAS deal with the three attributes; be you above these three attributes (GUNAS) , O Arjuna, free yourself from the pairs-of-opposites, and ever remain in the SATTWA (goodness) , freed from all thoughts of acquisition and preservation, and be established in the Self.

gita.Translation:
tyāvānartha udapāne sarvataḥ samplutodake.
tāvānsarveṣu vedeṣu brāhmaṇasya vijānataḥ -2-46-
gita.Explanation: To the BRAHMANA who has known the Self, all the VEDAS are of so much use, as is a reservoir of water in a place where there is flood everywhere.

gita.Translation:
karmaṇyevādhikāraste mā phaleṣu kadācana.
mā karmaphalaheturbhūrmā te saṅgo.astvakarmaṇi -2-47-
gita.Explanation: Thy right is to work only, but never to its fruits; let not the fruit-of-action be thy motive, nor let thy attachment be to inaction.

gita.Line1: योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ्जय |
gita.Line2: सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योः समो भूत्वा समत्वं योग उच्यते ||२-४८||
gita.Translation:
yogasthaḥ kuru karmāṇi saṅgaṃ tyaktvā dhanañjaya.
siddhyasiddhyoḥ samo bhūtvā samatvaṃ yoga ucyate -2-48-
gita.Explanation: Perform action, O Dhananjaya, abandoning attachment, being steadfast in YOGA, and balanced in success and failure. Evenness of mind is called YOGA.

gita.Translation:
dūreṇa hyavaraṃ karma buddhiyogāddhanañjaya.
buddhau śaraṇamanviccha kṛpaṇāḥ phalahetavaḥ -2-49-
gita.Explanation: Far lower than the YOGA -of-wisdom is action, O Dhananjaya. Seek thou refuge in wisdom; wretched are they whose motive is the fruit.

gita.Translation:
buddhiyukto jahātīha ubhe sukṛtaduṣkṛte.
tasmādyogāya yujyasva yogaḥ karmasu kauśalam -2-50-
gita.Explanation: Endowed with the Wisdom of evenness-of-mind, one casts off in this life both good deeds and evil deeds; therefore, devote yourself to YOGA, Skill in action is YOGA.

gita.Line1: कर्मजं बुद्धियुक्ता हि फलं त्यक्त्वा मनीषिणः |
gita.Translation:
karmajaṃ buddhiyuktā hi phalaṃ tyaktvā manīṣiṇaḥ.
janmabandhavinirmuktāḥ padaṃ gacchantyanāmayam -2-51-
gita.Explanation: The wise, possessed of knowledge, having abandoned the fruits of their actions, freed from the fetters of birth, go to the State which is beyond all evil.

gita.Line2: तदा गन्तासि निर्वेदं श्रोतव्यस्य श्रुतस्य च ||२-५२||
gita.Translation:
yadā te mohakalilaṃ buddhirvyatitariṣyati.
tadā gantāsi nirvedaṃ śrotavyasya śrutasya ca -2-52-
gita.Explanation: When your intellect crosses beyond the mire of delusion, then you shall attain to indifference as to what has been heard and what is yet to be heard.

gita.Translation:
śrutivipratipannā te yadā sthāsyati niścalā.
samādhāvacalā buddhistadā yogamavāpsyasi -2-53-
gita.Explanation: When your intellect, though perplexed by what you have heard, shall stand immovable and steady in the Self, then you shall attain Self-realisation.

gita.Line3: स्थितधीः किं प्रभाषेत किमासीत व्रजेत किम् ||२-५४||
gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.
sthitaprajñasya kā bhāṣā samādhisthasya keśava.
sthitadhīḥ kiṃ prabhāṣeta kimāsīta vrajeta kim -2-54-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said:What, O Keshava, is the description of him who has steady Wisdom and who is merged in the Superconscious state? How does one of steady Wisdom speak, how does he sit, how does he walk?

gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
prajahāti yadā kāmānsarvānpārtha manogatān.
ātmanyevātmanā tuṣṭaḥ sthitaprajñastadocyate -2-55-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said:When a man completely casts off, O Partha, all the desires of the mind, and is satisfied in the Self by the Self, then is he said to be one of steady Wisdom.

gita.Translation:
duḥkheṣvanudvignamanāḥ sukheṣu vigataspṛhaḥ.
vītarāgabhayakrodhaḥ sthitadhīrmunirucyate -2-56-
gita.Explanation: He whose mind is not shaken by adversity, and who in prosperity does not hanker after pleasures, who is free from attachment, fear and anger, is called a Sage-of-Steady-Wisdom.

gita.Line2: नाभिनन्दति न द्वेष्टि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ||२-५७||
gita.Translation:
yaḥ sarvatrānabhisnehastattatprāpya śubhāśubham.
nābhinandati na dveṣṭi tasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā -2-57-
gita.Explanation: He who is everywhere without attachment, on meeting with anything good or bad, who neither rejoices nor hates, his Wisdom is fixed.

gita.Translation:
yadā saṃharate cāyaṃ kūrmo.aṅgānīva sarvaśaḥ.
indriyāṇīndriyārthebhyastasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā -2-58-
gita.Explanation: When, like the tortoise which withdraws its limbs from all sides, he withdraws his senses from the sense-objects then his Wisdom becomes steady.

gita.Translation:
viṣayā vinivartante nirāhārasya dehinaḥ.
rasavarjaṃ raso.apyasya paraṃ dṛṣṭvā nivartate -2-59-
gita.Explanation: The objects of the senses turn away from the abstinent man leaving the longing (behind) ; but his longing also leaves him on seeing the Supreme.

gita.Translation:
yatato hyapi kaunteya puruṣasya vipaścitaḥ.
indriyāṇi pramāthīni haranti prasabhaṃ manaḥ -2-60-
gita.Explanation: The turbulent senses, O son of Kunti, do violently carry away the mind of a wise-man, though he be striving (to control them).

gita.Line1: तानि सर्वाणि संयम्य युक्त आसीत मत्परः |
gita.Line2: वशे हि यस्येन्द्रियाणि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ||२-६१||
gita.Translation:
tāni sarvāṇi saṃyamya yukta āsīta matparaḥ.
vaśe hi yasyendriyāṇi tasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā -2-61-
gita.Explanation: Having restrained them all, he should sit steadfast, intent on Me; his Wisdom is steady, whose senses are under control.

gita.Translation:
dhyāyato viṣayānpuṃsaḥ saṅgasteṣūpajāyate.
saṅgātsañjāyate kāmaḥ kāmātkrodho.abhijāyate -2-62-
gita.Explanation: When a man thinks of objects, 'attachment' for them arises; from attachment 'desire' is born; from desire arises 'anger'.

gita.Translation:
krodhādbhavati sammohaḥ sammohātsmṛtivibhramaḥ.
smṛtibhraṃśād buddhināśo buddhināśātpraṇaśyati -2-63-
gita.Explanation: From anger comes 'delusion' ; from delusion 'loss of memory' ; from loss of memory the 'destruction of discrimination' ; from destruction of discrimination, he 'perishes'.

gita.Translation:
rāgadveṣavimuktaistu viṣayānindriyaiścaran.
orviyuktaistu ātmavaśyairvidheyātmā prasādamadhigacchati -2-64-
gita.Explanation: But the self-controlled man, moving among objects, with his senses under restraint, and free from both attraction and repulsion, attains peace.

gita.Translation:
prasāde sarvaduḥkhānāṃ hānirasyopajāyate.
prasannacetaso hyāśu buddhiḥ paryavatiṣṭhate -2-65-
gita.Explanation: In that peace all pains are destroyed; for, the intellect of the tranquil-minded soon becomes steady.

gita.Translation:
nāsti buddhirayuktasya na cāyuktasya bhāvanā.
na cābhāvayataḥ śāntiraśāntasya kutaḥ sukham -2-66-
gita.Explanation: There is no knowledge (of the Self) to the unsteady; and to the unsteady no meditation; and to the unmeditative no peace; to the peaceless, how can there be happiness?

gita.Translation: indriyāṇāṃ hi caratāṃ yanmano.anuvidhīyate.tadasya harati prajñāṃ vāyurnāvamivāmbhasi -2-67-
gita.Explanation: For, the mind, which follows in the wake of the wandering senses, carries away his discrimination, as the wind carries away a boat on the waters.

gita.Translation:
tasmādyasya mahābāho nigṛhītāni sarvaśaḥ.
indriyāṇīndriyārthebhyastasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā -2-68-
gita.Explanation: Therefore, O Mighty-armed, his knowledge is steady whose senses are completely restrained from sense-objects.

gita.Line1: या निशा सर्वभूतानां तस्यां जागर्ति संयमी |
gita.Line2: यस्यां जाग्रति भूतानि सा निशा पश्यतो मुनेः ||२-६९||
gita.Translation:
yā niśā sarvabhūtānāṃ tasyāṃ jāgarti saṃyamī.
yasyāṃ jāgrati bhūtāni sā niśā paśyato muneḥ -2-69-
gita.Explanation: That which is night to all beings, in that the self-controlled man keeps awake; where all beings are awake, that is the night for the Sage (MUNI) who sees.

gita.Translation:
āpūryamāṇamacalapratiṣṭhaṃ samudramāpaḥ praviśanti yadvat.
tadvatkāmā yaṃ praviśanti sarve sa śāntimāpnoti na kāmakāmī -2-70-
gita.Explanation: He attains Peace into whom all desires enter as waters enter the ocean, which, filled from all sides, remains unmoved; but not the 'desirer of desires'.

gita.Translation:
vihāya kāmānyaḥ sarvānpumāṃścarati niḥspṛhaḥ.
nirmamo nirahaṅkāraḥ sa śāntimadhigacchati -2-71-
gita.Explanation: That man attains peace who, abandoning all desires, moves about without longing, without the sense of 'l-ness' and 'my-ness. '

gita.Line1: एषा ब्राह्मी स्थितिः पार्थ नैनां प्राप्य विमुह्यति |
gita.Translation:
eṣā brāhmī sthitiḥ pārtha naināṃ prāpya vimuhyati.
sthitvāsyāmantakāle.api brahmanirvāṇamṛcchati -2-72-
gita.Explanation: This is the BRAHMIC -state, O Son of Pritha. Attaining this, none is deluded. Being established therein, even at the end of life, one attains to oneness with BRAHMAN.

gita.Translation: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde sāṅkhyayogo nāma dvitīyo.adhyāyaḥ -2-73-
gita.Explanation: Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA, in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the second discourse ends entitled: THE YOGA OF KNOWLEDGE

gita.Line3: तत्किं कर्मणि घोरे मां नियोजयसि केशव ||३-१||
gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.
jyāyasī cetkarmaṇaste matā buddhirjanārdana.
tatkiṃ karmaṇi ghore māṃ niyojayasi keśava -3-1-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said:If it be thought by you that 'knowledge' is superior to 'action, ' O Janardana, why then, do you, O Kashava, engage me in this terrible action?

gita.Translation:
vyāmiśreṇeva vākyena buddhiṃ mohayasīva me.
tadekaṃ vada niścitya yena śreyo.ahamāpnuyām -3-2-
gita.Explanation: "With this apparently perplexing speech you confuse, as it were, my understanding; therefore, tell me that "one" way by which, I, for certain, may attain the Highest."

gita.Line2: लोकेऽस्मिन् द्विविधा निष्ठा पुरा प्रोक्ता मयानघ |
gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
loke.asmina dvividhā niṣṭhā purā proktā mayānagha.
jñānayogena sāṅkhyānāṃ karmayogena yoginām -3-3-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said :In this world there is a two-fold path, as I said before, O sinless one; the 'Path-of-Knowledge' of the SANKHYANS and the 'Path-of-Action' of the YOGINS.

gita.Translation:
na karmaṇāmanārambhānnaiṣkarmyaṃ puruṣo.aśnute.
na ca saṃnyasanādeva siddhiṃ samadhigacchati -3-4-
gita.Explanation: Not by non-performance of actions does man reach 'actionlessness' ; nor by mere renunciation does he attain 'Perfection'.

gita.Translation:
na hi kaścitkṣaṇamapi jātu tiṣṭhatyakarmakṛt.
kāryate hyavaśaḥ karma sarvaḥ prakṛtijairguṇaiḥ -3-5-
gita.Explanation: Verily, none can ever remain, even for a moment, without performing action; for, everyone is made to act helplessly, indeed, by the qualities born of PRAKRITI.

gita.Line1: कर्मेन्द्रियाणि संयम्य य आस्ते मनसा स्मरन् |
gita.Translation:
karmendriyāṇi saṃyamya ya āste manasā smaran.
indriyārthānvimūḍhātmā mithyācāraḥ sa ucyate -3-6-
gita.Explanation: VHe who, restraining the organs-of-action, sits thinking in his mind of the sense-objects, he, of deluded understanding, is called a hypocrite

gita.Translation:
yastvindriyāṇi manasā niyamyārabhate.arjuna.
karmendriyaiḥ karmayogamasaktaḥ sa viśiṣyate -3-7-
gita.Explanation: But, whosoever, controlling the senses by the mind, O Arjuna, engages his organs-of-action in KARMA YOGA, without attachment, he excels.

gita.Line1: नियतं कुरु कर्म त्वं कर्म ज्यायो ह्यकर्मणः |
gita.Translation:
niyataṃ kuru karma tvaṃ karma jyāyo hyakarmaṇaḥ.
śarīrayātrāpi ca te na prasiddhyedakarmaṇaḥ -3-8-
gita.Explanation: You perform (your) bounden duty; for, action is superior to inaction. Even the maintenance of the body would not be possible for you by inaction.

gita.Translation:
yajñārthātkarmaṇo.anyatra loko.ayaṃ karmabandhanaḥ.
tadarthaṃ karma kaunteya muktasaṅgaḥ samācara -3-9-
gita.Explanation: The World is bound by action other than those performed 'for the sake of sacrifice' ; do thou, therefore, O son of Kunti, perform action of that sake (for YAJNA ) alone, free from all attachments.

gita.Translation:
sahayajñāḥ prajāḥ sṛṣṭvā purovāca prajāpatiḥ.
anena prasaviṣyadhvameṣa vo.astviṣṭakāmadhuk -3-10-
gita.Explanation: The PRAJAPATI (the Creator) , having in the beginning (of creation) created mankind, together with sacrifices, said, 'by this shall you prosper; let this be the milch-cow of your desire --- 'KAMADHUK' (the mythological cow which yields all desired objects).

gita.Translation:
devānbhāvayatānena te devā bhāvayantu vaḥ.
parasparaṃ bhāvayantaḥ śreyaḥ paramavāpsyatha -3-11-
gita.Explanation: With this, you do nourish the gods and may those DEVAS nourish you; thus nourishing one another, you shall, attain the Highest Good.

gita.Line2: तैर्दत्तानप्रदायैभ्यो यो भुङ्क्ते स्तेन एव सः ||३-१२||
gita.Translation:
iṣṭānbhogānhi vo devā dāsyante yajñabhāvitāḥ.
tairdattānapradāyaibhyo yo bhuṅkte stena eva saḥ -3-12-
gita.Explanation: The DEVAS , nourished by the sacrifice, will give you the desired objects. Indeed he who enjoys objects, given by the DEVAS , without offering (in return) to them, is verily a thief.

gita.Line2: भुञ्जते ते त्वघं पापा ये पचन्त्यात्मकारणात् ||३-१३||
gita.Translation:
yajñaśiṣṭāśinaḥ santo mucyante sarvakilbiṣaiḥ.
bhuñjate te tvaghaṃ pāpā ye pacantyātmakāraṇāt -3-13-
gita.Explanation: The righteous, who eat the 'remnants of the sacrifices' are freed from all sins; but those sinful ones, who cook food (only) for their own sake, verily eat but sin.

gita.Translation:
annādbhavanti bhūtāni parjanyādannasambhavaḥ.
yajñādbhavati parjanyo yajñaḥ karmasamudbhavaḥ -3-14-
gita.Explanation: From food come forth beings; from rain food is produced; from sacrifice arises rain, and sacrifice is born of action.

gita.Translation:
karma brahmodbhavaṃ viddhi brahmākṣarasamudbhavam.
tasmātsarvagataṃ brahma nityaṃ yajñe pratiṣṭhitam -3-15-
gita.Explanation: Know you that action comes from BRAHMAJI (the creator) and BRAHMAJI come from the Imperishable. Therefore, the all-pervading BRAHMAN (God-principle) ever rests in sacrifice.

gita.Translation:
evaṃ pravartitaṃ cakraṃ nānuvartayatīha yaḥ.
aghāyurindriyārāmo moghaṃ pārtha sa jīvati -3-16-
gita.Explanation: He who does not follow here the wheel thus set revolving, is of a sinful life, rejoicing in the senses. He lives in vain, O Son of Pritha.

gita.Line2: आत्मन्येव च सन्तुष्टस्तस्य कार्यं न विद्यते ||३-१७||
gita.Translation:
yastvātmaratireva syādātmatṛptaśca mānavaḥ.
ātmanyeva ca santuṣṭastasya kāryaṃ na vidyate -3-17-
gita.Explanation: But the man who rejoices only in the Self, who is satisfied with the Self, who is content in the Self alone, for Him verily there is nothing (more) to be done.

gita.Translation:
naiva tasya kṛtenārtho nākṛteneha kaścana.
na cāsya sarvabhūteṣu kaścidarthavyapāśrayaḥ -3-18-
gita.Explanation: For him there is here no interest whatever in what is done, or what is not done; nor does he depend upon any being for any object.

gita.Translation:
tasmādasaktaḥ satataṃ kāryaṃ karma samācara.
asakto hyācarankarma paramāpnoti pūruṣaḥ -3-19-
gita.Explanation: Therefore, always perform actions which should be done, without attachment; for, by performing action without attachment, man attains the Supreme.

gita.Translation:
karmaṇaiva hi saṃsiddhimāsthitā janakādayaḥ.
lokasaṃgrahamevāpi sampaśyankartumarhasi -3-20-
gita.Explanation: Janaka and others attained Perfection verily by action only; even with a view to protecting the masses you should perform action.

gita.Translation:
yadyadācarati śreṣṭhastattadevetaro janaḥ.
sa yatpramāṇaṃ kurute lokastadanuvartate -3-21-
gita.Explanation: Whatever a great man does, that other men also do (imitate) ; whatever he sets up as the standard, that the world (people) follows.

gita.Line1: न मे पार्थास्ति कर्तव्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु किञ्चन |
gita.Translation:
na me pārthāsti kartavyaṃ triṣu lokeṣu kiñcana.
nānavāptamavāptavyaṃ varta eva ca karmaṇi -3-22-
gita.Explanation: There is nothing in the three worlds, O Partha, that has to be done by Me, nor is there anything unattained that should be attained by Me; yet, I engage Myself in action.

gita.Line1: यदि ह्यहं न वर्तेयं जातु कर्मण्यतन्द्रितः |
gita.Translation:
yadi hyahaṃ na varteyaṃ jātu karmaṇyatandritaḥ.
mama vartmānuvartante manuṣyāḥ pārtha sarvaśaḥ -3-23-
gita.Explanation: For, should I not ever engage Myself in action, without relaxation, men would in every way follow My Path, O son of Pritha.

gita.Line1: उत्सीदेयुरिमे लोका न कुर्यां कर्म चेदहम् |
gita.Translation:
utsīdeyurime lokā na kuryāṃ karma cedaham.
saṅkarasya ca kartā syāmupahanyāmimāḥ prajāḥ -3-24-
gita.Explanation: These worlds would perish if I did not perform action; I would be the author of confusion of 'castes',and would destroy these beings.

gita.Translation:
aktāḥ karmaṇyavidvāṃso yathā kurvanti bhārata.
kuryādvidvāṃstathāsaktaścikīrṣurlokasaṃgraham -3-25-
gita.Explanation: "As the 'ignorant' men act from attachment to action, O Bharata, so should the "wise" men act without attachment, wishing the welfare of the world."

gita.Translation:
na buddhibhedaṃ janayedajñānāṃ karmasaṅginām.
joṣayetsarvakarmāṇi vidvānyuktaḥ samācaran -3-26-
gita.Explanation: Let no wise-man unsettle the minds of ignorant-people, who are attached to action; he should engage them in all actions, himself fulfilling them with devotion.

gita.Translation: ahaṅkāravimūḍhātmā kartāhamiti manyate -3-27-
gita.Explanation:
All actions are performed, in all cases, merely by the Qualities-in-Nature (GUNAS ).
He whose mind is deluded by egoism, thinks 'I am the doer'.

gita.Line2: गुणा गुणेषु वर्तन्त इति मत्वा न सज्जते ||३-२८||
gita.Translation:
tattvavittu mahābāho guṇakarmavibhāgayoḥ.
guṇā guṇeṣu vartanta iti matvā na sajjate -3-28-
gita.Explanation: But he --- who knows the Truth, O mighty-armed, about the divisions of the qualities and (their) functions, and he who knows that GUNAS -as-senses move amidst GUNAS -as-objects, is not attached.

gita.Translation:
prakṛterguṇasammūḍhāḥ sajjante guṇakarmasu.
tānakṛtsnavido mandānkṛtsnavinna vicālayet -3-29-
gita.Explanation: Those deluded by the qualities of nature, (GUNAS) , are attached to the functions of the qualities. The Man-of-Perfect-Knowledge should not unsettle the 'foolish, ' who are of imperfect knowledge.

gita.Translation:
mayi sarvāṇi karmāṇi saṃnyasyādhyātmacetasā.
nirāśīrnirmamo bhūtvā yudhyasva vigatajvaraḥ -3-30-
gita.Explanation: Renouncing all actions in Me, with the mind centered on the Self, free from hope and egoism (ownership) , free from (mental) fever, (you) do fight!

gita.Translation:
ye me matamidaṃ nityamanutiṣṭhanti mānavāḥ.
śraddhāvanto.anasūyanto mucyante te.api karmabhiḥ -3-31-
gita.Explanation: Those men who constantly practise this teaching of Mine, full of faith and without cavilling, they too are freed from actions.

gita.Translation:
ye tvetadabhyasūyanto nānutiṣṭhanti me matam.
sarvajñānavimūḍhāṃstānviddhi naṣṭānacetasaḥ -3-32-
gita.Explanation: But those who carp at My teaching and do not practice it, deluded in all knowledge, and devoid of discrimination, know them to be doomed to destruction.

gita.Line2: प्रकृतिं यान्ति भूतानि निग्रहः किं करिष्यति ||३-३३||
gita.Translation:
sadṛśaṃ ceṣṭate svasyāḥ prakṛterjñānavānapi.
prakṛtiṃ yānti bhūtāni nigrahaḥ kiṃ kariṣyati -3-33-
gita.Explanation: Even a wise man acts in accordance with his own nature; beings will follow their own nature; what can restraint do?

gita.Translation:
indriyasyendriyasyārthe rāgadveṣau vyavasthitau.
tayorna vaśamāgacchettau hyasya paripanthinau -3-34-
gita.Explanation: Attachment and aversion for the objects of the senses abide in the senses; let none come under their sway; for they are his foes.

gita.Translation:
śreyānsvadharmo viguṇaḥ paradharmātsvanuṣṭhitāt.
svadharme nidhanaṃ śreyaḥ paradharmo bhayāvahaḥ -3-35-
gita.Explanation: Better is one's own 'duty' , though devoid of merit, than the 'duty' of another well discharged. Better is death in one's own 'duty' ; the 'duty' of another is fraught with fear (is productive of positive danger).

gita.Line2: अथ केन प्रयुक्तोऽयं पापं चरति पूरुषः |
gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.
atha kena prayukto.ayaṃ pāpaṃ carati pūruṣaḥ.
anicchannapi vārṣṇeya balādiva niyojitaḥ -3-36-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said:But, by what impelled does man commit sin, though against his wishes, O Varshneya, constrained, as it were, by force?

gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
kāma eṣa krodha eṣa rajoguṇasamudbhavaḥ.
mahāśano mahāpāpmā viddhyenamiha vairiṇam -3-37-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord Said:It is desire, it is anger born of the 'active', all-devouring, all-sinful; know this as the foe here (in this world).

gita.Translation:
dhūmenāvriyate vahniryathādarśo malena ca.
yatholbenāvṛto garbhastathā tenedamāvṛtam -3-38-
gita.Explanation: As fire is enveloped by smoke, as a mirror by dust, as an embryo by the womb, so this (wisdom) is enveloped by that (desire or anger).

gita.Translation:
āvṛtaṃ jñānametena jñānino nityavairiṇā.
kāmarūpeṇa kaunteya duṣpūreṇānalena ca -3-39-
gita.Explanation: Enveloped, O Son of Kunti, is 'wisdom' by this constant enemy of the wise in the form of 'desire, ' which is difficult to be appeased, like fire.

gita.Translation:
indriyāṇi mano buddhirasyādhiṣṭhānamucyate.
etairvimohayatyeṣa jñānamāvṛtya dehinam -3-40-
gita.Explanation: The senses, the mind, and the intellect are said to be its seat; through these, it deludes the embodied by veiling his wisdom.

gita.Translation:
tasmāttvamindriyāṇyādau niyamya bharatarṣabha.
pāpmānaṃ prajahi hyenaṃ jñānavijñānanāśanam -3-41-
gita.Explanation: Therefore, O best of the Bharatas, controlling first the senses, kill this sinful thing, the destroyer of knowledge and wisdom.

gita.Line2: मनसस्तु परा बुद्धिर्यो बुद्धेः परतस्तु सः ||३-४२||
gita.Translation:
indriyāṇi parāṇyāhurindriyebhyaḥ paraṃ manaḥ.
manasastu parā buddhiryo buddheḥ paratastu saḥ -3-42-
gita.Explanation: They say that the senses are superior (to the body) ; superior to the senses is the mind; superior to the mind is the intellect; one who is even superior to the intellect is He, (the Atman ).

gita.Translation:
evaṃ buddheḥ paraṃ buddhvā saṃstabhyātmānamātmanā.
jahi śatruṃ mahābāho kāmarūpaṃ durāsadam -3-43-
gita.Explanation: Thus knowing Him, who is superior to intellect, and restraining the self by the Self, slay you, O mighty-armed, the enemy in the form of 'desire, ' no doubt hard indeed to conquer.

gita.Translation: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde karmayogo nāma tṛtīyo.adhyāyaḥ -3-44-
gita.Explanation: Thus in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the Scripture of YOGA , in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the third discourse ends entitled: THE KARMA YOGA

gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
imaṃ vivasvate yogaṃ proktavānahamavyayam.
vivasvānmanave prāha manurikṣvākave.abravīt -4-1-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said:1. I taught this Imperishable YOGA to Vivasvan; Vivasvan taught it to Manu; Manu taught it to Ikshvaku.

gita.Line2: स कालेनेह महता योगो नष्टः परन्तप ||४-२||
gita.Translation:
evaṃ paramparāprāptamimaṃ rājarṣayo viduḥ.
sa kāleneha mahatā yogo naṣṭaḥ parantapa -4-2-
gita.Explanation: This knowledge, handed down thus in regular succession, the royal sages knew. This YOGA, by long lapse of time, has been lost here, O Parantapa (burner of the foes).

gita.Line1: स एवायं मया तेऽद्य योगः प्रोक्तः पुरातनः |
gita.Line2: भक्तोऽसि मे सखा चेति रहस्यं ह्येतदुत्तमम् ||४-३||
gita.Translation:
sa evāyaṃ mayā te.adya yogaḥ proktaḥ purātanaḥ.
bhakto.asi me sakhā ceti rahasyaṃ hyetaduttamam -4-3-
gita.Explanation: "That same ancient "YOGA" has been to-day taught to you by Me, for you are My devotee and My friend. This is a Supreme secret."

gita.Line2: अपरं भवतो जन्म परं जन्म विवस्वतः |
gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.
aparaṃ bhavato janma paraṃ janma vivasvataḥ.
kathametadvijānīyāṃ tvamādau proktavāniti -4-4-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said:Later was Your birth, and prior was the birth of Vivaswan (Sun) ; how am I to understand that You taught this YOGA in the beginning?

gita.Line2: बहूनि मे व्यतीतानि जन्मानि तव चार्जुन |
gita.Line3: तान्यहं वेद सर्वाणि न त्वं वेत्थ परन्तप ||४-५||
gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
bahūni me vyatītāni janmāni tava cārjuna.
tānyahaṃ veda sarvāṇi na tvaṃ vettha parantapa -4-5-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said:Many births of Mine have passed as well as yours, O Arjuna; I know them all but you know them not, O Parantapa (scorcher of foes).

gita.Translation:
ajo.api sannavyayātmā bhūtānāmīśvaro.api san.
prakṛtiṃ svāmadhiṣṭhāya sambhavāmyātmamāyayā -4-6-
gita.Explanation: Though I am unborn and am of imperishable nature, and though I am the Lord of all beings, yet, ruling over My own Nature, I take birth by My own MAYA.

gita.Line1: यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत |
gita.Translation:
yadā yadā hi dharmasya glānirbhavati bhārata.
abhyutthānamadharmasya tadātmānaṃ sṛjāmyaham -4-7-
gita.Explanation: Whenever there is a decay of righteousness, O Bharata, and a rise of unrighteousness,then I manifest Myself.

gita.Translation:
paritrāṇāya sādhūnāṃ vināśāya ca duṣkṛtām.
dharmasaṃsthāpanārthāya sambhavāmi yuge yuge -4-8-
gita.Explanation: For the protection of the good, for the destruction of the wicked and for the establishment of rightenousness, I am born in every age.

gita.Line1: जन्म कर्म च मे दिव्यमेवं यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः |
gita.Line2: त्यक्त्वा देहं पुनर्जन्म नैति मामेति सोऽर्जुन ||४-९||
gita.Translation:
janma karma ca me divyamevaṃ yo vetti tattvataḥ.
tyaktvā dehaṃ punarjanma naiti māmeti so.arjuna -4-9-
gita.Explanation: He who thus knows, in true light, My divine birth and action, having abandoned the body, he is not born again; he comes to Me, O Arjuna.

gita.Translation:
vītarāgabhayakrodhā manmayā māmupāśritāḥ.
bahavo jñānatapasā pūtā madbhāvamāgatāḥ -4-10-
gita.Explanation: Freed from attachment, fear and anger, absorbed in Me, taking refuge in Me, purified by the Fire-of-Knowledge, many have attained My Being.

gita.Line1: ये यथा मां प्रपद्यन्ते तांस्तथैव भजाम्यहम् |
gita.Translation:
ye yathā māṃ prapadyante tāṃstathaiva bhajāmyaham.
mama vartmānuvartante manuṣyāḥ pārtha sarvaśaḥ -4-11-
gita.Explanation: It whatever way men approach Me, even so do I reward them; My path do men tread in all ways, O son of Pritha.

gita.Line1: काङ्क्षन्तः कर्मणां सिद्धिं यजन्त इह देवताः |
gita.Line2: क्षिप्रं हि मानुषे लोके सिद्धिर्भवति कर्मजा ||४-१२||
gita.Translation:
kāṅkṣantaḥ karmaṇāṃ siddhiṃ yajanta iha devatāḥ.
kṣipraṃ hi mānuṣe loke siddhirbhavati karmajā -4-12-
gita.Explanation: They who long for satisfaction from actions in this world, make sacrifices to the gods; because satisfaction is quickly obtained from actions in the world-of-objects.

gita.Translation:
cāturvarṇyaṃ mayā sṛṣṭaṃ guṇakarmavibhāgaśaḥ.
tasya kartāramapi māṃ viddhyakartāramavyayam -4-13-
gita.Explanation: The fourfold-caste has been created by Me according to the differentiation of GUNA an d KARMA; though I am the author thereof know Me as non-doer and immutable.

gita.Line1: न मां कर्माणि लिम्पन्ति न मे कर्मफले स्पृहा |
gita.Line2: इति मां योऽभिजानाति कर्मभिर्न स बध्यते ||४-१४||
gita.Translation:
na māṃ karmāṇi limpanti na me karmaphale spṛhā.
iti māṃ yo.abhijānāti karmabhirna sa badhyate -4-14-
gita.Explanation: Actions do not taint Me, nor have I any desire for the fruits-of-actions. He who knows Me thus is not bound by his actions.

gita.Line1: एवं ज्ञात्वा कृतं कर्म पूर्वैरपि मुमुक्षुभिः |
gita.Line2: कुरु कर्मैव तस्मात्त्वं पूर्वैः पूर्वतरं कृतम् ||४-१५||
gita.Translation:
evaṃ jñātvā kṛtaṃ karma pūrvairapi mumukṣubhiḥ.
kuru karmaiva tasmāttvaṃ pūrvaiḥ pūrvataraṃ kṛtam -4-15-
gita.Explanation: Having known this, the ancient seekers-after-freedom also performed action;therefore, you too perform action, as did the ancients in the olden times.

gita.Translation:
kiṃ karma kimakarmeti kavayo.apyatra mohitāḥ.
tatte karma pravakṣyāmi yajjñātvā mokṣyase.aśubhāt -4-16-
gita.Explanation: What is action? What is inaction? As to this even the 'wise' are deluded. Therefore, I shall teach you 'action' (the nature of action and inaction) , knowing which, you shall be liberated from the evil (of SAMSARA --- the wheel of birth and death).

gita.Line1: कर्मणो ह्यपि बोद्धव्यं बोद्धव्यं च विकर्मणः |
gita.Translation:
karmaṇo hyapi boddhavyaṃ boddhavyaṃ ca vikarmaṇaḥ.
akarmaṇaśca boddhavyaṃ gahanā karmaṇo gatiḥ -4-17-
gita.Explanation: For verily (the true nature) of 'right action' should be known; also (that) of 'forbidden (or unlawful) action' and of 'inaction' ; imponderable is the nature (path) of action.

gita.Line1: कर्मण्यकर्म यः पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म यः |
gita.Translation:
karmaṇyakarma yaḥ paśyedakarmaṇi ca karma yaḥ.
sa buddhimānmanuṣyeṣu sa yuktaḥ kṛtsnakarmakṛt -4-18-
gita.Explanation: He who recognises inaction in action and action in inaction is wise among men; he is a YOGI and a true performer of all actions.

gita.Translation:
yasya sarve samārambhāḥ kāmasaṅkalpavarjitāḥ.
jñānāgnidagdhakarmāṇaṃ tamāhuḥ paṇḍitaṃ budhāḥ -4-19-
gita.Explanation: Whose undertakings are all devoid of desires and purposes, and whose actions have been burnt by the Fire-of-Knowledge, him the 'wise' call a Sage.

gita.Translation:
tyaktvā karmaphalāsaṅgaṃ nityatṛpto nirāśrayaḥ.
karmaṇyabhipravṛtto.api naiva kiñcitkaroti saḥ -4-20-
gita.Explanation: Having abandoned attachment to the fruits-of-action, ever-content, depending on nothing, he does not do anything, though engaged in actions.

gita.Translation:
nirāśīryatacittātmā tyaktasarvaparigrahaḥ.
śārīraṃ kevalaṃ karma kurvannāpnoti kilbiṣam -4-21-
gita.Explanation: Without hope, with the mind and Self controlled, having abandoned all possessions,doing mere bodily action, he incurs no sin.

gita.Line2: समः सिद्धावसिद्धौ च कृत्वापि न निबध्यते ||४-२२||
gita.Translation:
yadṛcchālābhasantuṣṭo dvandvātīto vimatsaraḥ.
samaḥ siddhāvasiddhau ca kṛtvāpi na nibadhyate -4-22-
gita.Explanation: Content with what comes to him without effort, free from the pairs-of-opposites and envy, even-minded in success and failure, though acting he is not bound.

gita.Translation:
gatasaṅgasya muktasya jñānāvasthitacetasaḥ.
yajñāyācarataḥ karma samagraṃ pravilīyate -4-23-
gita.Explanation: Of one who is devoid of attachment, who is liberated, whose mind is established in knowledge, who acts for the sake of sacrifice, all his actions are dissolved.

gita.Translation:
brahmārpaṇaṃ brahma havirbrahmāgnau brahmaṇā hutam.
brahmaiva tena gantavyaṃ brahmakarmasamādhinā -4-24-
gita.Explanation: BRAHMAN is the oblation; BRAHMAN is the clarified butter, etc. , constituting the offerings; by BRAHMAN is the oblation poured into the fire of BRAHMAN; BRAHMAN verily shall be reached by him who always sees BRAHMAN in all actions.

gita.Translation:
daivamevāpare yajñaṃ yoginaḥ paryupāsate.
brahmāgnāvapare yajñaṃ yajñenaivopajuhvati -4-25-
gita.Explanation: Some YOGIS perform sacrifice to DEVAS alone (DEVA-YAJNA) ; while others offer 'sacrifice' as sacrifice by the Self, in the Fire of BRAHMAN (BRAHMA-YAJNA).

gita.Translation:
śrotrādīnīndriyāṇyanye saṃyamāgniṣu juhvati.
śabdādīnviṣayānanya indriyāgniṣu juhvati -4-26-
gita.Explanation: Some again offer hearing and other senses as sacrifice in the fires-of-restraint; others offer sound and other objects of sense as sacrifice in the fires-of-the-senses.

gita.Translation:
sarvāṇīndriyakarmāṇi prāṇakarmāṇi cāpare.
ātmasaṃyamayogāgnau juhvati jñānadīpite -4-27-
gita.Explanation: Others again sacrifice all the functions of the senses and the functions of the breath (vital energy) in the fire of the YOGA of self-restraint, kindled by knowledge.

gita.Translation:
dravyayajñāstapoyajñā yogayajñāstathāpare.
svādhyāyajñānayajñāśca yatayaḥ saṃśitavratāḥ -4-28-
gita.Explanation: Others again offer wealth, austerity and YOGA as sacrifice, while the ascetics of self-restraint and rigid vows offer study of scriptures and knowledge as sacrifice.

gita.Translation:
apāne juhvati prāṇaṃ prāṇe.apānaṃ tathāpare.
prāṇāpānagatī ruddhvā prāṇāyāmaparāyaṇāḥ -4-29-
gita.Explanation: Others offer as sacrifice the out-going breath in the in-coming, and the in-coming in the out-going, restraining the courses of the out-going and in-coming breaths, solely absorbed in the restraint of breath.

gita.Translation:
aapare niyatāhārāḥ prāṇānprāṇeṣu juhvati.
sarve.apyete yajñavido yajñakṣapitakalmaṣāḥ -4-30-
gita.Explanation: Others, with well-regulated diet, offer vital-airs in the Vital-Air. All these are knowers of sacrifice, whose sins are destroyed by sacrifice.

gita.Translation:
yajñaśiṣṭāmṛtabhujo yānti brahma sanātanam.
nāyaṃ loko.astyayajñasya kuto.anyaḥ kurusattama -4-31-
gita.Explanation: The eaters of the nectar --- remnant of the sacrifice --- go to the Eternal BRAHMAN.Even this world is not for the non-performer of sacrifice; how then the other (world) , O best of the Kurus?

gita.Line1: एवं बहुविधा यज्ञा वितता ब्रह्मणो मुखे |
gita.Translation:
evaṃ bahuvidhā yajñā vitatā brahmaṇo mukhe.
karmajānviddhi tānsarvānevaṃ jñātvā vimokṣyase -4-32-
gita.Explanation: TThus innumerable sacrifices lie spread out before BRAHMAN --- (literally at themouth or face of BRAHMAN ) --- Know them all as born of action, and thus knowing,you shall be liberated.

gita.Translation:
śreyāndravyamayādyajñājjñānayajñaḥ parantapa.
sarvaṃ karmākhilaṃ pārtha jñāne parisamāpyate -4-33-
gita.Explanation: Superior is 'knowledge-sacrifice' to 'Sacrifice-with-objects' O Parantapa. All actions in their entirety, O Partha, culminate in Knowledge.

gita.Translation:
tadviddhi praṇipātena paripraśnena sevayā.
upadekṣyanti te jñānaṃ jñāninastattvadarśinaḥ -4-34-
gita.Explanation: Know that by long prostration, by question, and service, the 'wise' who have realised the Truth will instruct you in (that) 'Knowledge.'

gita.Translation:
yajjñātvā na punarmohamevaṃ yāsyasi pāṇḍava.
yena bhūtānyaśeṣāṇi drakṣyasyātmanyatho mayi -4-35-
gita.Explanation: Knowing that, you shall not, O Pandava, again get deluded like this; and by that, you shall see all beings in your Self, and also in Me.

gita.Translation:
api cedasi pāpebhyaḥ sarvebhyaḥ pāpakṛttamaḥ.
sarvaṃ jñānaplavenaiva vṛjinaṃ santariṣyasi -4-36-
gita.Explanation: Even if you are the most sinful of all sinners, yet you shall verily cross all sins by the raft of 'Knowledge. '

gita.Translation:
yathaidhāṃsi samiddho.agnirbhasmasātkurute.arjuna.
jñānāgniḥ sarvakarmāṇi bhasmasātkurute tathā -4-37-
gita.Explanation: As the blazing fire reduces fuel to ashes, O Arjuna, so does the Fire-of-Knowledge reduce all actions to ashes.

gita.Line1: न हि ज्ञानेन सदृशं पवित्रमिह विद्यते |
gita.Translation:
na hi jñānena sadṛśaṃ pavitramiha vidyate.
tatsvayaṃ yogasaṃsiddhaḥ kālenātmani vindati -4-38-
gita.Explanation: Certainly, there is no purifier in this world like 'Knowledge. ' He who is himself perfected in YOGA finds it in the Self in time.

gita.Translation:
śraddhāvā.Nllabhate jñānaṃ tatparaḥ saṃyatendriyaḥ.
jñānaṃ labdhvā parāṃ śāntimacireṇādhigacchati -4-39-
gita.Explanation: The man who is full of faith, who is devoted to It, and who has subdued the senses, obtains (this) 'Knowledge' ; and having obtained 'Knowledge, ' ere long he goes to the Supreme Peace.

gita.Line2: नायं लोकोऽस्ति न परो न सुखं संशयात्मनः ||४-४०||
gita.Translation:
ajñaścāśraddadhānaśca saṃśayātmā vinaśyati.
nāyaṃ loko.asti na paro na sukhaṃ saṃśayātmanaḥ -4-40-
gita.Explanation: The ignorant, the faithless, the doubting-self goes to destruction; there is neither this world, nor the other, nor happiness for the doubter.

gita.Translation:
yogasaṃnyastakarmāṇaṃ jñānasañchinnasaṃśayam.
ātmavantaṃ na karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjaya -4-41-
gita.Explanation: He who has renounced actions by YOGA, whose doubts are rent asunder by 'Knowledge, ' who is self-possessed, actions do not bind him, O Dhananjaya.

gita.Translation:
tasmādajñānasambhūtaṃ hṛtsthaṃ jñānāsinātmanaḥ.
chittvainaṃ saṃśayaṃ yogamātiṣṭhottiṣṭha bhārata -4-42-.
gita.Explanation: Therefore with the sword-of-Knowledge, cut asunder the doubt-of-the-Self, born of 'ignorance, ' residing in your heart, and take refuge in 'YOGA. ' Arise, O Bharata.

gita.Translation:
OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu
brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde
jñānakarmasaṃnyāsayogo nāma caturtho.adhyāyaḥ -4-43-
gita.Explanation: Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA , in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the fourth discourse ends entitled:'THE YOGA OF RENUNCIATION OF ACTION IN KNOWLEDGE.'

gita.Line2: संन्यासं कर्मणां कृष्ण पुनर्योगं च शंससि |
gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.
saṃnyāsaṃ karmaṇāṃ kṛṣṇa punaryogaṃ ca śaṃsasi.
yacchreya etayorekaṃ tanme brūhi suniścitam -5-1-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said:1. Renunciation-of-actions, O Krishna, You praise and again YOGA --- performance-of-actions. Tell me conclusively that which is the better of the two.

gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
saṃnyāsaḥ karmayogaśca niḥśreyasakarāvubhau.
tayostu karmasaṃnyāsātkarmayogo viśiṣyate -5-2-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said:Renunciation of action and YOGA -of-action both lead to the highest bliss; but of the two , YOGA -of-action is superior to the renunciation-of-action.

gita.Line1: ज्ञेयः स नित्यसंन्यासी यो न द्वेष्टि न काङ्क्षति |
gita.Translation:
jñeyaḥ sa nityasaṃnyāsī yo na dveṣṭi na kāṅkṣati.
nirdvandvo hi mahābāho sukhaṃ bandhātpramucyate -5-3-
gita.Explanation: He should be known as a perpetual SAMNYASI who neither hates nor desires; for,free from the pairs-of-opposites, O Mighty-armed, he is easily set free from bondage.

gita.Translation:
sāṅkhyayogau pṛthagbālāḥ pravadanti na paṇḍitāḥ.
ekamapyāsthitaḥ samyagubhayorvindate phalam -5-4-
gita.Explanation: Children, not the wise, speak of SANKHYA (Knowledge) and YOGA (YOGA -of-action) as distinct; he who is truly established even in one, obtains the fruits of both.

gita.Line2: एकं साङ्ख्यं च योगं च यः पश्यति स पश्यति ||५-५||
gita.Translation:
yatsāṅkhyaiḥ prāpyate sthānaṃ tadyogairapi gamyate.
ekaṃ sāṅkhyaṃ ca yogaṃ ca yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati -5-5-
gita.Explanation: That place which is reached by the SANKHYAS (JNANIS) is also reached by the YOGINS (KARMA-YOGINS).He sees who sees SANKHYA and YOGA as one.

gita.Translation:
saṃnyāsastu mahābāho duḥkhamāptumayogataḥ.
yogayukto munirbrahma nacireṇādhigacchati -5-6-
gita.Explanation: But renunciation, O mighty-armed, is hard to attain without YOGA; the YOGA - harmonised man of (steady) contemplation quickly goes to BRAHMAN.

gita.Translation:
yogayukto viśuddhātmā vijitātmā jitendriyaḥ.
sarvabhūtātmabhūtātmā kurvannapi na lipyate -5-7-
gita.Explanation: He who is devoted to the Path-of-action, whose mind is quite pure, who has conquered the self, who has subdued his senses, who realises his Self as the Self in all beings, though acting, is not tainted.

gita.Translation:
naiva kiñcitkaromīti yukto manyeta tattvavit.
paśyañśruṇvanspṛśañjighrannaśnangacchansvapañśvasan -5-8-
gita.Explanation: I do nothing at all, thus would the harmonised knower of Truth think seeing hearing touching smelling eating going sleeping breathing

gita.Translation:
pralapanvisṛjangṛhṇannunmiṣannimiṣannapi.
indriyāṇīndriyārtheṣu vartanta iti dhārayan -5-9-
gita.Explanation: Speaking, letting go, seizing, opening and closing the eyes --- convinced that the senses move among the sense-objects.

gita.Line1: ब्रह्मण्याधाय कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा करोति यः |
gita.Translation:
brahmaṇyādhāya karmāṇi saṅgaṃ tyaktvā karoti yaḥ.
lipyate na sa pāpena padmapatramivāmbhasā -5-10-
gita.Explanation: He who does actions, offering them to BRAHMAN, abandoning attachment, is not tainted by sin, just as a lotus leaf remains unaffected by the water on it.

gita.Translation:
kāyena manasā buddhyā kevalairindriyairapi.
yoginaḥ karma kurvanti saṅgaṃ tyaktvātmaśuddhaye -5-11-
gita.Explanation: YOGIS, having abandoned attachment, perform actions merely by the body, mind, intellect and senses, for the purification of the self (ego).

gita.Translation:
yuktaḥ karmaphalaṃ tyaktvā śāntimāpnoti naiṣṭhikīm.
ayuktaḥ kāmakāreṇa phale sakto nibadhyate -5-12-
gita.Explanation: The united one (the well-poised or the harmonised) , having abandoned the fruit of action, attains Eternal Peace; the non-united (the unsteady or the unbalanced) , impelled by desire and attached to the fruit, is bound.

gita.Line2: नवद्वारे पुरे देही नैव कुर्वन्न कारयन् ||५-१३||
gita.Translation:
sarvakarmāṇi manasā saṃnyasyāste sukhaṃ vaśī.
navadvāre pure dehī naiva kurvanna kārayan -5-13-
gita.Explanation: "Mentally renouncing all actions and fully self-controlled, the "embodied" one rests happily in the nine-gate city, neither acting nor causing others (body and senses) to act."

gita.Line1: न कर्तृत्वं न कर्माणि लोकस्य सृजति प्रभुः |
gita.Translation:
na kartṛtvaṃ na karmāṇi lokasya sṛjati prabhuḥ.
na karmaphalasaṃyogaṃ svabhāvastu pravartate -5-14-
gita.Explanation: Neither agency nor actions does the Lord create for the world, nor union with the fruits of actions. But it is Nature that acts.

gita.Line1: नादत्ते कस्यचित्पापं न चैव सुकृतं विभुः |
gita.Translation:
nādatte kasyacitpāpaṃ na caiva sukṛtaṃ vibhuḥ.
ajñānenāvṛtaṃ jñānaṃ tena muhyanti jantavaḥ -5-15-
gita.Explanation: The Lord takes neither the demerit not even the merit of any; knowledge is enveloped by ignorance, thereby beings are deluded.

gita.Translation:
jñānena tu tadajñānaṃ yeṣāṃ nāśitamātmanaḥ.
teṣāmādityavajjñānaṃ prakāśayati tatparam -5-16-
gita.Explanation: But to those whose ignorance is destroyed by the Knowledge of the Self, like the sun, to them Knowledge reveals the Supreme (BRAHMAN).

gita.Translation:
tadbuddhayastadātmānastanniṣṭhāstatparāyaṇāḥ.
gacchantyapunarāvṛttiṃ jñānanirdhūtakalmaṣāḥ -5-17-
gita.Explanation: Intellect absorbed in that, their Self being That, established in that, with That for their Supreme Goal, they go whence there is no return, their sins dispelled by Knowledge.

gita.Line2: शुनि चैव श्वपाके च पण्डिताः समदर्शिनः ||५-१८||
gita.Translation:
vidyāvinayasampanne brāhmaṇe gavi hastini.
śuni caiva śvapāke ca paṇḍitāḥ samadarśinaḥ -5-18-
gita.Explanation: Sages look with an equal eye upon a BRAHMANA endowed with learning and humility, on a cow, on an elephant, and even on a dog and an outcaste.

gita.Line1: इहैव तैर्जितः सर्गो येषां साम्ये स्थितं मनः |
gita.Line2: निर्दोषं हि समं ब्रह्म तस्माद् ब्रह्मणि ते स्थिताः ||५-१९||
gita.Translation:
ihaiva tairjitaḥ sargo yeṣāṃ sāmye sthitaṃ manaḥ.
nirdoṣaṃ hi samaṃ brahma tasmād brahmaṇi te sthitāḥ -5-19-
gita.Explanation: Even here (in this world) , birth (everything) is overcome by those whose minds rest in equality; BRAHMAN is spotless indeed and equal; therefore they are established in BRAHMAN.

gita.Translation:
na prahṛṣyetpriyaṃ prāpya nodvijetprāpya cāpriyam.
sthirabuddhirasammūḍho brahmavid brahmaṇi sthitaḥ -5-20-
gita.Explanation: Resting in BRAHMAN, with steady intellect and undeluded, the knower of BRAHMAN neither rejoices on obtaining what is pleasant, nor grieves on obtaining what is unpleasant.

gita.Translation:
bāhyasparśeṣvasaktātmā vindatyātmani yatsukham.
sa brahmayogayuktātmā sukhamakṣayamaśnute -5-21-
gita.Explanation: With the self unattached to external contacts, he finds happiness in the Self; with the self engaged in the meditation of BRAHMAN, he attains endless happiness.

gita.Line1: ये हि संस्पर्शजा भोगा दुःखयोनय एव ते |
gita.Line2: आद्यन्तवन्तः कौन्तेय न तेषु रमते बुधः ||५-२२||
gita.Translation:
ye hi saṃsparśajā bhogā duḥkhayonaya eva te.
ādyantavantaḥ kaunteya na teṣu ramate budhaḥ -5-22-
gita.Explanation: The enjoyments that are born of contacts are only generators of pain, for they have a beginning and an end. O son of Kunti, the wise do not rejoice in them.

gita.Line2: कामक्रोधोद्भवं वेगं स युक्तः स सुखी नरः ||५-२३||
gita.Translation:
śaknotīhaiva yaḥ soḍhuṃ prākśarīravimokṣaṇāt.
kāmakrodhodbhavaṃ vegaṃ sa yuktaḥ sa sukhī naraḥ -5-23-
gita.Explanation: He who is able, while still here (in this world) to withstand, before the liberation from the body (death) , the impulse born out of desire and anger, he is a YOGIN , he is a happy man.

gita.Translation:
yo.antaḥsukho.antarārāmastathāntarjyotireva yaḥ.
sa yogī brahmanirvāṇaṃ brahmabhūto.adhigacchati -5-24-
gita.Explanation: He who is happy within, who rejoices within, who is illuminated within, that YOGI attains Absolute Freedom or MOKSHA, himself becomin g BRAHMAN.

gita.Translation:
labhante brahmanirvāṇamṛṣayaḥ kṣīṇakalmaṣāḥ.
chinnadvaidhā yatātmānaḥ sarvabhūtahite ratāḥ -5-25-
gita.Explanation: Those RISHIS obtain Absolute Freedom or MOKSHA --- whose sins have been destroyed, whose dualities are torn asunder, who are self-controlled and intent on the welfare of all beings.

gita.Translation:
kāmakrodhaviyuktānāṃ yatīnāṃ yatacetasām.
abhito brahmanirvāṇaṃ vartate viditātmanām -5-26-
gita.Explanation: Absolute Freedom (or BRAHMIC Bliss) exists on all sides for those self-controlled ascetics, who are free from desire and anger, who have controlled their thoughts and who have realised the Self.

gita.Translation:
sparśānkṛtvā bahirbāhyāṃścakṣuścaivāntare bhruvoḥ.
prāṇāpānau samau kṛtvā nāsābhyantaracāriṇau -5-27-
gita.Explanation: Shutting out (all) external contacts and fixing the gaze (as though) between the eye-brows, equalising the outgoing and incoming breath moving within the nostrils,

gita.Line2: विगतेच्छाभयक्रोधो यः सदा मुक्त एव सः ||५-२८||
gita.Translation:
yatendriyamanobuddhirmunirmokṣaparāyaṇaḥ.
vigatecchābhayakrodho yaḥ sadā mukta eva saḥ -5-28-
gita.Explanation: With senses, mind and intellect (ever) controlled, having liberation as his Supreme Goal, free from desire, fear and anger --- the sage is verily liberated for ever.

gita.Translation:
bhoktāraṃ yajñatapasāṃ sarvalokamaheśvaram.
suhṛdaṃ sarvabhūtānāṃ jñātvā māṃ śāntimṛcchati -5-29-
gita.Explanation: Knowing Me as Enjoyer of sacrifices and austerities, the Great Lord of all worlds, the friend of all beings, he attains Peace.

gita.Translation:
OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu
brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde
saṃnyāsayogo nāma pañcamo.adhyāyaḥ -5-30-
gita.Explanation: Thus in the UPANISHAD of the glorious Bhagawad Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal,in the Scripture of YOGA , in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna the fifth discourse ends entitled: YOGA OF TRUE RENUNCIATION.

gita.Line2: अनाश्रितः कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति यः |
gita.Line3: स संन्यासी च योगी च न निरग्निर्न चाक्रियः ||६-१||
gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
anāśritaḥ karmaphalaṃ kāryaṃ karma karoti yaḥ.
sa saṃnyāsī ca yogī ca na niragnirna cākriyaḥ -6-1-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said: He who performs his bounden duty without depending on the fruits-of-actions --- he is a SAMNYASIN and a YOGIN ; not he who (has renounced) is without fire and without action.

gita.Line1: यं संन्यासमिति प्राहुर्योगं तं विद्धि पाण्डव |
gita.Translation:
yaṃ saṃnyāsamiti prāhuryogaṃ taṃ viddhi pāṇḍava.
na hyasaṃnyastasaṅkalpo yogī bhavati kaścana -6-2-
gita.Explanation: O Pandava, please know YOGA to be that which they call renunciation; no one verily becomes a YOGI who has not renounced thoughts.

gita.Translation:
ārurukṣormuneryogaṃ karma kāraṇamucyate.
yogārūḍhasya tasyaiva śamaḥ kāraṇamucyate -6-3-
gita.Explanation: For a MUNI or sage who 'wishes', to attain, to YOGA action is said to be the means; for the same sage who has attained to YOGA inaction (quiescence) is said to be the means.

gita.Translation:
yadā hi nendriyārtheṣu na karmasvanuṣajjate.
sarvasaṅkalpasaṃnyāsī yogārūḍhastadocyate -6-4-
gita.Explanation: When a man is not attached to sense-objects or to actions, having renounced all thoughts, then he is said to have attained to YOGA.

gita.Translation:
uddharedātmanātmānaṃ nātmānamavasādayet.
ātmaiva hyātmano bandhurātmaiva ripurātmanaḥ -6-5-
gita.Explanation: Let a man lift himself by his own Self alone, and let him not lower himself; for, this Self alone is the friend of oneself, and this Self is the enemy of oneself.

gita.Translation:
bandhurātmātmanastasya yenātmaivātmanā jitaḥ.
anātmanastu śatrutve vartetātmaiva śatruvat -6-6-
gita.Explanation: he Self is the friend of the self for him who has conquered himself by the Self, but to the unconquered self, the Self stands in the position of an enemy like the (external) foe.

gita.Translation:
jitātmanaḥ praśāntasya paramātmā samāhitaḥ.
śītoṣṇasukhaduḥkheṣu tathā mānāpamānayoḥ -6-7-
gita.Explanation: The Supreme Self of him who is self-controlled and peaceful, is balanced in cold and heat, pleasure and pain, as also in honour and dishonour.

gita.Translation:
jñānavijñānatṛptātmā kūṭastho vijitendriyaḥ.
yukta ityucyate yogī samaloṣṭāśmakāñcanaḥ -6-8-
gita.Explanation: The YOGI who is satisfied with knowledge and wisdom, who remains unshaken, who has conquered the senses, to whom a lump of earth, a stone and gold are the same, is said to be harmonised (i. e. , is said to have attained NIRVIKALPA SAMADHI).

gita.Translation:
suhṛnmitrāryudāsīnamadhyasthadveṣyabandhuṣu.
sādhuṣvapi ca pāpeṣu samabuddhirviśiṣyate -6-9-
gita.Explanation: He who is of the same mind to the good-hearted, friends, enemies, the indifferent, the neutral, the hateful, relatives, the righteous and the unrighteous, he excels.

gita.Translation:
yogī yuñjīta satatamātmānaṃ rahasi sthitaḥ.
ekākī yatacittātmā nirāśīraparigrahaḥ -6-10-
gita.Explanation: Let the YOGI try constantly to keep the mind steady, remaining in solitude, alone, with the mind and body controlled, free from hope and greed.

gita.Translation:
śucau deśe pratiṣṭhāpya sthiramāsanamātmanaḥ.
nātyucchritaṃ nātinīcaṃ cailājinakuśottaram -6-11-
gita.Explanation:
Having, in a clean spot, established a firm seat of his own, neither too high nor too low, made of a cloth, a skin and KUSHA -grass, one over the other,.
.
.

gita.Translation:
tatraikāgraṃ manaḥ kṛtvā yatacittendriyakriyaḥ.
upaviśyāsane yuñjyādyogamātmaviśuddhaye -6-12-
gita.Explanation: There, having made the mind one-pointed, with the actions of the mind and the senses controlled, let him, seated on the seat, practise YOGA, for the purification of the self.

gita.Translation:
samaṃ kāyaśirogrīvaṃ dhārayannacalaṃ sthiraḥ.
samprekṣya nāsikāgraṃ svaṃ diśaścānavalokayan -6-13-
gita.Explanation: Let him firmly hold his body, head and neck erect and still, gazing at the tip of his nose, without looking around.

gita.Line2: मनः संयम्य मच्चित्तो युक्त आसीत मत्परः ||६-१४||
gita.Translation:
praśāntātmā vigatabhīrbrahmacārivrate sthitaḥ.
manaḥ saṃyamya maccitto yukta āsīta matparaḥ -6-14-
gita.Explanation: Serene-minded, fearless, firm in the vow of BRAHMACHARYA, having controlled the mind, thinking on Me and balanced, let him sit, having Me as the Supreme Goal.

gita.Translation:
yuñjannevaṃ sadātmānaṃ yogī niyatamānasaḥ.
śāntiṃ nirvāṇaparamāṃ matsaṃsthāmadhigacchati -6-15-
gita.Explanation: Thus, always keeping the mind balanced, the YOGI, with his mind controlled, attains to the Peace abiding in Me, which culminates in total liberation (NIRVANA or MOKSHA).

gita.Translation:
nātyaśnatastu yogo.asti na caikāntamanaśnataḥ.
na cātisvapnaśīlasya jāgrato naiva cārjuna -6-16-
gita.Explanation: Verily, YOGA is not possible for him who eats too much, nor for him who does not eat at all; nor for him who sleeps too much, nor for him who is (always) awake, O Arjuna.

gita.Translation:
yuktāhāravihārasya yuktaceṣṭasya karmasu.
