yuktasvapnāvabodhasya yogo bhavati duḥkhahā -6-17-
gita.Explanation: YOGA becomes the destroyer of pain for him who is moderate in eating and recreation, who is moderate in his exertion during his actions, who is moderate in sleep and wakefulness.

gita.Translation:
yadā viniyataṃ cittamātmanyevāvatiṣṭhate.
niḥspṛhaḥ sarvakāmebhyo yukta ityucyate tadā -6-18-
gita.Explanation:
When the perfectly controlled mind rests in the Self only, free from longing for all (objects of) desire, then it is said:
he is united (YUKTAH).

gita.Line1: यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते सोपमा स्मृता |
gita.Translation:
yathā dīpo nivātastho neṅgate sopamā smṛtā.
yogino yatacittasya yuñjato yogamātmanaḥ -6-19-
gita.Explanation: As a lamp placed in a windless place does not flicker is a simile used to describe the YOGI of controlled-mind practising YOGA of the Self (or absorbed in the YOGA - of-the-Self).

gita.Translation:
yatroparamate cittaṃ niruddhaṃ yogasevayā.
yatra caivātmanātmānaṃ paśyannātmani tuṣyati -6-20-
gita.Explanation: When the mind, restrained by the practice of YOGA, attains quietude and when seeing the Self by the self, he is satisfied in his own Self;

gita.Line2: वेत्ति यत्र न चैवायं स्थितश्चलति तत्त्वतः ||६-२१||
gita.Translation:
sukhamātyantikaṃ yattad buddhigrāhyamatīndriyam.
vetti yatra na caivāyaṃ sthitaścalati tattvataḥ -6-21-
gita.Explanation: When he (the YOGI ) feels that Infinite bliss --- which can be grasped by the (pure)intellect and which transcends the senses --- wherein established he never moves from the Reality;

gita.Line1: यं लब्ध्वा चापरं लाभं मन्यते नाधिकं ततः |
gita.Translation:
yaṃ labdhvā cāparaṃ lābhaṃ manyate nādhikaṃ tataḥ.
yasminsthito na duḥkhena guruṇāpi vicālyate -6-22-
gita.Explanation: Which, having obtained, he thinks there is no other gain superior to it; wherein established, he is not moved even by heavy sorrow.

gita.Translation:
taṃ vidyād duḥkhasaṃyogaviyogaṃ yogasaṃjñitam.
sa niścayena yoktavyo yogo.anirviṇṇacetasā -6-23-
gita.Explanation: Let it be known the severance from the union-with-pain is YOGA. This YOGA should be practised with determination and with a mind steady and undespairing.

gita.Translation:
saṅkalpaprabhavānkāmāṃstyaktvā sarvānaśeṣataḥ.
manasaivendriyagrāmaṃ viniyamya samantataḥ -6-24-
gita.Explanation: Abandoning without reserve all desires born of SANKALPA, and completely restraining the whole group of senses by the mind from all sides.

gita.Line2: आत्मसंस्थं मनः कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत् ||६-२५||
gita.Translation:
śanaiḥ śanairuparamed buddhyā dhṛtigṛhītayā.
ātmasaṃsthaṃ manaḥ kṛtvā na kiñcidapi cintayet -6-25-
gita.Explanation: Little by little, let him attain quietude by his intellect, held firm; having made the mind established in the Self, let him not think of anything.

gita.Translation:
yato yato niścarati manaścañcalamasthiram.
tatastato niyamyaitadātmanyeva vaśaṃ nayet -6-26-
gita.Explanation: From whatever cause the restless and the unsteady mind wanders away, from that let him restrain it, and bring it back under the control of the Self alone.

gita.Translation:
praśāntamanasaṃ hyenaṃ yoginaṃ sukhamuttamam.
upaiti śāntarajasaṃ brahmabhūtamakalmaṣam -6-27-
gita.Explanation: Supreme Bliss verily comes to this YOGI, whose mind is quite peaceful, whose passion is quietened, who is free from sin, and who has become BRAHMAN.

gita.Translation:
yuñjannevaṃ sadātmānaṃ yogī vigatakalmaṣaḥ.
sukhena brahmasaṃsparśamatyantaṃ sukhamaśnute -6-28-
gita.Explanation: The YOGI engaging the mind thus (in the practice of YOGA ) , freed from sins, easily enjoys the Infinite Bliss of 'BRAHMAN -contact.'

gita.Translation:
sarvabhūtasthamātmānaṃ sarvabhūtāni cātmani.
īkṣate yogayuktātmā sarvatra samadarśanaḥ -6-29-
gita.Explanation: With the mind harmonised by YOGA he sees the Self abiding in all beings, and all beings in the Self; he sees the same everywhere.

gita.Line1: यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति |
gita.Line2: तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति ||६-३०||
gita.Translation:
yo māṃ paśyati sarvatra sarvaṃ ca mayi paśyati.
tasyāhaṃ na praṇaśyāmi sa ca me na praṇaśyati -6-30-
gita.Explanation: He who sees Me everywhere, and sees everything in Me, he never gets separated from Me, nor do I get separated from him.

gita.Line2: सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते ||६-३१||
gita.Translation:
sarvabhūtasthitaṃ yo māṃ bhajatyekatvamāsthitaḥ.
sarvathā vartamāno.api sa yogī mayi vartate -6-31-
gita.Explanation: He who, being established in unity, worships Me, dwelling in all beings, that YOGI abides in Me, whatever be his mode of living.

gita.Line2: सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं स योगी परमो मतः ||६-३२||
gita.Translation:
ātmaupamyena sarvatra samaṃ paśyati yo.arjuna.
sukhaṃ vā yadi vā duḥkhaṃ sa yogī paramo mataḥ -6-32-
gita.Explanation: He who, through the likeness (sameness) of the Self, O Arjuna, sees equality everywhere, be it pleasure or pain, he is regarded as the highest YOGI.

gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.yo.ayaṃ yogastvayā proktaḥ sāmyena madhusūdana.
etasyāhaṃ na paśyāmi cañcalatvātsthitiṃ sthirām -6-33-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said:This YOGA of Equanimity, taught by Thee, O slayer of Madhu, I see not its enduring continuity, because of the restlessness (of the mind).

gita.Line1: चञ्चलं हि मनः कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद् दृढम् |
gita.Translation:
cañcalaṃ hi manaḥ kṛṣṇa pramāthi balavad dṛḍham.
tasyāhaṃ nigrahaṃ manye vāyoriva suduṣkaram -6-34-
gita.Explanation: The mind verily is, O Krishna, restless, turbulent, strong and unyielding; I deem it quite as difficult to control as the wind.

gita.Line3: अभ्यासेन तु कौन्तेय वैराग्येण च गृह्यते ||६-३५||
gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
asaṃśayaṃ mahābāho mano durnigrahaṃ calam.
abhyāsena tu kaunteya vairāgyeṇa ca gṛhyate -6-35-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said: Undoubtedly, O mighty-armed one, the mind is difficult to control and is restless; but, by practice, O Son of Kunti, and by dispassion, it is restrained.

gita.Line1: असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः |
gita.Translation:
asaṃyatātmanā yogo duṣprāpa iti me matiḥ.
vaśyātmanā tu yatatā śakyo.avāptumupāyataḥ -6-36-
gita.Explanation: YOGA, I think is hard to be attained by one of uncontrolled self; but the self-controlled, striving, can obtain it by (proper) means.

gita.Line3: अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति ||६-३७||
gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca. ayatiḥ śraddhayopeto yogāccalitamānasaḥ.
aprāpya yogasaṃsiddhiṃ kāṃ gatiṃ kṛṣṇa gacchati -6-37-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said: He who, though possessed of faith, is unable to control himself, whose mind wanders away from YOGA, to what end does he, having failed to attain perfection in YOGA go, O Krishna?

gita.Translation:
kaccinnobhayavibhraṣṭaśchinnābhramiva naśyati.
apratiṣṭho mahābāho vimūḍho brahmaṇaḥ pathi -6-38-
gita.Explanation: Fallen from both, does he not, O mighty-armed, perish like a rent cloud, supportless and deluded in the path of BRAHMAN?

gita.Translation:
etanme saṃśayaṃ kṛṣṇa chettumarhasyaśeṣataḥ.
tvadanyaḥ saṃśayasyāsya chettā na hyupapadyate -6-39-
gita.Explanation: This doubt of mine, O Krishna, please dispel completely; because it is not possible for any one but You to dispel this doubt.

gita.Line3: न हि कल्याणकृत्कश्चिद् दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति ||६-४०||
gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.pārtha naiveha nāmutra vināśastasya vidyate.
na hi kalyāṇakṛtkaścid durgatiṃ tāta gacchati -6-40-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said: O Partha, neither in this world, nor in the next world is there destruction for him; none, verily, who strives to be good, O My son, ever comes to grief.

gita.Translation:
prāpya puṇyakṛtāṃ lokānuṣitvā śāśvatīḥ samāḥ.
śucīnāṃ śrīmatāṃ gehe yogabhraṣṭo.abhijāyate -6-41-
gita.Explanation: Having attained to the worlds of the righteous, and having dwelt there for everlasting (long) years, he who had fallen from YOGA is born again in the house of the pure and the wealthy.

gita.Translation:
athavā yogināmeva kule bhavati dhīmatām.
etaddhi durlabhataraṃ loke janma yadīdṛśam -6-42-
gita.Explanation: Or, he is even born in the family of the wise YOGIS; verily, a birth like this is very difficult to obtain in this world.

gita.Line2: यतते च ततो भूयः संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन ||६-४३||
gita.Translation:
tatra taṃ buddhisaṃyogaṃ labhate paurvadehikam.
yatate ca tato bhūyaḥ saṃsiddhau kurunandana -6-43-
gita.Explanation: There he comes to be united with the knowledge acquired in his former body and strives more than before for Perfection, O son of the Kurus.

gita.Translation:
pūrvābhyāsena tenaiva hriyate hyavaśo.api saḥ.
jijñāsurapi yogasya śabdabrahmātivartate -6-44-
gita.Explanation: By that very former practice he is borne on inspite of himself. Even he who merely wishes to know YOGA goes beyond the SHABDA BRAHMAN.

gita.Translation:
prayatnādyatamānastu yogī saṃśuddhakilbiṣaḥ.
anekajanmasaṃsiddhastato yāti parāṃ gatim -6-45-
gita.Explanation: But the YOGI, who strives with assiduity, purified from sins and perfected (gradually) through many births, then attains the highest Goal.

gita.Translation:
tapasvibhyo.adhiko yogī jñānibhyo.api mato.
adhikaḥ.karmibhyaścādhiko yogī tasmādyogī bhavārjuna -6-46-
gita.Explanation: The YOGI is thought to be superior to the ascetics, and even superior to men-of-knowledge (mere scholars) ; he is also superior to men-of-action; therefore (you strive to) be a YOGI, O Arjuna.

gita.Line2: श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मतः ||६-४७||
gita.Translation:
yogināmapi sarveṣāṃ madgatenāntarātmanā.
śraddhāvānbhajate yo māṃ sa me yuktatamo mataḥ -6-47-
gita.Explanation: And among all YOGIS, he who, full of faith, with his inner-self merged in Me, worships Me, is, according to Me, the most devout.

gita.Translation:
OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu
brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde
ātmasaṃyamayogo nāma ṣaṣṭho.adhyāyaḥ -6-48-
gita.Explanation: Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad-Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA, in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the sixth discourse ends entitled: THE YOGA OF MEDITATION

gita.Line3: असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु ||७-१||
gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
mayyāsaktamanāḥ pārtha yogaṃ yuñjanmadāśrayaḥ.
asaṃśayaṃ samagraṃ māṃ yathā jñāsyasi tacchṛṇu -7-1-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said:With the mind intent on Me, Partha, practising YOGA and taking refuge in Me, how thou shalt, without doubt, know Me fully, that do thou hear.

gita.Translation:
jñānaṃ te.ahaṃ savijñānamidaṃ vakṣyāmyaśeṣataḥ.
yajjñātvā neha bhūyo.anyajjñātavyamavaśiṣyate -7-2-
gita.Explanation: I shall declare to thee in full this knowledge combined with realisation, which being known, nothing more here remains to be known.

gita.Translation:
manuṣyāṇāṃ sahasreṣu kaścidyatati siddhaye.
yatatāmapi siddhānāṃ kaścinmāṃ vetti tattvataḥ -7-3-
gita.Explanation: Among thousands of men, one perchance strives, for perfection; even among those successful strivers, only one perchance knows Me in essence.

gita.Line1: भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च |
gita.Translation:
bhūmirāpo.analo vāyuḥ khaṃ mano buddhireva ca.
ahaṃkāra itīyaṃ me bhinnā prakṛtiraṣṭadhā -7-4-
gita.Explanation: Earth, water, fire, air, ether, mind, intellect, egoism --- these are My eight-fold  PRAKRITI.

gita.Translation:
apareyamitastvanyāṃ prakṛtiṃ viddhi me parām.
jīvabhūtāṃ mahābāho yayedaṃ dhāryate jagat -7-5-
gita.Explanation: "This is the "lower" PRAKRITI; different from it, know thou, O mighty-armed, My 'Higher' ' PRAKRITI , the very Life-element, by which this world is upheld."

gita.Translation:
etadyonīni bhūtāni sarvāṇītyupadhāraya.
ahaṃ kṛtsnasya jagataḥ prabhavaḥ pralayastathā -7-6-
gita.Explanation: Know that these (two PRAKRITIS ) , are the womb of all beings. So I am the source and dissolution of the whole universe.

gita.Line2: मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव ||७-७||
gita.Translation:
mattaḥ parataraṃ nānyatkiñcidasti dhanañjaya.
mayi sarvamidaṃ protaṃ sūtre maṇigaṇā iva -7-7-
gita.Explanation: There is nothing whatsoever higher than Me, O Dhananjaya. All this is strung in Me, as clusters of gems on a string.

gita.Line2: प्रणवः सर्ववेदेषु शब्दः खे पौरुषं नृषु ||७-८||
gita.Translation:
raso.ahamapsu kaunteya prabhāsmi śaśisūryayoḥ.
praṇavaḥ sarvavedeṣu śabdaḥ khe pauruṣaṃ nṛṣu -7-8-
gita.Explanation: I am the sapidity in water, O son of Kunti, I am the light in the moon and the sun; I am the syllable OM in all the VEDAS, sound in ether, and virility in men.

gita.Line1: पुण्यो गन्धः पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ |
gita.Translation:
puṇyo gandhaḥ pṛthivyāṃ ca tejaścāsmi vibhāvasau.
jīvanaṃ sarvabhūteṣu tapaścāsmi tapasviṣu -7-9-
gita.Explanation: I am the sweet fragrance in earth and the brilliance in fire, the life in all beings, and I am austerity in the austere.

gita.Line1: बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम् |
gita.Translation:
bījaṃ māṃ sarvabhūtānāṃ viddhi pārtha sanātanam.
buddhirbuddhimatāmasmi tejastejasvināmaham -7-10-
gita.Explanation: Know Me, O Partha, as the eternal seed of all beings; I am the intelligence of the intelligent. The splendour of the splendid (things and beings) , am I.

gita.Translation:
balaṃ balavatāṃ cāhaṃ kāmarāgavivarjitam.
dharmāviruddho bhūteṣu kāmo.asmi bharatarṣabha -7-11-
gita.Explanation: Of the strong, I am the strength --- devoid of desire and attachment, and in (all) beings, I am the desire --- unopposed to DHARMA, O best among the Bharatas.

gita.Line1: ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये |
gita.Line2: मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि न त्वहं तेषु ते मयि ||७-१२||
gita.Translation:
ye caiva sāttvikā bhāvā rājasāstāmasāśca ye.
matta eveti tānviddhi na tvahaṃ teṣu te mayi -7-12-
gita.Explanation: Whatever beings (and objects) that are pure, active and inert, know them to proceed from Me; yet, I am not in them, they are in Me.

gita.Translation:
tribhirguṇamayairbhāvairebhiḥ sarvamidaṃ jagat.
mohitaṃ nābhijānāti māmebhyaḥ paramavyayam -7-13-
gita.Explanation: Deluded by these natures (states or things) composed of the three GUNAS (of PRAKRITI ) all the world knows Me not as Immutable and distinct from them.

gita.Line1: दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया |
gita.Line2: मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते ||७-१४||
gita.Translation:
daivī hyeṣā guṇamayī mama māyā duratyayā.
māmeva ye prapadyante māyāmetāṃ taranti te -7-14-
gita.Explanation: Verily, this divine illusion of Mine, made up of GUNAS (caused by the qualities) is difficult to cross over; those who take refuge in Me, they alone cross over this illusion.

gita.Line1: न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः |
gita.Translation:
na māṃ duṣkṛtino mūḍhāḥ prapadyante narādhamāḥ.
māyayāpahṛtajñānā āsuraṃ bhāvamāśritāḥ -7-15-
gita.Explanation: The evil-doers, the deluded, the lowest of men, do not seek Me; they, whose discrimination has been destroyed by their own delusions, follow the ways of the demons.

gita.Translation:
caturvidhā bhajante māṃ janāḥ sukṛtino.arjuna.
ārto jijñāsurarthārthī jñānī ca bharatarṣabha -7-16-
gita.Explanation: Four kinds of virtuous men worship Me, O Arjuna, the dissatisfied, the seeker of (systematised) knowledge, the seeker of wealth, and the wise, O best among the Bharatas.

gita.Line2: प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः ||७-१७||
gita.Translation:
teṣāṃ jñānī nityayukta ekabhaktirviśiṣyate.
priyo hi jñānino.atyarthamahaṃ sa ca mama priyaḥ -7-17-
gita.Explanation: Of them the wise, ever steadfast and devoted to the One, excels; for, I am exceedingly dear to the wise, and he is dear to Me.

gita.Line1: उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम् |
gita.Line2: आस्थितः स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम् ||७-१८||
gita.Translation:
udārāḥ sarva evaite jñānī tvātmaiva me matam.
āsthitaḥ sa hi yuktātmā māmevānuttamāṃ gatim -7-18-
gita.Explanation: Noble indeed are all these, but the wise man, I deem, as My very Self; for, steadfast in mind he is established in Me alone as the Supreme Goal.

gita.Translation:
bahūnāṃ janmanāmante jñānavānmāṃ prapadyate.
vāsudevaḥ sarvamiti sa mahātmā sudurlabhaḥ -7-19-
gita.Explanation: At the end of many births the wise man comes to Me, realising that all this is Vasudeva (the innermost Self) ; such a great soul (MAHATMA) is very hard to find.

gita.Line2: तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियताः स्वया ||७-२०||
gita.Translation:
kāmaistaistairhṛtajñānāḥ prapadyante.anyadevatāḥ.
taṃ taṃ niyamamāsthāya prakṛtyā niyatāḥ svayā -7-20-
gita.Explanation: Those whose wisdom has been looted away by this or that desire, go to other gods,following this or that rite, led by their own nature.

gita.Line1: यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति |
gita.Translation:
yo yo yāṃ yāṃ tanuṃ bhaktaḥ śraddhayārcitumicchati.
tasya tasyācalāṃ śraddhāṃ tāmeva vidadhāmyaham -7-21-
gita.Explanation: Whatsoever form any devotee desires to worship with faith --- that (same) faith of his I make (firm and) unflinching.

gita.Line2: लभते च ततः कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान् ||७-२२||
gita.Translation:
sa tayā śraddhayā yuktastasyārādhanamīhate.
labhate ca tataḥ kāmānmayaivavihitānhi tān -7-22-
gita.Explanation: Endued with that faith, he engages in the worship of that 'DEVATA' and from it he obtains his desire-fulfilments; all these being ordained, indeed, by Me (alone).

gita.Translation:
antavattu phalaṃ teṣāṃ tadbhavatyalpamedhasām.
devāndevayajo yānti madbhaktā yānti māmapi -7-23-
gita.Explanation: "Verily the "fruit" that accrues to those men of little-intelligence is finite. The worshippers of the DEVAS go to the DEVAS but My devotees come to Me."

gita.Translation:
avyaktaṃ vyaktimāpannaṃ manyante māmabuddhayaḥ.
paraṃ bhāvamajānanto mamāvyayamanuttamam -7-24-
gita.Explanation: The foolish think of Me, the Unmanifest, as having come to manifestation, not knowing My higher, immutable and peerless nature.

gita.Translation:
nāhaṃ prakāśaḥ sarvasya yogamāyāsamāvṛtaḥ. mūḍho.
ayaṃ nābhijānāti loko māmajamavyayam -7-25-
gita.Explanation: I am not manifest to all (in My Real Nature) veiled by Divine- 'MAYA. ' This deluded world knows not Me, the Unborn, the Imperishable.

gita.Line2: भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन ||७-२६||
gita.Translation:
vedāhaṃ samatītāni vartamānāni cārjuna.
bhaviṣyāṇi ca bhūtāni māṃ tu veda na kaścana -7-26-
gita.Explanation: I know, O Arjuna, the beings of the past, and present and the future, but no one knows Me.

gita.Translation:
icchādveṣasamutthena dvandvamohena bhārata.
sarvabhūtāni sammohaṃ sarge yānti parantapa -7-27-
gita.Explanation: By the delusion of the pairs-of-opposites arising from desire and aversion, O Bharata, all beings are subject to delusion at birth, O Parantapa (scorcher of foes).

gita.Translation:
yeṣāṃ tvantagataṃ pāpaṃ janānāṃ puṇyakarmaṇām.
te dvandvamohanirmuktā bhajante māṃ dṛḍhavratāḥ -7-28-
gita.Explanation: But those men of virtuous deeds whose sins have come to an end, who are freed from the delusion of the pairs-of-opposites and steadfast in vows, worship Me.

gita.Line2: ते ब्रह्म तद्विदुः कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम् ||७-२९||
gita.Translation:
jarāmaraṇamokṣāya māmāśritya yatanti ye.
te brahma tadviduḥ kṛtsnamadhyātmaṃ karma cākhilam -7-29-
gita.Explanation: Those who strive for liberation from old age and death, taking refuge in Me --- They realise in full that BRAHMAN, the whole knowledge of the Self and all action.

gita.Line1: साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदुः |
gita.Translation:
sādhibhūtādhidaivaṃ māṃ sādhiyajñaṃ ca ye viduḥ.
prayāṇakāle.api ca māṃ te viduryuktacetasaḥ -7-30-
gita.Explanation: Those who know Me with the ADHIBHUTA (pertaining to elements; the world-of-objects) , ADHIDAIVA (pertaining to the gods; the sense-organs) and the ADHIYAJNA (pertaining to the sacrifice; all perceptions) , even at the time of death, steadfast in mind, know Me.

gita.Translation:
OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu
brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde
jñānavijñānayogo nāma saptamo.adhyāyaḥ -7-31-
gita.Explanation: Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the Scripture of YOGA, in the dialogue between Shri Krishna and Arjuna, the seventh discourse ends entitled: THE YOGA OF KNOWLEDGE AND WISDOM

gita.Line2: किं तद् ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम |
gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.
kiṃ tad brahma kimadhyātmaṃ kiṃ karma puruṣottama.
adhibhūtaṃ ca kiṃ proktamadhidaivaṃ kimucyate -8-1-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said:What is that BRAHMAN? What is the ADHYATMA ? What is 'action' ? O best among men, what is declared to be the ADHIBHUTA? And what is ADHIDAIVA said to be?

gita.Translation:
adhiyajñaḥ kathaṃ ko.atra dehe.asminmadhusūdana.
prayāṇakāle ca kathaṃ jñeyo.asi niyatātmabhiḥ -8-2-
gita.Explanation: Who, and how, is ADHIYAJNA here in this body, O destroyer of Madhu? And how, at the time of death, are you to be known by the self-controlled?

gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
akṣaraṃ brahma paramaṃ svabhāvo.adhyātmamucyate.
bhūtabhāvodbhavakaro visargaḥ karmasaṃjñitaḥ -8-3-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said:BRAHMAN is Imperishable, the Supreme; His essential nature is called Self-knowledge, the creative force that causes beings to spring forth into manifestation is  called 'work'.

gita.Translation:
adhibhūtaṃ kṣaro bhāvaḥ puruṣaścādhidaivatam.
adhiyajño.ahamevātra dehe dehabhṛtāṃ vara -8-4-
gita.Explanation: ADHIBHUTA (or elements) constitutes My perishable nature, and the Indweller (or the essence) is the ADHIDAIVATA; I alone am the ADHIYAJNA here, in this body, O best of the embodied.

gita.Line2: यः प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशयः ||८-५||
gita.Translation:
antakāle ca māmeva smaranmuktvā kalevaram.
yaḥ prayāti sa madbhāvaṃ yāti nāstyatra saṃśayaḥ -8-5-
gita.Explanation: And whosoever, leaving the body, goes forth remembering Me alone, at the time of his death, he attains My being; there is no doubt about this.

gita.Line1: यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम् |
gita.Translation:
yaṃ yaṃ vāpi smaranbhāvaṃ tyajatyante kalevaram.
taṃ tamevaiti kaunteya sadā tadbhāvabhāvitaḥ -8-6-
gita.Explanation: Whosoever, at the end, leaves the body, thinking of any being, to that being only he goes, O Kaunteya (O son of Kunti) , because of his constant thought of that being.

gita.Translation:
tasmātsarveṣu kāleṣu māmanusmara yudhya ca.
mayyarpitamanobuddhirmāmevaiṣyasyasaṃśayaḥ -8-7-
gita.Explanation: Therefore, at all times, remember Me, and fight, with mind and intellect fixed (or absorbed) in Me; you shall doubtless come to Me alone.

gita.Translation:
orsaṃśayama abhyāsayogayuktena cetasā nānyagāminā.
paramaṃ puruṣaṃ divyaṃ yāti pārthānucintayan -8-8-
gita.Explanation: With the mind not moving towards any other thing, made steadfast by the method of habitual meditation, and constantly meditating on the Supreme PURUSHA, the Resplendent, O Partha, he goes (to Him).

gita.Translation:
kaviṃ purāṇamanuśāsitāraṃ
aṇoraṇīyaṃsamanusmaredyaḥ.
sarvasya dhātāramacintyarūpaṃ
ādityavarṇaṃ tamasaḥ parastāt -8-9-
gita.Explanation: Whosoever, meditates upon the Omniscient, the Ancient, the Ruler (of the whole world), minuter than the atom, the Supporter of all, of Form inconceivable, Effulgent like the Sun and beyond the darkness (of ignorance).

gita.Translation:
prayāṇakāle manasā.
acalena bhaktyā yukto yogabalena caiva.
bhruvormadhye prāṇamāveśya samyak
sa taṃ paraṃ puruṣamupaiti divyam -8-10-
gita.Explanation: At the time of death, with an unshaken mind full of devotion, by the power of 'YOGA' fixing the whole 'PRANA' (breath) between the two eyebrows, he (the seeker) reaches the Supreme Resplendent 'PURUSHA4'.

gita.Translation:
yadakṣaraṃ vedavido vadanti
viśanti yadyatayo vītarāgāḥ.
yadicchanto brahmacaryaṃ caranti
tatte padaṃ saṃgraheṇa pravakṣye -8-11-
gita.Explanation: That which is declared Imperishable by the VEDA -knowers; That into which, the self-controlled and desire-freed enter; That desiring which BRAHMCHARYA is practised --- That Goal I will declare to thee in brief.

gita.Line1: सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च |
gita.Translation:
sarvadvārāṇi saṃyamya mano hṛdi nirudhya ca.
mūdhnyā^^rdhāyātmanaḥ prāṇamāsthito yogadhāraṇām -8-12-
gita.Explanation: Having closed all the gates, having confined the mind in the heart, having fixed the life-breath in the 'head, ' engaged in the practice of concentration

gita.Line2: यः प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम् ||८-१३||
gita.Translation:
omityekākṣaraṃ brahma vyāharanmāmanusmaran.
yaḥ prayāti tyajandehaṃ sa yāti paramāṃ gatim -8-13-
gita.Explanation: Uttering the one-syllabled 'OM' --- the (symbol of) BRAHMAN --- and remembering Me, he who departs, leaving the body, attains the Supreme Goal.

gita.Line1: अनन्यचेताः सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यशः |
gita.Translation:
ananyacetāḥ satataṃ yo māṃ smarati nityaśaḥ.
tasyāhaṃ sulabhaḥ pārtha nityayuktasya yoginaḥ -8-14-
gita.Explanation: I am easily attainable by that ever-steadfast YOGI who constantly remembers Me daily, not thinking of anything else, O Partha.

gita.Translation:
māmupetya punarjanma duḥkhālayamaśāśvatam.
nāpnuvanti mahātmānaḥ saṃsiddhiṃ paramāṃ gatāḥ -8-15-
gita.Explanation: Having attained Me, these MAHATMAS (great souls) do not again take birth, which is the house of pain and is non-eternal, they having reached the Highest Perfection ,MOKSHA.

gita.Line2: मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते ||८-१६||
gita.Translation:
ābrahmabhuvanāllokāḥ punarāvartino.arjuna.
māmupetya tu kaunteya punarjanma na vidyate -8-16-
gita.Explanation: Worlds upto the world-of-BRAHMAJI are subject to rebirth, O Arjuna; but he who reaches Me, O Kaunteya, has no birth.

gita.Translation:
sahasrayugaparyantamaharyad brahmaṇo viduḥ.
rātriṃ yugasahasrāntāṃ te.ahorātravido janāḥ -8-17-
gita.Explanation: Those people who know (the length of) the day- of-BRAHMA which ends in a thousand YUGAS (aeons) , and the night which (also) ends in a thousand YUGAS (aeons) , they know day-and-night.

gita.Translation:
avyaktād vyaktayaḥ sarvāḥ prabhavantyaharāgame.
rātryāgame pralīyante tatraivāvyaktasaṃjñake -8-18-
gita.Explanation: From the unmanifested all the manifested proceed at the coming of the 'day' ; at the coming of 'night' they dissolve verily in that alone which is called the unmanifest.

gita.Line1: भूतग्रामः स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते |
gita.Translation:
bhūtagrāmaḥ sa evāyaṃ bhūtvā bhūtvā pralīyate.
rātryāgame.avaśaḥ pārtha prabhavatyaharāgame -8-19-
gita.Explanation: This same multiple of beings are being born again and again, and are dissolved (into the unmanifest) ; helplessly, O Partha, at the coming of 'night', and they come forth again at the coming of 'day'.

gita.Line2: यः स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति ||८-२०||
gita.Translation:
parastasmāttu bhāvo.anyo.avyakto.avyaktātsanātanaḥ.
yaḥ sa sarveṣu bhūteṣu naśyatsu na vinaśyati -8-20-
gita.Explanation: But verily there exists, higher than that unmanifest (AVYAKTA) , another Unmanifested, which is Eternal, which is not destroyed when all beings are destroyed.

gita.Line2: यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ||८-२१||
gita.Translation:
avyakto.akṣara ityuktastamāhuḥ paramāṃ gatim.
yaṃ prāpya na nivartante taddhāma paramaṃ mama -8-21-
gita.Explanation: That which is called the Unmanifest and the Imperishable, that, they say is the Highest Goal (path).They who reach It never again return. That is My highest abode (state).

gita.Line1: पुरुषः स परः पार्थ भक्त्या लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया |
gita.Translation:
puruṣaḥ sa paraḥ pārtha bhaktyā labhyastvananyayā.
yasyāntaḥsthāni bhūtāni yena sarvamidaṃ tatam -8-22-
gita.Explanation: That Highest 'PURUSHA' , O Partha, is attainable by unswerving devotion to Him alone, within whom all beings dwell, by whom all this is pervaded.

gita.Line2: प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ ||८-२३||
gita.Translation:
yatra kāle tvanāvṛttimāvṛttiṃ caiva yoginaḥ.
prayātā yānti taṃ kālaṃ vakṣyāmi bharatarṣabha -8-23-
gita.Explanation: Now at what time (path) departing, YOGINS go, never to return, as also to return, that time (path) , I will tell you, O Chief of Bharatas.

gita.Line2: तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जनाः ||८-२४||
gita.Translation:
agnirjotirahaḥ śuklaḥ ṣaṇmāsā uttarāyaṇam.
tatra prayātā gacchanti brahma brahmavido janāḥ -8-24-
gita.Explanation: Fire, light, day-time, the bright fortnight, the six months of the northern solstice; following this path, men who know BRAHMAN go to BRAHMAN.

gita.Translation:
dhūmo rātristathā kṛṣṇaḥ ṣaṇmāsā dakṣiṇāyanam.
tatra cāndramasaṃ jyotiryogī prāpya nivartate -8-25-
gita.Explanation: Smoke, night-time, the dark fortnight, also six months of the southern solstice, attaining by these to the Moon, the lunar light, the 'YOGI' returns.

gita.Line1: शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगतः शाश्वते मते |
gita.Translation:
śuklakṛṣṇe gatī hyete jagataḥ śāśvate mate.
ekayā yātyanāvṛttimanyayāvartate punaḥ -8-26-
gita.Explanation: The Path of Light and the Path of Darkness available for the world are verily thought to be both eternal; by the one, the 'Path of Light, 'a man goes to return not; by the other, the 'Path of Darkness,' he returns again.

gita.Line1: नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्चन |
gita.Translation:
naite sṛtī pārtha jānanyogī muhyati kaścana.
tasmātsarveṣu kāleṣu yogayukto bhavārjuna -8-27-
gita.Explanation: Knowing these paths, O Partha, no YOGIN is deluded; therefore, at all times be steadfast in YOGA , O Arjuna.

gita.Translation:
vedeṣu yajñeṣu tapaḥsu caiva
dāneṣu yatpuṇyaphalaṃ pradiṣṭam.
atyeti tatsarvamidaṃ viditvā
yogī paraṃ sthānamupaiti cādyam -8-28-
gita.Explanation: Whether fruit of merit is declared (in the scriptures) as springing up from study of the VEDAS, from performance of sacrifices, from practice of austerities, and from charity beyond all these goes the YOGIN, who having known this (the two 'paths' ) attains to the Supreme, Primeval (Essence).

gita.Translation:
OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu
brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde
akṣarabrahmayogo nāmāṣṭamo.adhyāyaḥ -8-29-
gita.Explanation: Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad-Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA , in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the eightth discourse ends entitled: THE YOGA OF IMPERISHABLE BRAHMAN.

gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
idaṃ tu te guhyatamaṃ pravakṣyāmyanasūyave.
jñānaṃ vijñānasahitaṃ yajjñātvā mokṣyase.aśubhāt -9-1-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said:To you who do not cavil, I shall now declare this, the greatest secret, the most profound knowledge combined with experience (or realisation) ; which having known,you shall be free from the sorrows of life.

gita.Translation:
rājavidyā rājaguhyaṃ pavitramidamuttamam.
pratyakṣāvagamaṃ dharmyaṃ susukhaṃ kartumavyayam -9-2-
gita.Explanation: Royal Science, Royal Secret, the supreme purifier is this, realisable by direct intuitive knowledge, according to the DHARMA, very easy to perform, imperishable.

gita.Translation:
aśraddadhānāḥ puruṣā dharmasyāsya parantapa.
aprāpya māṃ nivartante mṛtyusaṃsāravartmani -9-3-
gita.Explanation: Persons without faith in this DHARMA (the Divine Self) , O Parantapa, without attaining Me, return to the path of rebirth, fraught with death.

gita.Translation:
mayā tatamidaṃ sarvaṃ jagadavyaktamūrtinā.
matsthāni sarvabhūtāni na cāhaṃ teṣvavasthitaḥ -9-4-
gita.Explanation: All this world is pervaded by Me in My Unmanifest form (aspect) ; all beings exist in Me, but I do not dwell in them.

gita.Line1: न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् |
gita.Translation:
na ca matsthāni bhūtāni paśya me yogamaiśvaram.
bhūtabhṛnna ca bhūtastho mamātmā bhūtabhāvanaḥ -9-5-
gita.Explanation: Nor do beings exist (in reality) in Me --- behold My Divine YOGA supporting all beings, but not dwelling in them, am I My Self, the 'efficient-cause' of all beings.

gita.Translation:
yathākāśasthito nityaṃ vāyuḥ sarvatrago mahān.
tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni matsthānītyupadhāraya -9-6-
gita.Explanation: As the mighty wind, moving everywhere, rests always in space (the AKASHA ) , even so, know you, all beings rest in Me.

gita.Translation:
arvabhūtāni kaunteya prakṛtiṃ yānti māmikām.
kalpakṣaye punastāni kalpādau visṛjāmyaham -9-7-
gita.Explanation: All beings, O Kaunteya (O Son of Kunti) , go into My PRAKRITI (nature) at the end of a KALPA; I send them forth again at the beginning of (the next) KALPA.

gita.Translation:
prakṛtiṃ svāmavaṣṭabhya visṛjāmi punaḥ punaḥ.
bhūtagrāmamimaṃ kṛtsnamavaśaṃ prakṛtervaśāt -9-8-
gita.Explanation: Animating My PRAKRITI, I, again and again send forth all this helpless multitude of beings, by the force of nature (PRAKRITI).

gita.Line1: न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय |
gita.Translation:
na ca māṃ tāni karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjaya.
udāsīnavadāsīnamasaktaṃ teṣu karmasu -9-9-
gita.Explanation: Sitting like one indifferent, and unattached to these acts, Dhananjaya, these acts do not bind Me.

gita.Translation:
mayādhyakṣeṇa prakṛtiḥ sūyate sacarācaram.
hetunānena kaunteya jagadviparivartate -9-10-
gita.Explanation: Under Me as her Supervisor, PRAKRITI (nature) produces the moving and the unmoving; because of this, O Kaunteya, the world revolves.

gita.Translation:
avajānanti māṃ mūḍhā mānuṣīṃ tanumāśritam.
paraṃ bhāvamajānanto mama bhūtamaheśvaram -9-11-
gita.Explanation: Fools disregard Me when I dwell in human form; they know not My Higher being as the Great Lord of all beings.

gita.Translation:
moghāśā moghakarmāṇo moghajñānā vicetasaḥ.
rākṣasīmāsurīṃ caiva prakṛtiṃ mohinīṃ śritāḥ -9-12-
gita.Explanation: Of vain hopes, of vain actions, of vain knowledge, and senseless, they verily are possessed of the delusive nature of RAKSHASAS and ASURAS.

gita.Translation:
mahātmānastu māṃ pārtha daivīṃ prakṛtimāśritāḥ.
bhajantyananyamanaso jñātvā bhūtādimavyayam -9-13-
gita.Explanation: But the MAHATMAS (great-souls) O Partha, partaking of My divine nature, worship Me with a single mind (with a mind devoted to nothing else) , knowing Me as the Imperishable Source of all beings.

gita.Translation:
satataṃ kīrtayanto māṃ yatantaśca dṛḍhavratāḥ.
namasyantaśca māṃ bhaktyā nityayuktā upāsate -9-14-
gita.Explanation: Always glorifying Me, striving, firm in vows, prostrating before Me, and always steadfast, they worshipMe with devotion.

gita.Translation:
jñānayajñena cāpyanye yajanto māmupāsate.
ekatvena pṛthaktvena bahudhā viśvatomukham -9-15-
gita.Explanation: "Others also, offering the "Wisdom-sacrifice" worship Me, regarding Me as One, as distinct, as manifold --- Me, who in all forms, faces everywhere."

gita.Translation:
ahaṃ kraturahaṃ yajñaḥ svadhāhamahamauṣadham.
mantro.ahamahamevājyamahamagnirahaṃ hutam -9-16-
gita.Explanation: I am the KRATU; I am the sacrifice; I am the offering (food) to PITRIS (or ancestors); I am the medicinal herb, and all plants; I am the MANTRA I am also the clarified butter; I am the fire; I am the oblation.

gita.Translation:
pitāhamasya jagato mātā dhātā pitāmahaḥ.
vedyaṃ pavitramoṃkāra ṛksāma yajureva ca -9-17-
gita.Explanation: I am the Father of this world, the Mother, the supporter and the grandsire; the (one) Thing to be known, the Purifier, (the syllable) OM, and also the RIK, the SAMA and the YAJUH also.

gita.Line1: गतिर्भर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत् |
gita.Translation:
gatirbhartā prabhuḥ sākṣī nivāsaḥ śaraṇaṃ suhṛt.
prabhavaḥ pralayaḥ sthānaṃ nidhānaṃ bījamavyayam -9-18-
gita.Explanation: I am the Goal, the Supporter, the Lord, the Witness, the Abode, the Shelter, the Friend, the Origin, the Dissolution, the Foundation, the Treasure-house and the Seed Imperishable.

gita.Translation:
tapāmyahamahaṃ varṣaṃ nigṛhṇāmyutsṛjāmi ca.
amṛtaṃ caiva mṛtyuśca sadasaccāhamarjuna -9-19-
gita.Explanation: (As Sun) I give heat; I withhold and send forth the rain; I am Immortality and also death, both Existence and Non-existence, O Arjuna.

gita.Translation:
traividyā māṃ somapāḥ pūtapāpā yajñairiṣṭvā svargatiṃ prārthayante.
te puṇyamāsādya surendralokaṃ aśnanti divyāndivi devabhogān -9-20-
gita.Explanation: The Knowers of the three VEDAS, the drinkers of SOMA , purified from sin,worshipping Me by sacrifices, pray for the way to heaven; they reach the holy world of the Lord-of-the-gods and enjoy in heaven the Divine pleasures of the gods.

gita.Translation:
te taṃ bhuktvā svargalokaṃ viśālaṃ
kṣīṇe puṇye martyalokaṃ viśanti.
evaṃ trayīdharmamanuprapannā gatāgataṃ kāmakāmā labhante -9-21-
gita.Explanation: They, having enjoyed the vast heaven-world, when their merits are exhausted, enter the world-of-the-mortals; thus abiding by the injunctions of the three (VEDAS) , desiring (objects of) desires, they attain to the state of 'going-and-returning' (SAMSARA).

gita.Translation:
ananyāścintayanto māṃ ye janāḥ paryupāsate.
teṣāṃ nityābhiyuktānāṃ yogakṣemaṃ vahāmyaham -9-22-
gita.Explanation: To those men who worship Me alone, thinking of no other, to those ever self-controlled, I secure for them that which is not already possessed (YOGA) by them, and preserve for them what they already possess (KSHEMA).

gita.Translation:
ye.apyanyadevatābhaktā yajante śraddhayānvitāḥ.
te.api māmeva kaunteya yajantyavidhipūrvakam -9-23-
gita.Explanation: Even those devotees, who, endowed with faith worship other gods, worship Me alone,O son of Kunti, (but) by the wrong method.

gita.Line1: अहं हि सर्वयज्ञानां भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च |
gita.Translation:
ahaṃ hi sarvayajñānāṃ bhoktā ca prabhureva ca.
na tu māmabhijānanti tattvenātaścyavanti te -9-24-
gita.Explanation: (For) I alone am the enjoyer in and the Lord of all sacrifices; but they do not know Me in Essence, and hence they fall (return to this mortal world).

gita.Line2: भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्याजिनोऽपि माम् ||९-२५||
gita.Translation:
yānti devavratā devānpitṝnyānti pitṛvratāḥ.
bhūtāni yānti bhūtejyā yānti madyājino.api mām -9-25-
gita.Explanation: The worshippers of the DEVAS or gods go to the DEVAS; to the PITRIS or ancestors go the ancestor-worshippers; to the BHUTAS or the elements go worshippers of the BHUTAS; but My worshippers come unto Me.

gita.Line1: पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति |
gita.Translation:
patraṃ puṣpaṃ phalaṃ toyaṃ yo me bhaktyā prayacchati.
tadahaṃ bhaktyupahṛtamaśnāmi prayatātmanaḥ -9-26-
gita.Explanation: Whoever offers Me with devotion a leaf, a flower, a fruit, water, that I accept, offered by the pure-minded with devotion.

gita.Translation:
yatkaroṣi yadaśnāsi yajjuhoṣi dadāsi yat.
yattapasyasi kaunteya tatkuruṣva madarpaṇam -9-27-
gita.Explanation: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer in sacrifice, whatever you give in charity, whatever you practise as austerity, O Kaunteya, do it as an offering to Me.

gita.Translation:
śubhāśubhaphalairevaṃ mokṣyase karmabandhanaiḥ.
saṃnyāsayogayuktātmā vimukto māmupaiṣyasi -9-28-
gita.Explanation: Thus shall you be freed from the bonds-of-actions yielding good and evil 'fruits' ; with the mind steadfast in the YOGA of renunciation, and liberated, you shall come unto  Me.

gita.Line1: समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रियः |
gita.Line2: ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम् ||९-२९||
gita.Translation:
samo.ahaṃ sarvabhūteṣu na me dveṣyo.asti na priyaḥ.
ye bhajanti tu māṃ bhaktyā mayi te teṣu cāpyaham -9-29-
gita.Explanation: The same am I to all beings, to Me there is none hateful nor dear; but those who worship Me with devotion, are in Me and I am also in them.

gita.Line2: साधुरेव स मन्तव्यः सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि सः ||९-३०||
gita.Translation:
api cetsudurācāro bhajate māmananyabhāk.
sādhureva sa mantavyaḥ samyagvyavasito hi saḥ -9-30-
gita.Explanation: Even if the most sinful worships Me, with devotion to none else, (or with single-pointedness) , he too should indeed be regarded as 'righteous, ' for he has rightly  resolved.

gita.Line2: कौन्तेय प्रतिजानीहि न मे भक्तः प्रणश्यति ||९-३१||
gita.Translation:
kṣipraṃ bhavati dharmātmā śaśvacchāntiṃ nigacchati.
kaunteya pratijānīhi na me bhaktaḥ praṇaśyati -9-31-
gita.Explanation: Soon he becomes righteous and attains Eternal Peace, O Kaunteya, know for certain that My devotee is never destroyed.

gita.Line1: "मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्युः पापयोनयः |
gita.Translation:
māṃ hi pārtha vyapāśritya ye.api syuḥ pāpayonayaḥ.
striyo vaiśyāstathā śūdrāste.api yānti parāṃ gatim -9-32-
gita.Explanation: For, taking refuge in Me, they also, who O Partha, may be of a 'sinful birth' --- WOMEN, VAISHYAS as well as SHUDRAS --- even they attain the Supreme Goal.

gita.Translation:
kiṃ punarbrāhmaṇāḥ puṇyā bhaktā rājarṣayastathā.
anityamasukhaṃ lokamimaṃ prāpya bhajasva mām -9-33-
gita.Explanation: How much more (easily) then the holy BRAHMINS, and devoted Royal saints (attain the goal).Having reached (obtained) this impermanent and joyless world, do worship Me devoutly.

gita.Line1: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु |
gita.Translation:
manmanā bhava madbhakto madyājī māṃ namaskuru.
māmevaiṣyasi yuktvaivamātmānaṃ matparāyaṇaḥ -9-34-
gita.Explanation: Fix your mind on Me; be devoted to Me, sacrifice to Me, bow down to Me; having thus united your (whole) Self with Me, taking me as the Supreme Goal, you shall come to Me.

gita.Translation: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde rājavidyārājaguhyayogo nāma navamo.adhyāyaḥ -9-35-
gita.Explanation: Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad-Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA, in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the ninth discourse ends entitled: THE YOGA OF ROYAL KNOWLEDGE AND ROYAL SECRET

gita.Line2: भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वचः |
gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
bhūya eva mahābāho śṛṇu me paramaṃ vacaḥ.
yatte.ahaṃ prīyamāṇāya vakṣyāmi hitakāmyayā -10-1-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said: Again, O mighty-armed, listen to My Supreme word; which I, wishing our welfare, will declare to you, who delight in hearing me.

gita.Line1: न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः |
gita.Translation:
na me viduḥ suragaṇāḥ prabhavaṃ na maharṣayaḥ.
ahamādirhi devānāṃ maharṣīṇāṃ ca sarvaśaḥ -10-2-
gita.Explanation: Neither the hosts of heaven, nor great RISHIS know My origin; for, in every way, I am the source of all the DEVAS and the RISHIS.

gita.Translation:
yo māmajamanādiṃ ca vetti lokamaheśvaram.
asammūḍhaḥ sa martyeṣu sarvapāpaiḥ pramucyate -10-3-
gita.Explanation: He who amongst the mortals, knows Me as unborn and beginningless, as the great Lord of the worlds, is undeluded and is liberated from all sins.

gita.Line2: सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च ||१०-४||
gita.Translation:
buddhirjñānamasammohaḥ kṣamā satyaṃ damaḥ śamaḥ.
sukhaṃ duḥkhaṃ bhavo.abhāvo bhayaṃ cābhayameva ca -10-4-
gita.Explanation: Intellect, wisdom, non-delusion, forgiveness, truth, self-restraint, calmness, happiness, pain, birth or death, fear and also fearlessness.

gita.Line2: भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधाः ||१०-५||
gita.Translation:
ahiṃsā samatā tuṣṭistapo dānaṃ yaśo.ayaśaḥ.
bhavanti bhāvā bhūtānāṃ matta eva pṛthagvidhāḥ -10-5-
gita.Explanation: Non-injury, equanimity, contentment, austerity, beneficence, fame, infamy --- all these different kinds of "qualities-of-beings" arise from Me alone.

gita.Line2: मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः ||१०-६||
gita.Translation:
maharṣayaḥ sapta pūrve catvāro manavastathā.
madbhāvā mānasā jātā yeṣāṃ loka imāḥ prajāḥ -10-6-
gita.Explanation: The seven great RISHIS, the ancient four and also the MANUS, possessed of powers like Me, were born of (My) mind; from them are these creatures in the world (originated and sustained).

gita.Line1: एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः |
gita.Translation:
etāṃ vibhūtiṃ yogaṃ ca mama yo vetti tattvataḥ.
so.avikampena yogena yujyate nātra saṃśayaḥ -10-7-
gita.Explanation: He, who in truth knows these manifold manifestations of My being (Macrocosm) , and (this) YOGA -power of Mine (Microcosm) , becomes established in the 'tremorless - YOGA' ; there is no doubt about it.

gita.Line1: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते |
gita.Line2: इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः ||१०-८||
gita.Translation:
ahaṃ sarvasya prabhavo mattaḥ sarvaṃ pravartate.
iti matvā bhajante māṃ budhā bhāvasamanvitāḥ -10-8-
gita.Explanation: I am the Source of All; from Me everything evolves; understanding thus, the 'wise,' endowed with 'loving consciousness' worship Me.

gita.Line2: कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च ||१०-९||
gita.Translation:
maccittā madgataprāṇā bodhayantaḥ parasparam.
kathayantaśca māṃ nityaṃ tuṣyanti ca ramanti ca -10-9-
gita.Explanation: With their minds wholly resting in Me, with their senses absorbed in Me, enlightening one another, and ever speaking of Me, they are satisfied and delighted.

gita.Line2: ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते ||१०-१०||
gita.Translation:
teṣāṃ satatayuktānāṃ bhajatāṃ prītipūrvakam.
dadāmi buddhiyogaṃ taṃ yena māmupayānti te -10-10-
gita.Explanation: To the ever-steadfast, worshipping Me with love, I give the 'BUDDHI YOGA', by which they come to Me.

gita.Translation:
teṣāmevānukampārthamahamajñānajaṃ tamaḥ.
nāśayāmyātmabhāvastho jñānadīpena bhāsvatā -10-11-
gita.Explanation: Out of mere compassion for them, I, dwelling within their hearts, destroy the darkness born of ignorance by the luminous Lamp-of-Knowledge.

gita.Line2: परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् |
gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.
paraṃ brahma paraṃ dhāma pavitraṃ paramaṃ bhavān.
puruṣaṃ śāśvataṃ divyamādidevamajaṃ vibhum -10-12-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said:You are the Supreme BRAHMAN, the Supreme Abode, the Supreme Purifier, Eternal, Divine PURUSHA, the God of all gods, Unborn, Omnipresent.

gita.Line2: असितो देवलो व्यासः स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे ||१०-१३||
gita.Translation:
āhustvāmṛṣayaḥ sarve devarṣirnāradastathā.
asito devalo vyāsaḥ svayaṃ caiva bravīṣi me -10-13-
gita.Explanation: All the RISHIS have thus declared You, as also the DEVA-RISHI Narada, so also Asita, Devala and Vyasa; and now the same You Yourself say to me.

gita.Line2: न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवाः ||१०-१४||
gita.Translation:
sarvametadṛtaṃ manye yanmāṃ vadasi keśava.
na hi te bhagavanvyaktiṃ vidurdevā na dānavāḥ -10-14-
gita.Explanation: I believe all this that You say to me as true, O Keshava; verily, O Blessed Lord, neither the DEVAS nor the DANAVAS know Your manifestation (identity).

gita.Translation:
svayamevātmanātmānaṃ vettha tvaṃ puruṣottama.
bhūtabhāvana bhūteśa devadeva jagatpate -10-15-
gita.Explanation: Verily, You Yourself know Yourself by Yourself, O PURUSHOTTAMA (Supreme PURUSHA) , O Source of beings, O Lord of beings, O God of gods, O Ruler of the world.

gita.Translation:
vaktumarhasyaśeṣeṇa divyā hyātmavibhūtayaḥ.
yābhirvibhūtibhirlokānimāṃstvaṃ vyāpya tiṣṭhasi -10-16-
gita.Explanation: You should indeed, without reserve, tell me of Your Divine glories by which You exist pervading all these worlds.

gita.Line2: केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया ||१०-१७||
gita.Translation:
kathaṃ vidyāmahaṃ yogiṃstvāṃ sadā paricintayan.
keṣu keṣu ca bhāveṣu cintyo.asi bhagavanmayā -10-17-
gita.Explanation: How shall I, ever-meditating, know You, O YOGIN? In what aspects or things, O Blessed Lord, are You to be thought of by me?

gita.Line2: भूयः कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम् ||१०-१८||
gita.Translation:
vistareṇātmano yogaṃ vibhūtiṃ ca janārdana.
bhūyaḥ kathaya tṛptirhi śṛṇvato nāsti me.amṛtam -10-18-
gita.Explanation: Tell me again, in detail, O Janardana, of your YOGA -power and Immanent glory; for I do not feel satisfied by hearing your (life-giving and so) nectar-like speech.

gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
hanta te kathayiṣyāmi divyā hyātmavibhūtayaḥ.
prādhānyataḥ kuruśreṣṭha nāstyanto vistarasya me -10-19-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said:Alas! Now I will declare to you My Divine glories, immanent, in their prominence; O best of the Kurus, there is no end to the details of My extent.

gita.Line2: अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च ||१०-२०||
gita.Translation:
ahamātmā guḍākeśa sarvabhūtāśayasthitaḥ.
ahamādiśca madhyaṃ ca bhūtānāmanta eva ca -10-20-
gita.Explanation: I am the Self, O Gudakesha, seated in the hearts of all beings; I am the Beginning, the Middle and also the End of all beings.

gita.Translation:
ādityānāmahaṃ viṣṇurjyotiṣāṃ raviraṃśumān.
marīcirmarutāmasmi nakṣatrāṇāmahaṃ śaśī -10-21-
gita.Explanation: Among the (twelve) ADITYAS I am Vishnu; among luminaries, the radiant Sun; I am Marichi among the MARUTS; among asterisms, the moon am I.

gita.Translation:
vedānāṃ sāmavedo.asmi devānāmasmi vāsavaḥ.
indriyāṇāṃ manaścāsmi bhūtānāmasmi cetanā -10-22-
gita.Explanation: Among the VEDAS, I am the SAMA-VEDA; I am VASAVA among the gods; among the senses I am the mind; and I am the intelligence among living beings.

gita.Translation:
rudrāṇāṃ śaṅkaraścāsmi vitteśo yakṣarakṣasām.
vasūnāṃ pāvakaścāsmi meruḥ śikhariṇāmaham -10-23-
gita.Explanation: And among the RUDRAS I am Shankara; among the YAKSHAS and RAKSHASAS I am the Lord of wealth (KUBERA) ; among the VASUS I am PAVAKA (AGNI) ; and  among the mountains I am the MERU.

gita.Line1: पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम् |
gita.Translation:
purodhasāṃ ca mukhyaṃ māṃ viddhi pārtha bṛhaspatim.
senānīnāmahaṃ skandaḥ sarasāmasmi sāgaraḥ -10-24-
gita.Explanation: And among the household priests, O Partha, know Me to be the chief, BRIHASPATI; among generals, I am SKANDA; among lakes, I am the ocean.

gita.Translation:
maharṣīṇāṃ bhṛgurahaṃ girāmasmyekamakṣaram.
yajñānāṃ japayajño.asmi sthāvarāṇāṃ himālayaḥ -10-25-
gita.Explanation: Among the great RISHIS I am Bhrigu; among words I am the one-syllabled 'OM' ;among sacrifices I am the sacrifice of silent repetition (JAPA-YAJNA) ; among immovable things, the Himalayas.

gita.Translation:
aśvatthaḥ sarvavṛkṣāṇāṃ devarṣīṇāṃ ca nāradaḥ.
gandharvāṇāṃ citrarathaḥ siddhānāṃ kapilo muniḥ -10-26-
gita.Explanation: Among all trees (I am) the ASHWATTHA -tree; among Divine RISHIS , Narada ;among GANDHARVAS , Chitraratha ; among Perfected ones , the MUNI Kapila.

gita.Translation:
uccaiḥśravasamaśvānāṃ viddhi māmamṛtodbhavam.
airāvataṃ gajendrāṇāṃ narāṇāṃ ca narādhipam -10-27-
gita.Explanation: Know Me among horses as 'UCCHAHI-SHRAVAS', born of AMRITA; among lordly elephants, the 'AIRAVATA' and among men, the King.

gita.Translation:
āyudhānāmahaṃ vajraṃ dhenūnāmasmi kāmadhuk.
prajanaścāsmi kandarpaḥ sarpāṇāmasmi vāsukiḥ -10-28-
gita.Explanation: Among weapons, I'am the thunderbolt (VAJRA); among cows I'm KAMADHUK; I'am KANDARPA, the cause of offspring; among serpents I'am VASUKI.

gita.Translation:
anantaścāsmi nāgānāṃ varuṇo yādasāmaham.
pitṝṇāmaryamā cāsmi yamaḥ saṃyamatāmaham -10-29-
gita.Explanation: I am 'ANANTA' among NAGAS; I am 'VARUNA' among water deities; I am 'ARYAMA' among the ancestors; and I am 'YAMA' among controllers.

gita.Translation:
prahlādaścāsmi daityānāṃ kālaḥ kalayatāmaham.
mṛgāṇāṃ ca mṛgendro.ahaṃ vainateyaśca pakṣiṇām -10-30-
gita.Explanation: I am 'Prahlada' among DAITYAS, 'Time' among reckoners, the 'Lord-of-beasts' (Lion) among animals, and 'Vainateya' (Garuda) among birds.

gita.Translation:
pavanaḥ pavatāmasmi rāmaḥ śastrabhṛtāmaham.
jhaṣāṇāṃ makaraścāsmi srotasāmasmi jāhnavī -10-31-
gita.Explanation: Among purifiers, I am the 'wind' ; among warriors, I am 'Rama, ' among fishes, I am the 'shark' ; among rivers, I am the 'Ganges. '

gita.Translation:
sargāṇāmādirantaśca madhyaṃ caivāhamarjuna.
adhyātmavidyā vidyānāṃ vādaḥ pravadatāmaham -10-32-
gita.Explanation: Among creations, I am the beginning, the middle and also the end, O Arjuna; among sciences I am the Science of the Self and I am the logic in all arguments.

gita.Translation:
akṣarāṇāmakāro.asmi dvandvaḥ sāmāsikasya ca.
ahamevākṣayaḥ kālo dhātāhaṃ viśvatomukhaḥ -10-33-
gita.Explanation: Among letters I am the letter 'A' ; among all compounds I am the dual (co-ordinates) ; I am verily, the inexhaustible, or the everlasting time; I am the (All-faced) dispenser (of fruits of actions) having faces in all directions.

gita.Line2: कीर्तिः श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृतिः क्षमा ||१०-३४||
gita.Translation:
mṛtyuḥ sarvaharaścāhamudbhavaśca bhaviṣyatām.
kīrtiḥ śrīrvākca nārīṇāṃ smṛtirmedhā dhṛtiḥ kṣamā -10-34-
gita.Explanation: And I am all-devouring Death, and the prosperity of those who are to be prosperous; among the feminine qualities (I am) fame, prosperity, speech, memory, intelligence,firmness and forgiveness.

gita.Translation:
bṛhatsāma tathā sāmnāṃ gāyatrī chandasāmaham.
māsānāṃ mārgaśīrṣo.ahamṛtūnāṃ kusumākaraḥ -10-35-
gita.Explanation: Among hymns also I am the 'BRIHAT-SAMAN' ; among metres 'GAYATRI' am I; among months I am parts of December-January (MARGA-SHIRSHA) ; among seasons I am the 'flowery-spring. '

gita.Translation:
dyūtaṃ chalayatāmasmi tejastejasvināmaham.
jayo.asmi vyavasāyo.asmi sattvaṃ sattvavatāmaham -10-36-
gita.Explanation: I am the gambling of the fraudulent; I am the splendour of the splendid; I am victory;I am the industry (in those who are determined) ; I am the goodness in the good.

gita.Translation:
vṛṣṇīnāṃ vāsudevo.asmi pāṇḍavānāṃ dhanañjayaḥ.
munīnāmapyahaṃ vyāsaḥ kavīnāmuśanā kaviḥ -10-37-
gita.Explanation: Among the VRISHNIS I am 'VAASUDEVA' ; among the PANDAVAS, (I am) 'DHANANJAYA' ; also among the MUNIS I am 'VYASA' ; and among the poets I am  'USHANA, ' the great Seer.

gita.Translation:
daṇḍo damayatāmasmi nītirasmi jigīṣatām.
maunaṃ caivāsmi guhyānāṃ jñānaṃ jñānavatāmaham -10-38-
gita.Explanation: Among punishers I am the 'Sceptre' ; among those who seek victory, I am 'Statesmanship' ; and also among secrets, I am 'Silence' ; and I am the 'Knowledge' among knowers.

gita.Line2: न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम् ||१०-३९||
gita.Translation:
yaccāpi sarvabhūtānāṃ bījaṃ tadahamarjuna.
na tadasti vinā yatsyānmayā bhūtaṃ carācaram -10-39-
gita.Explanation: And whatsoever is the seed of all beings, that also am I, O Arjuna; there is no being, whether moving, or unmoving, that can exist without Me.

gita.Translation:
nānto.asti mama divyānāṃ vibhūtīnāṃ parantapa.
eṣa tūddeśataḥ prokto vibhūtervistaro mayā -10-40-
gita.Explanation: There is no end to My Divine Glories, O Parantapa; but, this is but a brief statement by Me of the particulars of My Divine Glories.

gita.Translation:
yadyadvibhūtimatsattvaṃ śrīmadūrjitameva vā.
tattadevāvagaccha tvaṃ mama tejoṃśasambhavam -10-41-
gita.Explanation: Whatever it is that is glorious, prosperous or powerful in any being, know that to be a manifestation of a part of My splendour.

gita.Translation:
athavā bahunaitena kiṃ jñātena tavārjuna.
viṣṭabhyāhamidaṃ kṛtsnamekāṃśena sthito jagat -10-42-
gita.Explanation: But, of what avail to thee is the knowledge of all these details, O Arjuna? I exist, supporting this whole world by one part of Myself.

gita.Translation:
OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu.
brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde.
vibhūtiyogo nāma daśamo.adhyāyaḥ -10-43-
gita.Explanation: Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad-Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA , in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the tenth discourse ends entitled: THE YOGA OF DIVINE GLORIES

gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.
madanugrahāya paramaṃ guhyamadhyātmasaṃjñitam.
yattvayoktaṃ vacastena moho.ayaṃ vigato mama -11-1-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna Said: By this word of the highest secret concerning the Self, which You have spoken out of  compassion towards me, my delusion is gone.

gita.Line1: भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया |
gita.Translation:
bhavāpyayau hi bhūtānāṃ śrutau vistaraśo mayā.
tvattaḥ kamalapatrākṣa māhātmyamapi cāvyayam -11-2-
gita.Explanation: The origin and destruction of beings verily, have been heard by me in detail from You,  O Lotus-eyed Krishna, and also Your inexhaustible greatness.

gita.Translation:
evametadyathāttha tvamātmānaṃ parameśvara.
draṣṭumicchāmi te rūpamaiśvaraṃ puruṣottama -11-3-
gita.Explanation: (Now) O Supreme Lord! As you have thus described Yourself, I wish to see (actually) Your Form Divine, O PURUSHOTTAMA.

gita.Line1: मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया द्रष्टुमिति प्रभो |
gita.Translation:
manyase yadi tacchakyaṃ mayā draṣṭumiti prabho.
yogeśvara tato me tvaṃ darśayātmānamavyayam -11-4-
gita.Explanation: If you, O Lord, think it possible for me to see It, do You please, then, O Lord of YOGAS, show me Your Imperishable Self-form.

gita.Line2: पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः |
gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
paśya me pārtha rūpāṇi śataśo.atha sahasraśaḥ.
nānāvidhāni divyāni nānāvarṇākṛtīni ca -11-5-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said: Behold, O Partha, forms of Me, by hundreds and thousands, of different sorts Divine, of various colours and shapes.

gita.Translation:
paśyādityānvasūnrudrānaśvinau marutastathā.
bahūnyadṛṣṭapūrvāṇi paśyāścaryāṇi bhārata -11-6-
gita.Explanation: Behold the ADITYAS, the VASUS, the RUDRAS, the (two) ASHWINS and also the MARUTS; behold many wonders never seen before, O Bharata.

gita.Translation:
ihaikasthaṃ jagatkṛtsnaṃ paśyādya sacarācaram.
mama dehe guḍākeśa yaccānyad draṣṭumicchasi -11-7-
gita.Explanation: Now behold, O Gudakesha, in this Body, that the whole universe centres in One --- including, the moving and the unmoving --- and whatever else you desire to see.

gita.Line1: न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा |
gita.Line2: दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् ||११-८||
gita.Translation:
na tu māṃ śakyase draṣṭumanenaiva svacakṣuṣā.
divyaṃ dadāmi te cakṣuḥ paśya me yogamaiśvaram -11-8-
gita.Explanation: But You are not able to behold Me with these Your own eyes; I give You the divine-eye; behold My lordly YOGA.

gita.Translation:
sañjaya uvāca.
evamuktvā tato rājanmahāyogeśvaro hariḥ.
darśayāmāsa pārthāya paramaṃ rūpamaiśvaram -11-9-
gita.Explanation: Sanjaya said: Having thus spoken, O King, the great Lord of YOGA, Hari, showed to Partha His  Supreme Form, as the Lord (of the Universe).

gita.Translation:
anekavaktranayanamanekādbhutadarśanam.
anekadivyābharaṇaṃ divyānekodyatāyudham -11-10-
gita.Explanation: With numerous mouths and eyes, with numerous wonderful sights, with numerous divine ornaments, with numerous divine weapons uplifted (such a form He showed).

gita.Translation:
divyamālyāmbaradharaṃ divyagandhānulepanam.
sarvāścaryamayaṃ devamanantaṃ viśvatomukham -11-11-
gita.Explanation: Wearing divine garlands (necklaces) and apparel, anointed with divine unguents, the All-wonderful, Resplendent, Endless, facing all sides.

gita.Line2: यदि भाः सदृशी सा स्याद्भासस्तस्य महात्मनः ||११-१२||
gita.Translation:
divi sūryasahasrasya bhavedyugapadutthitā.
yadi bhāḥ sadṛśī sā syādbhāsastasya mahātmanaḥ -11-12-
gita.Explanation: If the splendour of a thousand Suns was to blaze all at once (simultaneously) in the  sky, that would be like the splendour of that Mighty Being (great soul).

gita.Translation:
tatraikasthaṃ jagatkṛtsnaṃ pravibhaktamanekadhā.
apaśyaddevadevasya śarīre pāṇḍavastadā -11-13-
gita.Explanation: There, in the body of the God of gods, the Pandava (Son of Pandu) then saw the  whole Universe resting in one, with all its infinite parts.

gita.Translation:
tataḥ sa vismayāviṣṭo hṛṣṭaromā dhanañjayaḥ.
praṇamya śirasā devaṃ kṛtāñjalirabhāṣata -11-14-
gita.Explanation: Then, Dhananjaya, filled with wonder, with his hair standing on end, bowed down his head to the God and spoke with joined palms.

gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.
paśyāmi devāṃstava deva dehe sarvāṃstathā bhūtaviśeṣasaṅghān.
brahmāṇamīśaṃ kamalāsanasthaṃ ṛṣīṃśca sarvānuragāṃśca divyān -11-15-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said:I see all the gods, O God, in Your body, and (also) hosts of various classes of beings. BRAHMA, the Lord of Creation, seated on the Lotus, all the RISHIS and celestial serpents.

gita.Translation:
anekabāhūdaravaktranetraṃ.
paśyāmi tvāṃ sarvato.anantarūpam.
nāntaṃ na madhyaṃ na .
punastavādiṃ paśyāmi viśveśvara viśvarūpa -11-16-
gita.Explanation: I see Thee of boundless form on every side, with manifold arms, stomachs, mouths and eyes; neither the end, nor the middle, nor also the beginning do I see; O, Lord of the  Universe, O, Cosmic-Form.

gita.Translation:
kirīṭinaṃ gadinaṃ cakriṇaṃ ca .
tejorāśiṃ sarvato dīptimantam.
paśyāmi tvāṃ durnirīkṣyaṃ samantād .
dīptānalārkadyutimaprameyam -11-17-
gita.Explanation: I see Thee with Crown, Club, and Discus; a mass of radiance shining everywhere, very hard to look at, all round blazing like burning fire and Sun, and incomprehensible.

gita.Translation:
tvamakṣaraṃ paramaṃ veditavyaṃ .
tvamasya viśvasya paraṃ nidhānam.
tvamavyayaḥ śāśvatadharmagoptā.
sanātanastvaṃ puruṣo mato me -11-18-
gita.Explanation: You are the Imperishable, the Supreme Being worthy to be known. You are the great  treasure-house of this Universe. You are the imperishable Protector of the Eternal DHARMA. In my opinion, You are the Ancient PURUSHA.

gita.Translation:
anādimadhyāntamanantavīryam .
anantabāhuṃ śaśisūryanetram.
paśyāmi tvāṃ dīptahutāśavaktraṃ .
svatejasā viśvamidaṃ tapantam -11-19-
gita.Explanation: I see You without beginning, middle, or end, infinite in power, of endless arms, the sun and moon being Your eyes, the burning fire Your mouth, heating the whole universe with Your radiance.

gita.Translation:
dyāvāpṛthivyoridamantaraṃ hi .
vyāptaṃ tvayaikena diśaśca sarvāḥ.
dṛṣṭvādbhutaṃ rūpamugraṃ tavedaṃ lokatrayaṃ pravyathitaṃ mahātman -11-20-
gita.Explanation: This space between earth and the heavens and all the quarters is filled by You alone; having seen this, Your wonderful and terrible form, the three worlds are trembling with fear, O great-souled Being.

gita.Translation:
amī hi tvāṃ surasaṅghā .
viśanti kecidbhītāḥ prāñjalayo gṛṇanti.
svastītyuktvā maharṣisiddhasaṅghāḥ.
stuvanti tvāṃ stutibhiḥ puṣkalābhiḥ -11-21-
gita.Explanation: Verily, into You enter these hosts of DEVAS; some extol You in fear with joined palms; May it be well thus saying, bands of great RISHIS and SIDDHAS praise You with hymns sublime.

gita.Translation:
rudrādityā vasavo ye ca .
sādhyā viśve\.aśvinau marutaścoṣmapāśca.
gandharvayakṣāsurasiddhasaṅghā .
vīkṣante tvāṃ vismitāścaiva sarve -11-22-
gita.Explanation: THE RUDRAS, ADITYAS, VASUS, SADHYAS, VISHWE-DEVAS, THE TWO ASHWINS, MARUTS, USHMAPAS AND HOSTS OF GANDHARVAS, YAKSHAS, ASURAS AND SIDDHAS --- they are all looking at you, all quite astonished.

gita.Translation:
rūpaṃ mahatte bahuvaktranetraṃ.
mahābāho bahubāhūrupādam.
bahūdaraṃ bahudaṃṣṭrākarālaṃ.
dṛṣṭvā lokāḥ pravyathitāstathāham -11-23-
gita.Explanation: Having seen Your immeasurable Form, with many mouths and eyes, O Mighty-armed,with many arms, thighs, and feet, with many stomachs and fearsome with many tusks, the worlds are terrified and so too am I.

gita.Translation:
nabhaḥspṛśaṃ dīptamanekavarṇaṃ .
vyāttānanaṃ dīptaviśālanetram.
dṛṣṭvā hi tvāṃ pravyathitāntarātmā .
dhṛtiṃ na vindāmi śamaṃ ca viṣṇo -11-24-
gita.Explanation: On seeing you, with Your Form touching the sky, flaming in many colours, with  mouths wide open, with large fiery eyes, I am terrified at heart, and I find neither  courage, nor peace, O Vishnu!

gita.Line3: दिशो न जाने न लभे च शर्म
gita.Translation:
daṃṣṭrākarālāni ca te mukhāni .
dṛṣṭvaiva kālānalasannibhāni.
diśo na jāne na labhe ca.
śarma prasīda deveśa jagannivāsa -11-25-
gita.Explanation: Having seen your mouths fearsome with tusks (blazing) like PRALAYA fires, I know not the four quarters, nor do I find peace; be gracious, O Lord of the DEVAS, O Abode of the Universe.

gita.Translation:
amī ca tvāṃ dhṛtarāṣṭrasya.
putrāḥ sarve sahaivāvanipālasaṅghaiḥ.
bhīṣmo droṇaḥ sūtaputrastathāsau.
sahāsmadīyairapi yodhamukhyaiḥ -11-26-
gita.Explanation: All the sons of Dhritarashtra with hosts of kings of the earth, Bhishma, Drona and the son of a charioteer, Karna, with the warrior chieftains of ours;

gita.Translation:
vaktrāṇi te tvaramāṇā viśanti .
daṃṣṭrākarālāni bhayānakāni.
kecidvilagnā daśanāntareṣu.
sandṛśyante cūrṇitairuttamāṅgaiḥ -11-27-
gita.Explanation: Into Your mouths, with terrible teeth, and fearful to behold, they precipitately enter. Some are found sticking in the gaps between the teeth with their heads crushed into pulp.

gita.Translation:
yathā nadīnāṃ bahavo..
ambuvegāḥ samudramevābhimukhā dravanti.
tathā tavāmī naralokavīrā .
viśanti vaktrāṇyabhivijvalanti -11-28-
gita.Explanation: Verily, as many torrents of rivers flow towards the ocean, so these heroes in the world of men enter Your flaming mouths.

gita.Translation:
yathā pradīptaṃ jvalanaṃ pataṅgā .
viśanti nāśāya samṛddhavegāḥ.
tathaiva nāśāya viśanti lokāsa.
tavāpi vaktrāṇi samṛddhavegāḥ -11-29-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna says:As moths rush hurriedly into a blazing fire for their own destruction, so also these creatures hastily rush into Your mouths of destruction.

gita.Translation:
lelihyase grasamānaḥ samantāl- .
lokānsamagrānvadanairjvaladbhiḥ.
tejobhirāpūrya jagatsamagraṃ .
bhāsastavogrāḥ pratapanti viṣṇo -11-30-
gita.Explanation: Devouring all worlds on every side with Your flaming mouths, You are licking (in enjoyment). Your fierce rays, filling the whole world with radiance, are burning, O  Vishnu.

gita.Translation:
ākhyāhi me ko bhavānugrarūpo namo..
astu te devavara prasīda.
vijñātumicchāmi bhavantamādyaṃ.
na hi prajānāmi tava pravṛttim -11-31-
gita.Explanation: Tell me, who You are, so fierce in form? Salutations to You, O God Supreme; have mercy. I desire to know You, the Original Being, I know not indeed Your purpose.

gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
kālo.asmi lokakṣayakṛtpravṛddho.
lokānsamāhartumiha pravṛttaḥ.
ṛte.api tvāṃ na bhaviṣyanti sarve ye.
avasthitāḥ pratyanīkeṣu yodhāḥ -11-32-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said: I am the mighty world-destroying Time, now engaged in destroying the worlds. Even without You, none of the warriors arrayed in hostile armies shall live.

gita.Translation:
tasmāttvamuttiṣṭha yaśo labhasva.
jitvā śatrūn bhuṅkṣva rājyaṃ samṛddham.
mayaivaite nihatāḥ pūrvameva .
nimittamātraṃ bhava savyasācin -11-33-
gita.Explanation: Therefore, stand up, and obtain fame. Conquer the enemies and enjoy the flourishing kingdom. Verily by Myself they have already been slain; be you a mere instrument, O left- handed archer.

gita.Line1: द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं च
gita.Translation:
droṇaṃ ca bhīṣmaṃ ca .
jayadrathaṃ ca karṇaṃ tathānyānapi yodhavīrān.
mayā hatāṃstvaṃ jahi mavyathiṣṭhā.
yudhyasva jetāsi raṇe sapatnān -11-34-
gita.Explanation: Drona, Bhishma, Jayadratha, Karna, and other brave warriors --- those have already  been slain by Me; you do kill; be not distressed with fear; fight and you shall conquer your enemies in battle.

gita.Translation:
sañjaya uvāca.
etacchrutvā vacanaṃ keśavasya kṛtāñjalirvepamānaḥ kirīṭī.
namaskṛtvā bhūya evāha .
kṛṣṇaṃ sagadgadaṃ bhītabhītaḥ praṇamya -11-35-
gita.Explanation: Sanjaya said: Having heard that speech of Keshava (Krishna), the crowned-one (Arjuna), with joined palms, trembling and prostrating himself, again addressed Krishna, in a choked voice, bowing down, overwhelmed with fear.

gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.
sthāne hṛṣīkeśa tava prakīrtyā jagatprahṛṣyatyanurajyate ca.
rakṣāṃsi bhītāni diśo dravanti sarve.
namasyanti ca siddhasaṅghāḥ -11-36-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said:It is but meet, O Hrishikesha (Krishna), that the world delights and rejoices in Thy praise; RAKSHASAS fly in fear to all quarters, and all hosts of SIDDHAS bow to Thee.

gita.Translation:
kasmācca te na nameranmahātman.
garīyase brahmaṇo.apyādikartre.
ananta deveśa jagannivāsa .
tvamakṣaraṃ sadasattatparaṃ yat -11-37-
gita.Explanation: And why should they not, O Great-souled One, bow to Thee, greater (than all else), the Primal Cause even of Brahma, O Infinite Being, O Lord of Lords, O Abode of the  Universe, You are the Imperishable, that which is beyond both the Manifest and the  Unmanifest.

gita.Line3: वेत्तासि वेद्यं च परं च धाम
gita.Translation:
tvamādidevaḥ puruṣaḥ purāṇasa- tvamasya viśvasya paraṃ nidhānam.
vettāsi vedyaṃ ca paraṃ ca dhāma tvayā tataṃ viśvamanantarūpa -11-38-
gita.Explanation: You are the Primal God, the Ancient PURUSHA; You are the Supreme Refuge of this  universe. You are the knower, the knowable, and the Abode-Supreme. By Thee is the  universe pervaded, O Being of Infinite forms.

gita.Translation:
vāyuryamo.agnirvaruṇaḥ śaśāṅkaḥ prajāpatistvaṃ prapitāmahaśca.
namo namaste.astu sahasrakṛtvaḥ punaśca bhūyo.api namo namaste -11-39-
gita.Explanation: You are VAYU, YAMA, AGNI, VARUNA, the Moon, PRAJAPATI, and the great-grandfather of all. Salutations! Salutations unto You a thousand times, and again salutations unto You!

gita.Translation:
namaḥ purastādatha pṛṣṭhataste namo.astu te sarvata eva sarva.
anantavīryāmitavikramastvaṃ sarvaṃ samāpnoṣi tato.asi sarvaḥ -11-40-
gita.Explanation: Salutations to You, before and behind! Salutations to You on every side! O All! You, Infinite in Power, and Infinite in Prowess, pervade all; wherefore You are the All.

gita.Line2: हे कृष्ण हे यादव हे सखेति |
gita.Translation:
sakheti matvā prasabhaṃ yaduktaṃ he kṛṣṇa he yādava he sakheti.
ajānatā mahimānaṃ tavedaṃ mayā pramādātpraṇayena vāpi -11-41-
gita.Explanation: Whatever I have rashly said from carelessness or love, addressing You as O Krishna O Yadava O friend and regarding You merely as a friend, unknowing of this greatness of Yours -.

gita.Translation:
yaccāvahāsārthamasatkṛto.asi vihāraśayyāsanabhojaneṣu.
eko.athavāpyacyuta tatsamakṣaṃ tatkṣāmaye tvāmahamaprameyam -11-42-
gita.Explanation: In whatever way I may have insulted You for the sake of fun, while at play, reposing or sitting, or at meals, when alone (with You), O Achyuta, or in company --- that, O Immeasurable One, I implore You to forgive.

gita.Translation:
pitāsi lokasya carācarasya tvamasya pūjyaśca gururgarīyān.
na tvatsamo.astyabhyadhikaḥ kuto.anyo lokatraye.apyapratimaprabhāva -11-43-
gita.Explanation: You are the Father of this world, moving and unmoving. You are to be adored by this world. You are the greatest GURU, (for) there exists none who is equal to You; how can there be then another, superior to You in the three worlds, O Being of unequalled power?

gita.Translation:
tasmātpraṇamya praṇidhāya kāyaṃ prasādaye tvāmahamīśamīḍyam.
piteva putrasya sakheva sakhyuḥ priyaḥ priyāyārhasi deva soḍhum -11-44-
gita.Explanation: Therefore, bowing down, prostrating my body, I crave your forgiveness, adorable Lord. As a father forgiveth his son, a friend his friend, a lover his beloved, even so should  You forgive me, O DEVA.

gita.Translation:
adṛṣṭapūrvaṃ hṛṣito.asmi dṛṣṭvā bhayena ca pravyathitaṃ mano me.
tadeva me darśaya deva rūpaṃ prasīda deveśa jagannivāsa -11-45-
gita.Explanation: I am delighted, having seen what was never seen before; and (yet) my mind is  distressed with fear. Show me your previous form only, O God; have mercy, O God of  gods, O Abode of the Universe.

gita.Translation:
kirīṭinaṃ gadinaṃ cakrahastaṃ icchāmi tvāṃ draṣṭumahaṃ tathaiva.
tenaiva rūpeṇa caturbhujena sahasrabāho bhava viśvamūrte -11-46-
gita.Explanation: I desire to see You as before, crowned, bearing a mace, with a discus in hand, in Your Former Form only, having four arms, O Thousand-armed, O Universal Form.

gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
mayā prasannena tavārjunedaṃ rūpaṃ paraṃ darśitamātmayogāt.
tejomayaṃ viśvamanantamādyaṃ yanme tvadanyena na dṛṣṭapūrvam -11-47-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said: Graciously by Me, O Arjuna, this Supreme-Form has been shown to you by My own YOGA-power --- Full of splendour, Primeval, Infinite, this Universal-Form of Mine has never been seen by any other than yourself.

gita.Translation:
na vedayajñādhyayanairna dānaira- na ca kriyābhirna tapobhirugraiḥ.
evaṃrūpaḥ śakya ahaṃ nṛloke draṣṭuṃ tvadanyena kurupravīra -11-48-
gita.Explanation: Neither by the study of the VEDAS and sacrifices, nor by rituals, nor by severe  austerities, can I be seen in this form in the world of men by any other than yourself, O  great hero among the Kurus.

gita.Line1: मा ते व्यथा मा च विमूढभावो
gita.Translation:
mā te vyathā mā ca vimūḍhabhāvo dṛṣṭvā rūpaṃ ghoramīdṛṅmamedam.
vyapetabhīḥ prītamanāḥ punastvaṃ tadeva me rūpamidaṃ prapaśya -11-49-
gita.Explanation: Be not afraid, nor bewildered on seeing such a terrible-Form of Mine as this; with your fear dispelled and with gladdened heart, now behold again this Form of Mine.

gita.Translation:
sañjaya uvāca.
ityarjunaṃ vāsudevastathoktvā svakaṃ rūpaṃ darśayāmāsa bhūyaḥ.
āśvāsayāmāsa ca bhītamenaṃ bhūtvā punaḥ saumyavapurmahātmā -11-50-
gita.Explanation: Sanjaya said:Having thus spoken to Arjuna, Vaasudeva again showed His own Form, and, the Great-souled One, assuming His gentle Form, consoled him who was so terrified.

gita.Line2: दृष्ट्वेदं मानुषं रूपं तव सौम्यं जनार्दन |
gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.
dṛṣṭvedaṃ mānuṣaṃ rūpaṃ tava saumyaṃ janārdana.
idānīmasmi saṃvṛttaḥ sacetāḥ prakṛtiṃ gataḥ -11-51-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said:Having seen this, Thy gentle human-Form, O Janardana, I am now composed and restored to my own nature.

gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
sudurdarśamidaṃ rūpaṃ dṛṣṭavānasi yanmama.
devā apyasya rūpasya nityaṃ darśanakāṅkṣiṇaḥ -11-52-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said: Very hard, indeed, it is to see this Form of Mine which you have seen. Even the gods are ever longing to behold this Form.

gita.Line1: नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानेन न चेज्यया |
gita.Line2: शक्य एवंविधो द्रष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा ||११-५३||
gita.Translation:
nāhaṃ vedairna tapasā na dānena na cejyayā.
śakya evaṃvidho draṣṭuṃ dṛṣṭavānasi māṃ yathā -11-53-
gita.Explanation: Neither by the VEDAS, nor by austerity, nor by gift, nor by sacrifices can I be seen in this Form as you have seen Me (in your present mental condition).

gita.Line2: ज्ञातुं द्रष्टुं च तत्त्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परन्तप ||११-५४||
gita.Translation:
bhaktyā tvananyayā śakya ahamevaṃvidho.arjuna.
jñātuṃ draṣṭuṃ ca tattvena praveṣṭuṃ ca parantapa -11-54-
gita.Explanation: But, by single-minded devotion, can I, of this Form, be 'known' and 'seen' in reality, and also 'entered' into, O Parantapa (O scorcher of your foes)!

gita.Line2: निर्वैरः सर्वभूतेषु यः स मामेति पाण्डव ||११-५५||
gita.Translation:
matkarmakṛnmatparamo madbhaktaḥ saṅgavarjitaḥ.
nirvairaḥ sarvabhūteṣu yaḥ sa māmeti pāṇḍava -11-55-
gita.Explanation: He who does actions for Me, who looks upon Me as the Supreme, who is devoted to Me, who is free from attachment, who bears enmity towards none, he comes to Me, O Pandava.

gita.Translation: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde viśvarūpadarśanayogo nāmaikādaśo.adhyāyaḥ -11-56-
gita.Explanation: Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad-Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA, in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the eleventh discourse ends titled:THE YOGA OF THE VISION OF THE UNIVERSAL FORM

gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.
evaṃ satatayuktā ye bhaktāstvāṃ paryupāsate.
ye cāpyakṣaramavyaktaṃ teṣāṃ ke yogavittamāḥ -12-1-
gita.Explanation: Those devotees who, eversteadfast, thus worship you, and also those who worship the imperishable, the unmanifested --- which of them are better versed in YOGA?

gita.Line2: मय्यावेश्य मनो ये मां नित्ययुक्ता उपासते |
gita.Line3: श्रद्धया परयोपेताः ते मे युक्ततमा मताः ||१२-२||
gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
mayyāveśya mano ye māṃ nityayuktā upāsate.
śraddhayā parayopetāḥ te me yuktatamā matāḥ -12-2-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said:Those who, fixing their mind on Me, worship Me, ever steadfast and endowed with supreme faith, these, in my opinion, are the best in YOGA.

gita.Translation:
ye tvakṣaramanirdeśyamavyaktaṃ paryupāsate.
sarvatragamacintyañca kūṭasthamacalandhruvam -12-3-
gita.Explanation:
Those who worship the imperishable, the indefinable, the unmanifest, the omnipresent, the unthinkable. the unchangeable. the immovable and the eternal,.
.
.

gita.Translation:
sanniyamyendriyagrāmaṃ sarvatra samabuddhayaḥ.
te prāpnuvanti māmeva sarvabhūtahite ratāḥ -12-4-
gita.Explanation: Having restrained all the senses, even-minded everywhere, rejoicing ever in the welfare of all beings --- verily theyalso come unto Me.

gita.Translation: kleśo.adhikatarasteṣāmavyaktāsaktacetasām -avyaktā hi gatirduḥkhaṃ dehavadbhiravāpyate -12-5-
gita.Explanation: Greater is their trouble whose minds are set on the 'Unmanifest' ; for the goal, the 'Unmanifest, ' is very hard for the embodied to reach.

gita.Line1: ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्परः |
gita.Translation:
ye tu sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi saṃnyasya matparaḥ.
ananyenaiva yogena māṃ dhyāyanta upāsate -12-6-
gita.Explanation:
But those who worship Me, renouncing all actions in Me, regarding Me as the Supreme Goal, meditating on Me with single-minded devotion (YOGA).
.
.

gita.Translation:
teṣāmahaṃ samuddhartā mṛtyusaṃsārasāgarāt.
bhavāmi nacirātpārtha mayyāveśitacetasām -12-7-
gita.Explanation: For them, whose minds are set on Me, verily I become, ere-long, O Partha, the Saviour, (to save them) out of the ocean of finite experiences; the SAMSARA.

gita.Line1: मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय |
gita.Line2: निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशयः ||१२-८||
gita.Translation:
mayyeva mana ādhatsva mayi buddhiṃ niveśaya.
nivasiṣyasi mayyeva ata ūrdhvaṃ na saṃśayaḥ -12-8-
gita.Explanation: Fix your mind on Me only, place your intellect in Me; then, (thereafter) you shall, no doubt, live in Me alone.

gita.Line1: अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शक्नोषि मयि स्थिरम् |
gita.Translation:
atha cittaṃ samādhātuṃ na śaknoṣi mayi sthiram.
abhyāsayogena tato māmicchāptuṃ dhanañjaya -12-9-
gita.Explanation: If you are unable to fix your mind steadily upon Me, then by the 'YOGA -of constant-practice, ' seek to reach Me, O Dhananjaya.

gita.Translation:
abhyāse.apyasamartho.asi matkarmaparamo bhava.
madarthamapi karmāṇi kurvansiddhimavāpsyasi -12-10-
gita.Explanation: If you are unable even to practise ABHYASA-YOGA, be you intent on performing actions for My sake; even by doing actions for My sake, you shall attain perfection.

gita.Translation:
athaitadapyaśakto.asi kartuṃ madyogamāśritaḥ.
sarvakarmaphalatyāgaṃ tataḥ kuru yatātmavān -12-11-
gita.Explanation: If you are unable to do even this, then taking refuge in Me, self-controlled, renounce the fruits-of-all-actions.

gita.Translation:
śreyo hi jñānamabhyāsājjñānāddhyānaṃ viśiṣyate.
dhyānātkarmaphalatyāgastyāgācchāntiranantaram -12-12-
gita.Explanation: Knowledge' is indeed better than 'practice' ; 'meditation' is better than 'knowledge' ; 'renunciation of the fruits-of-actions' is better than 'meditation' ; peace immediately follows 'renunciation. '

gita.Line1: अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च |
gita.Translation:
adveṣṭā sarvabhūtānāṃ maitraḥ karuṇa eva ca.
nirmamo nirahaṅkāraḥ samaduḥkhasukhaḥ kṣamī -12-13-
gita.Explanation:
He who hates no creature, who is friendly and compassionate to all, who is free from attachment and egoism, balanced in pleasure and pain, and forgiving.
.
.

gita.Translation:
santuṣṭaḥ satataṃ yogī yatātmā dṛḍhaniścayaḥ.
mayyarpitamanobuddhiryo madbhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ -12-14-
gita.Explanation: Ever content, steady in meditation, self-controlled, possessed of firm conviction, with mind and intellect dedicated to Me, he, My devotee, is dear to me.

gita.Line2: हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो यः स च मे प्रियः ||१२-१५||
gita.Translation:
yasmānnodvijate loko lokānnodvijate ca yaḥ.
harṣāmarṣabhayodvegairmukto yaḥ sa ca me priyaḥ -12-15-
gita.Explanation: He by whom the world is not agitated (affected) , and who cannot be agitated by the world, who is freed from joy, envy, fear, and anxiety --- he is dear to me.

gita.Line2: सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः ||१२-१६||
gita.Translation:
anapekṣaḥ śucirdakṣa udāsīno gatavyathaḥ.
sarvārambhaparityāgī yo madbhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ -12-16-
gita.Explanation: He who is free from wants, pure, alert, unconcerned, untroubled, renouncing all undertakings (or commencements) --- he who is (thus) devoted to Me, is dear to Me.

gita.Line1: यो न हृष्यति न द्वेष्टि न शोचति न काङ्क्षति |
gita.Translation:
yo na hṛṣyati na dveṣṭi na śocati na kāṅkṣati.
śubhāśubhaparityāgī bhaktimānyaḥ sa me priyaḥ -12-17-
gita.Explanation: He who neither rejoices, nor hates, nor grieves, nor desires, renouncing good and evil, full of devotion, is dear to Me.
