gita.Line1: समः शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानापमानयोः |
gita.Translation:
samaḥ śatrau ca mitre ca tathā mānāpamānayoḥ.
śītoṣṇasukhaduḥkheṣu samaḥ saṅgavivarjitaḥ -12-18-
gita.Explanation:
He who is the same to foe and friend, and also in honour and dishonour, who is the same in cold and heat and in pleasure and pain, who is free from attachment.
.
.

gita.Translation:
tulyanindāstutirmaunī santuṣṭo yena kenacit.
aniketaḥ sthiramatirbhaktimānme priyo naraḥ -12-19-
gita.Explanation: To whom censure and praise are equal, who is silent, content with anything, homeless, steady-minded, full of devotion --- that man is dear to Me.

gita.Translation:
ye tu dharmyāmṛtamidaṃ yathoktaṃ paryupāsate.
śraddadhānā matparamā bhaktāste.atīva me priyāḥ -12-20-
gita.Explanation: They indeed, who follow this 'Immortal DHARMA' (Law of Life) as described above, endowed with faith, regarding Me as their Supreme Goal --- such devotees are exceedingly dear to Me.

gita.Translation: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde bhaktiyogo nāma dvādaśo.adhyāyaḥ -12-21-
gita.Explanation: Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad-Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA, in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the twelfth discourse ends entitled: THE YOGA OF DEVOTION  Om Om Om Om Om

gita.Line2: प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव क्षेत्रं क्षेत्रज्ञमेव च |
gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.
prakṛtiṃ puruṣaṃ caiva kṣetraṃ kṣetrajñameva ca.
etadveditumicchāmi jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ ca keśava -13-1-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said:PRAKRITI (Matter) and PURUSHA (Spirit) , also the KSHETRA (the Field) and KSHETRAJNA (the Knower-of-the-Field) , Knowledge and that which ought to be  known --- these, I wish to learn, O Keshava.

gita.Line3: एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहुः क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विदः ||१३-२||
gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
idaṃ śarīraṃ kaunteya kṣetramityabhidhīyate.
etadyo vetti taṃ prāhuḥ kṣetrajña iti tadvidaḥ -13-2-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said: This body, O Kaunteya is called KSHETRA (the Field) and he who knows it is called KSHETRAJNA (the Knower-of-the-Field) by those who know them (KSHETRA and KSHETRAJNA) i. e. by the sages.

gita.Line1: क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत |
gita.Translation:
kṣetrajñaṃ cāpi māṃ viddhi sarvakṣetreṣu bhārata.
kṣetrakṣetrajñayorjñānaṃ yattajjñānaṃ mataṃ mama -13-3-
gita.Explanation: Know Me as the 'Knower-of-the-Field' in all 'Fields, ' O Bharata; Knowledge of the  'Field' as also of the 'knower-of-the-Field' is considered by Me to be My Knowledge.

gita.Line1: तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक्च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत् |
gita.Line2: स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे शृणु ||१३-४||
gita.Translation:
tatkṣetraṃ yacca yādṛkca yadvikāri yataśca yat.
sa ca yo yatprabhāvaśca tatsamāsena me śṛṇu -13-4-
gita.Explanation: What that Field is; of what nature it is; what are its modifications; whence it is; and also who He is; and what His powers are --- these hear from Me in brief.

gita.Translation:
ṛṣibhirbahudhā gītaṃ chandobhirvividhaiḥ pṛthak.
brahmasūtrapadaiścaiva hetumadbhirviniścitaiḥ -13-5-
gita.Explanation: RISHIS have sung (about the 'Field' and the 'Knower-of-the-Field') in many ways, in various distinctive chants and also in the suggestive words indicative of BRAHMAN, full of reason and decision.

gita.Translation:
mahābhūtānyahaṃkāro buddhiravyaktameva ca.
indriyāṇi daśaikaṃ ca pañca cendriyagocarāḥ -13-6-
gita.Explanation:
The great elements, egoism, intellect, and also the unmanifested (MOOLA-PRAKRITI), the ten senses and the one (the mind) and the five objects-of-the-senses,.
.
.

gita.Line1: इच्छा द्वेषः सुखं दुःखं संघातश्चेतना धृतिः |
gita.Translation:
icchā dveṣaḥ sukhaṃ duḥkhaṃ saṃghātaścetanā dhṛtiḥ.
etatkṣetraṃ samāsena savikāramudāhṛtam -13-7-
gita.Explanation: Desire, hatred, pleasure, pain, aggregate (body) , intelligence, fortitude --- this KSHETRA has been thus briefly described with its modifications.

gita.Translation:
amānitvamadambhitvamahiṃsā kṣāntirārjavam.
ācāryopāsanaṃ śaucaṃ sthairyamātmavinigrahaḥ -13-8-
gita.Explanation:
Humility, unpretentiousness, non-injury, forgiveness, uprightness, service to the teacher, purity, steadfastness, self-control.
.
.

gita.Translation:
indriyārtheṣu vairāgyamanahaṃkāra eva ca.
janmamṛtyujarāvyādhiduḥkhadoṣānudarśanam -13-9-
gita.Explanation:
Indifference to the objects of the sense, and also absence of egoism, perception of (or reflection upon) evils in birth, death, old age, sickness and pain..
.

gita.Translation:
asaktiranabhiṣvaṅgaḥ putradāragṛhādiṣu.
nityaṃ ca samacittatvamiṣṭāniṣṭopapattiṣu -13-10-
gita.Explanation:
Non-attachment; non-identification of Self with son, wife, home and the rest; and constant even-mindedness on the attainment of the desirable and the undesirable..
.

gita.Translation:
mayi cānanyayogena bhaktiravyabhicāriṇī.
viviktadeśasevitvamaratirjanasaṃsadi -13-11-
gita.Explanation:
Unswerving devotion unto Me by the YOGA of non-separation, resorting to solitary places, distaste for the society of men..
.

gita.Translation:
adhyātmajñānanityatvaṃ tattvajñānārthadarśanam.
etajjñānamiti proktamajñānaṃ yadato.anyathā -13-12-
gita.Explanation: "Constancy in Self-knowledge, perception of the end of true knowledge --- this is declared to be 'knowledge,' and what is opposed to it is 'ignorance.'

gita.Translation:
jñeyaṃ yattatpravakṣyāmi yajjñātvāmṛtamaśnute.
anādi matparaṃ brahma na sattannāsaducyate -13-13-
gita.Explanation: I will declare that which has to be 'known' knowing which one attains to Immortality --- the beginningless Supreme BRAHMAN, called neither being nor non- being.

gita.Translation:
sarvataḥ pāṇipādaṃ tatsarvato.akṣiśiromukham.
sarvataḥ śrutimalloke sarvamāvṛtya tiṣṭhati -13-14-
gita.Explanation: With hands and feet everywhere, with eyes, heads and mouths everywhere, with ears  everywhere, He exists in the world, enveloping all.

gita.Translation:
sarvendriyaguṇābhāsaṃ sarvendriyavivarjitam.
asaktaṃ sarvabhṛccaiva nirguṇaṃ guṇabhoktṛ ca -13-15-
gita.Explanation:
Shining by the functions of all the senses, yet without the senses; unattached, yet supporting all; devoid of qualities, yet their experiencer..
.

gita.Translation:
bahirantaśca bhūtānāmacaraṃ carameva ca.
sūkṣmatvāttadavijñeyaṃ dūrasthaṃ cāntike ca tat -13-16-
gita.Explanation: Without and within (all) beings, the 'unmoving' and also the 'moving' ; because of its  subtlety unknowable; and near and far away --- is That.

gita.Line1: अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम् |
gita.Line2: भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च ||१३-१७||
gita.Translation:
avibhaktaṃ ca bhūteṣu vibhaktamiva ca sthitam.
bhūtabhartṛ ca tajjñeyaṃ grasiṣṇu prabhaviṣṇu ca -13-17-
gita.Explanation: And undivided, yet He exists as if divided in beings; That is to be known as the Supporter of Beings; He devours and He generates.

gita.Line2: ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम् ||१३-१८||
gita.Translation:
jyotiṣāmapi tajjyotistamasaḥ paramucyate.
jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ jñānagamyaṃ hṛdi sarvasya viṣṭhitam -13-18-
gita.Explanation: That (BRAHMAN) , the Light-of-all lights, is said to be beyond darkness; (It is)  Knowledge, the Object-of-Knowledge, seated in the hearts of all, to be reached by Knowledge.

gita.Line1: इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासतः |
gita.Translation:
iti kṣetraṃ tathā jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ coktaṃ samāsataḥ.
madbhakta etadvijñāya madbhāvāyopapadyate -13-19-
gita.Explanation: Thus the Field, as well as the knowledge and the knowable have been briefly stated. Knowing this, My devotee enters into My Being.

gita.Translation:
prakṛtiṃ puruṣaṃ caiva viddhyanādi ubhāvapi.
vikārāṃśca guṇāṃścaiva viddhi prakṛtisambhavān -13-20-
gita.Explanation: Know you that Matter (PRAKRITI) and Spirit (PURUSHA) are both beginningless;  and know you also that all modifications and qualities are born of PRAKRITI.

gita.Translation:
kāryakāraṇakartṛtve hetuḥ prakṛtirucyate.
puruṣaḥ sukhaduḥkhānāṃ bhoktṛtve heturucyate -13-21-
gita.Explanation: In the production of the effect and the cause, PRAKRITI is said to be the cause; in the experience of pleasure and pain, PURUSHA is said to be the cause.

gita.Translation:
puruṣaḥ prakṛtistho hi bhuṅkte prakṛtijānguṇān.
kāraṇaṃ guṇasaṅgo.asya sadasadyonijanmasu -13-22-
gita.Explanation: The PURUSHA, seated in PRAKRITI, experiences the qualities born of PRAKRITI; attachment to the qualities is the cause of his birth in good and evil wombs.

gita.Translation:
upadraṣṭānumantā ca bhartā bhoktā maheśvaraḥ.
paramātmeti cāpyukto dehe.asminpuruṣaḥ paraḥ -13-23-
gita.Explanation: The supreme PURUSHA in this body is also called the Spectator, the Permitter, the  Supporter, the Enjoyer, the great Lord and the Supreme Self.

gita.Line1: य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणैः सह |
gita.Translation:
ya evaṃ vetti puruṣaṃ prakṛtiṃ ca guṇaiḥ saha.
sarvathā vartamāno.api na sa bhūyo.abhijāyate -13-24-
gita.Explanation: He who thus knows the PURUSHA and PRAKRITI together with the qualities, in  whatsoever condition he may be, he is not born again.

gita.Translation:
dhyānenātmani paśyanti kecidātmānamātmanā.
anye sāṅkhyena yogena karmayogena cāpare -13-25-
gita.Explanation: Some, by meditation, behold the Self in the Self by the Self; others by the 'YOGA -of-Knowledge' (by SANKHYA YOGA) ; and others by KARMA YOGA.

gita.Translation:
anye tvevamajānantaḥ śrutvānyebhya upāsate.
te.api cātitarantyeva mṛtyuṃ śrutiparāyaṇāḥ -13-26-
gita.Explanation: Others also, not knowing this, worship, having heard of it from others; they too, cross beyond death, if they would regard what they have heard as their Supreme Refuge.

gita.Translation:
yāvatsañjāyate kiñcitsattvaṃ sthāvarajaṅgamam.
kṣetrakṣetrajñasaṃyogāttadviddhi bharatarṣabha -13-27-
gita.Explanation: Wherever any being is born, the unmoving or the moving, know you, O best of the  Bharatas, that it is from the union between the 'Field' and the 'Knower-of-the-Field.'

gita.Translation:
samaṃ sarveṣu bhūteṣu tiṣṭhantaṃ parameśvaram.
vinaśyatsvavinaśyantaṃ yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati -13-28-
gita.Explanation: He sees, who sees the Supreme Lord existing equally in all beings, the unperishing  within the perishing.

gita.Line2: न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम् ||१३-२९||
gita.Translation:
samaṃ paśyanhi sarvatra samavasthitamīśvaram.
na hinastyātmanātmānaṃ tato yāti parāṃ gatim -13-29-
gita.Explanation: Indeed, he who sees the same Lord everywhere equally dwelling, destroys not the Self  by the Self; therefore, he goes to the Highest Goal.

gita.Translation:
prakṛtyaiva ca karmāṇi kriyamāṇāni sarvaśaḥ.
yaḥ paśyati tathātmānamakartāraṃ sa paśyati -13-30-
gita.Explanation: He sees, who sees that all actions are performed by PRAKRITI alone, and that the  Self is actionless.

gita.Line2: तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते तदा ||१३-३१||
gita.Translation:
yadā bhūtapṛthagbhāvamekasthamanupaśyati.
tata eva ca vistāraṃ brahma sampadyate tadā -13-31-
gita.Explanation: When he (man) sees the whole variety-of-beings, as resting in the One, and spreading  forth from That (One) alone, he then becomes BRAHMAN.

gita.Line2: शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते ||१३-३२||
gita.Translation:
anāditvānnirguṇatvātparamātmāyamavyayaḥ.
śarīrastho.api kaunteya na karoti na lipyate -13-32-
gita.Explanation: Being without beginning, and being devoid of qualities, the Supreme Self, the Imperishable, though dwelling in the body, O Kaunteya, neither acts, nor is tainted.

gita.Translation:
yathā sarvagataṃ saukṣmyādākāśaṃ nopalipyate.
sarvatrāvasthito dehe tathātmā nopalipyate -13-33-
gita.Explanation: As the all-pervading ether is not tainted, because of its subtlety, so too the Self, seated  everywhere in the body, is not tainted.

gita.Line2: क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नं प्रकाशयति भारत ||१३-३४||
gita.Translation:
yathā prakāśayatyekaḥ kṛtsnaṃ lokamimaṃ raviḥ.
kṣetraṃ kṣetrī tathā kṛtsnaṃ prakāśayati bhārata -13-34-
gita.Explanation: Just as the one Sun illumines the whole world, so also the Lord-of-the-Field  (PARAMATMAN) illumines the whole 'Field,' O Bharata.

gita.Line2: भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम् ||१३-३५||
gita.Translation:
kṣetrakṣetrajñayorevamantaraṃ jñānacakṣuṣā.
bhūtaprakṛtimokṣaṃ ca ye viduryānti te param -13-35-
gita.Explanation: They who, with their eye-of-wisdom come to know the distinction between the 'Field' and the' Knower-of-the-Field', and of the liberation from the 'PRAKRITI' of the being, go to the Supreme.

gita.Translation: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde kṣetrakṣetrajñavibhāgayogo nāma trayodaśo.adhyāyaḥ -13-36-
gita.Explanation: Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad-Geeta, in the Science of the  Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA, in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the  thirteenth discourse ends entitled: THE FIELD AND THE KNOWER-OF-THE-FIELD

gita.Line3: यज्ज्ञात्वा मुनयः सर्वे परां सिद्धिमितो गताः ||१४-१||
gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
paraṃ bhūyaḥ pravakṣyāmi jñānānāṃ jñānamuttamam.
yajjñātvā munayaḥ sarve parāṃ siddhimito gatāḥ -14-1-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said:I will again declare (to you) that Supreme Knowledge, the best of all knowledges, having known which, all the sages have attained Supreme Perfection after this life.

gita.Line2: सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च ||१४-२||
gita.Translation:
idaṃ jñānamupāśritya mama sādharmyamāgatāḥ.
sarge.api nopajāyante pralaye na vyathanti ca -14-2-
gita.Explanation: They who, having refuge in this 'Knowledge, ' have attained to My Being, are neither  born at the time of Creation, nor are they disturbed at the time of dissolution.

gita.Translation:
mama yonirmahad brahma tasmingarbhaṃ dadhāmyaham.
sambhavaḥ sarvabhūtānāṃ tato bhavati bhārata -14-3-
gita.Explanation: My womb is the great BRAHMAN (MULA PRAKRITI) ; in that I place the germ; from which, O Bharata, is the birth of all beings.

gita.Translation:
sarvayoniṣu kaunteya mūrtayaḥ sambhavanti yāḥ.
tāsāṃ brahma mahadyonirahaṃ bījapradaḥ pitā -14-4-
gita.Explanation: Whatever forms are produced, O Kaunteya, in all the wombs whatsoever, the great BRAHMA is their womb, and I the seed-giving Father.

gita.Translation:
sattvaṃ rajastama iti guṇāḥ prakṛtisambhavāḥ.
nibadhnanti mahābāho dehe dehinamavyayam -14-5-
gita.Explanation: Purity, passion, and inertia --- these qualities (GUNAS) , O! mighty-armed, born of  'PRAKRITI' bind, the Indestructible, Embodied one, fast in the body.

gita.Translation:
tatra sattvaṃ nirmalatvātprakāśakamanāmayam.
sukhasaṅgena badhnāti jñānasaṅgena cānagha -14-6-
gita.Explanation:
"Of these, "SATTWA" which because of its stainlessness, is luminous and healthy, (unobstructive).
It binds by (creating) attachment to 'happiness' and attachment to 'knowledge, ' O sinless one."

gita.Translation:
rajo rāgātmakaṃ viddhi tṛṣṇāsaṅgasamudbhavam.
tannibadhnāti kaunteya karmasaṅgena dehinam -14-7-
gita.Explanation: "Know thou "RAJAS" (to be) of the nature of passion, the source of thirst and attachment; it binds fast, O Kaunteya, the embodied one, by attachment to action."

gita.Translation:
tamastvajñānajaṃ viddhi mohanaṃ sarvadehinām.
pramādālasyanidrābhistannibadhnāti bhārata -14-8-
gita.Explanation: But, know thou TAMAS is born of ignorance, deluding all embodied beings, it binds  fast, O Bharata, by heedless-ness, indolence and sleep.

gita.Line1: सत्त्वं सुखे सञ्जयति रजः कर्मणि भारत |
gita.Translation:
sattvaṃ sukhe sañjayati rajaḥ karmaṇi bhārata.
jñānamāvṛtya tu tamaḥ pramāde sañjayatyuta -14-9-
gita.Explanation: SATTWA attaches to happiness, RAJAS to action, O Bharata, while TAMAS, verily,  shrouding knowledge, attaches to heedlessness.

gita.Line2: रजः सत्त्वं तमश्चैव तमः सत्त्वं रजस्तथा ||१४-१०||
gita.Translation:
rajastamaścābhibhūya sattvaṃ bhavati bhārata.
rajaḥ sattvaṃ tamaścaiva tamaḥ sattvaṃ rajastathā -14-10-
gita.Explanation: Now SATTWA rises (prevails) , O Bharata, having over-powered RAJAS and inertia (TAMAS) ; now RAJAS, having over-powered SATTWA and inertia; and inertia (TAMAS) , having over-powered SATTWA and RAJAS.

gita.Translation:
sarvadvāreṣu dehe.asminprakāśa upajāyate.
jñānaṃ yadā tadā vidyādvivṛddhaṃ sattvamityuta -14-11-
gita.Explanation: When, through every gate (sense) in this body, the light-of-intelligence shines, then it  may be known that 'SATTWA' is predominant.

gita.Translation:
lobhaḥ pravṛttirārambhaḥ karmaṇāmaśamaḥ spṛhā.
rajasyetāni jāyante vivṛddhe bharatarṣabha -14-12-
gita.Explanation: Greed, activity, undertaking of actions, restless-ness longing --- these arise when RAJAS is predominant, O best in the Bharata family.

gita.Translation:
aprakāśo.apravṛttiśca pramādo moha eva ca.
tamasyetāni jāyante vivṛddhe kurunandana -14-13-
gita.Explanation: Darkness, inertness, heedlessness and delusion --- these arise when 'TAMAS' is  predominant, O descendant-of-Kuru.

gita.Line1: यदा सत्त्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत् |
gita.Translation:
yadā sattve pravṛddhe tu pralayaṃ yāti dehabhṛt.
tadottamavidāṃ lokānamalānpratipadyate -14-14-
gita.Explanation: If the embodied one meets with death when SATTWA is predominant, then he attains  to the spotless worlds of the 'Knowers of the Highest. '

gita.Translation:
"rajasi pralayaṃ gatvā karmasaṅgiṣu jāyate.
tathā pralīnastamasi mūḍhayoniṣu jāyate -14-15-
gita.Explanation: "Meeting death in RAJAS, he is born among those attached to action; and dying in  TAMAS, he is born in the womb of the senseless.

gita.Translation:
karmaṇaḥ sukṛtasyāhuḥ sāttvikaṃ nirmalaṃ phalam.
rajasastu phalaṃ duḥkhamajñānaṃ tamasaḥ phalam -14-16-
gita.Explanation: The fruit of good action, they say, is SATTWIC and pure; verily, the fruit of RAJAS is  pain, and the fruit of TAMAS is ignorance.

gita.Line1: सत्त्वात्सञ्जायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च |
gita.Translation:
sattvātsañjāyate jñānaṃ rajaso lobha eva ca.
pramādamohau tamaso bhavato.ajñānameva ca -14-17-
gita.Explanation: Knowledge arises from SATTWA, greed from RAJAS, heedlessness, delusion and  also ignorance arise from TAMAS.

gita.Line1: ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्त्वस्था मध्ये तिष्ठन्ति राजसाः |
gita.Translation:
ūrdhvaṃ gacchanti sattvasthā madhye tiṣṭhanti rājasāḥ.
jaghanyaguṇavṛttisthā adho gacchanti tāmasāḥ -14-18-
gita.Explanation: Those who are abiding in SATTWA go upwards; the RAJASIC dwell in the middle; and the TAMASIC, abiding in the function of the lowest GUNA, go downwards.

gita.Translation:
nānyaṃ guṇebhyaḥ kartāraṃ yadā draṣṭānupaśyati.
guṇebhyaśca paraṃ vetti madbhāvaṃ so.adhigacchati -14-19-
gita.Explanation: When the Seer beholds no agent other than the GUNAS and knows him who is higher  than the GUNAS, he attains to My Being.

gita.Translation:
guṇānetānatītya trīndehī dehasamudbhavān.
janmamṛtyujarāduḥkhairvimukto.amṛtamaśnute -14-20-
gita.Explanation: The embodied-one having crossed beyond these three GUNAS out of which the body is evolved, is freed from birth, death, decay and pain, and attains to Immortality.

gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.
kairliṅgaistrīnguṇānetānatīto bhavati prabho.
kimācāraḥ kathaṃ caitāṃstrīnguṇānativartate -14-21-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said: What are the marks of him who has crossed over the three GUNAS, O Lord? What is  his conduct, and how does he go beyond these three GUNAS?

gita.Line2: प्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव |
gita.Line3: न द्वेष्टि सम्प्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ्क्षति ||१४-२२||
gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
prakāśaṃ ca pravṛttiṃ ca mohameva ca pāṇḍava.
na dveṣṭi sampravṛttāni na nivṛttāni kāṅkṣati -14-22-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said: Light, activity, and delusion, when present, O Pandava, he hates not, nor longs for  them when absent.

gita.Translation:
udāsīnavadāsīno guṇairyo na vicālyate.
guṇā vartanta ityevaṃ yo.avatiṣṭhati neṅgate -14-23-
gita.Explanation:
He who, seated like one unconcerned, is not moved by the 'GUNAS, ' who, knowing that the 'GUNAS' operate, is self-centred and swerves not.
.
.

gita.Translation:
samaduḥkhasukhaḥ svasthaḥ samaloṣṭāśmakāñcanaḥ.
tulyapriyāpriyo dhīrastulyanindātmasaṃstutiḥ -14-24-
gita.Explanation:
Alike in pleasure and pain; who dwells in the Self; to whom a clod of earth, a precious stone and gold are alike; to whom the dear and the not-dear are the same; firm; the same in censure and self-praise..
.
.

gita.Translation:
mānāpamānayostulyastulyo mitrāripakṣayoḥ.
sarvārambhaparityāgī guṇātītaḥ sa ucyate -14-25-
gita.Explanation: The same in honour and dishonour; the same to friend and foe; abandoning all  undertakings --- he is said to have crossed beyond the GUNAS.

gita.Translation:
māṃ ca yo.avyabhicāreṇa bhaktiyogena sevate.
sa guṇānsamatītyaitānbrahmabhūyāya kalpate -14-26-
gita.Explanation: And he, serving Me with unswerving devotion, and crossing beyond the GUNAS, is fit  to become BRAHMAN.

gita.Translation:
brahmaṇo hi pratiṣṭhāhamamṛtasyāvyayasya ca.
śāśvatasya ca dharmasya sukhasyaikāntikasya ca -14-27-
gita.Explanation: For I am the Abode of BRAHMAN, the Immortal and the Immutable, of everlasting  DHARMA and of Absolute Bliss.

gita.Translation: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde guṇatrayavibhāgayogo nāma caturdaśo.adhyāyaḥ -14-28-
gita.Explanation: Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad-Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in  the scripture of YOGA , in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the fourteenth  discourse ends entitled:  THE YOGA OF GUNAS

gita.Line3: छन्दांसि यस्य पर्णानि यस्तं वेद स वेदवित् ||१५-१||
gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
ūrdhvamūlamadhaḥśākhamaśvatthaṃ prāhuravyayam.
chandāṃsi yasya parṇāni yastaṃ veda sa vedavit -15-1-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said:They (wise people) speak of the indestructible ASHWATTHA tree as having its roots above and branches below, whose leaves are the VEDAS ; he who knows it, is alone a Veda-knower.

gita.Translation:
adhaścordhvaṃ prasṛtāstasya śākhā guṇapravṛddhā viṣayapravālāḥ.
adhaśca mūlānyanusantatāni karmānubandhīni manuṣyaloke -15-2-
gita.Explanation: Below and above are spread its branches, nourished by the GUNAS; sense-objects are its buds; and below, in the world of men, stretch forth the roots, originating in action.

gita.Translation:
na rūpamasyeha tathopalabhyate nānto na cādirna ca sampratiṣṭhā.
aśvatthamenaṃ suvirūḍhamūlaṃ asaṅgaśastreṇa dṛḍhena chittvā -15-3-
gita.Explanation:
Its form is not perceived here as such, neither its end, nor its origin, nor its foundation, nor its resting-place; having cut asunder this firm-rooted ASHWATTHA -tree with the strong axe of non-attachment..
.

gita.Translation:
tataḥ padaṃ tatparimārgitavyaṃ yasmingatā na nivartanti bhūyaḥ.
tameva cādyaṃ puruṣaṃ prapadye.
yataḥ pravṛttiḥ prasṛtā purāṇī -15-4-
gita.Explanation: Then that Goal should be sought after, where having gone, none returns again. I seek refuge in that 'primeval PURUSHA' from which streamed forth, from time immemorial, all activity (or energy).

gita.Translation:
nirmānamohā jitasaṅgadoṣā adhyātmanityā vinivṛttakāmāḥ.
dvandvairvimuktāḥ sukhaduḥkhasaṃjñaira- gacchantyamūḍhāḥ padamavyayaṃ tat -15-5-
gita.Explanation: Free from pride and delusion, victorious over the evil of attachment, dwelling constantly in the Self, their desires having completely retired, freed from the pairs-of-opposites --- such as pleasure and pain --- the undeluded reach that Goal Eternal.

gita.Line1: न तद्भासयते सूर्यो न शशाङ्को न पावकः |
gita.Line2: यद्गत्वा न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ||१५-६||
gita.Translation:
na tadbhāsayate sūryo na śaśāṅko na pāvakaḥ.
yadgatvā na nivartante taddhāma paramaṃ mama -15-6-
gita.Explanation: Nor does the Sun shine there, nor the moon, nor fire; to which having gone they return not; that is My Supreme Abode.

gita.Translation:
mamaivāṃśo jīvaloke jīvabhūtaḥ sanātanaḥ.
manaḥṣaṣṭhānīndriyāṇi prakṛtisthāni karṣati -15-7-
gita.Explanation: An eternal portion of Myself, having become a living soul in the world of life, and abiding in PRAKRITI, draws (to itself) the (five) senses, with mind for the sixth.

gita.Translation:
śarīraṃ yadavāpnoti yaccāpyutkrāmatīśvaraḥ.
gṛhitvaitāni saṃyāti vāyurgandhānivāśayāt -15-8-
gita.Explanation: When the Lord obtains a body, and when He leaves it, He takes these and goes (with them) as the wind takes the scents from their seats (the flowers).

gita.Line1: श्रोत्रं चक्षुः स्पर्शनं च रसनं घ्राणमेव च |
gita.Translation:
śrotraṃ cakṣuḥ sparśanaṃ ca rasanaṃ ghrāṇameva ca.
adhiṣṭhāya manaścāyaṃ viṣayānupasevate -15-9-
gita.Explanation: Presiding over the ear, the eye, the touch, the taste and the smell, so also the mind, He enjoys the sense-objects.

gita.Line1: उत्क्रामन्तं स्थितं वापि भुञ्जानं वा गुणान्वितम् |
gita.Translation:
utkrāmantaṃ sthitaṃ vāpi bhuñjānaṃ vā guṇānvitam.
vimūḍhā nānupaśyanti paśyanti jñānacakṣuṣaḥ -15-10-
gita.Explanation: Him, who departs, stays and enjoys, who is united with GUNAS, the deluded do not see; but they do behold Him, who posses the 'eye-of-Knowledge. '

gita.Translation:
yatanto yoginaścainaṃ paśyantyātmanyavasthitam.
yatanto.apyakṛtātmāno nainaṃ paśyantyacetasaḥ -15-11-
gita.Explanation: The seekers striving (for Perfection) behold Him dwelling in the Self; but, the unrefined and unitelligent, even though striving, see Him not.

gita.Translation:
yadādityagataṃ tejo jagadbhāsayate.akhilam.
yaccandramasi yaccāgnau tattejo viddhi māmakam -15-12-
gita.Explanation: That Light which is residing in the Sun and which illumines the whole world, and that which is in the moon and in the fire --- know that Light to be Mine.

gita.Line2: पुष्णामि चौषधीः सर्वाः सोमो भूत्वा रसात्मकः ||१५-१३||
gita.Translation:
gāmāviśya ca bhūtāni dhārayāmyahamojasā.
puṣṇāmi cauṣadhīḥ sarvāḥ somo bhūtvā rasātmakaḥ -15-13-
gita.Explanation: Permeating the earth I support all beings by (My) energy; and having become the liquid moon, I nourish all herbs.

gita.Translation:
ahaṃ vaiśvānaro bhūtvā prāṇināṃ dehamāśritaḥ.
prāṇāpānasamāyuktaḥ pacāmyannaṃ caturvidham -15-14-
gita.Explanation: Having become (the Fire) VAISHVAANARA , I abide in the body of beings, and associated with PRANA and APANA, digest the four-fold food.

gita.Translation:
sarvasya cāhaṃ hṛdi sanniviṣṭo mattaḥ smṛtirjñānamapohanañca.
vedaiśca sarvairahameva vedyo vedāntakṛdvedavideva cāham -15-15-
gita.Explanation: And I am seated in the hearts of all, from Me are memory, knowledge, as well as their absence. I am verily that which has to be known in all the VEDAS; I am indeed the author of VEDANTA, and, the knower of the VEDAS am I.

gita.Line1: द्वाविमौ पुरुषौ लोके क्षरश्चाक्षर एव च |
gita.Translation:
dvāvimau puruṣau loke kṣaraścākṣara eva ca.
kṣaraḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni kūṭastho.akṣara ucyate -15-16-
gita.Explanation: Two 'PURUSHAS' are there in this world, the Perishable and the Imperishable. All beings are the Perishable and the 'KOOTASTHAH' is called the Imperishable.

gita.Translation:
uttamaḥ puruṣastvanyaḥ paramātmetyudhāhṛtaḥ.
yo lokatrayamāviśya bibhartyavyaya īśvaraḥ -15-17-
gita.Explanation: But distinct is the Supreme PURUSHA called the Highest Self, the Indestructible Lord, who, pervading the three worlds (waking, dream and deep-sleep) , sustains them.

gita.Line2: अतोऽस्मि लोके वेदे च प्रथितः पुरुषोत्तमः ||१५-१८||
gita.Translation:
yasmātkṣaramatīto.ahamakṣarādapi cottamaḥ.
ato.asmi loke vedeca prathitaḥ puruṣottamaḥ -15-18-
gita.Explanation: As I transcend the perishable and I am even Higher than the Imperishable, I am declared as the PURUSHOTTAMA (the Highest -PURUSHA) in the world and in the VEDAS.

gita.Translation:
yo māmevamasammūḍho jānāti puruṣottamam.
sa sarvavidbhajati māṃ sarvabhāvena bhārata -15-19-
gita.Explanation: He who undeluded, thus knows Me, the Supreme PURUSHA , he, all-knowing, worships Me with his whole being, O Bharata.

gita.Translation:
iti guhyatamaṃ śāstramidamuktaṃ mayānagha.
etadbuddhvā buddhimānsyātkṛtakṛtyaśca bhārata -15-20-
gita.Explanation: Thus, this most secret science (teaching) , has been taught by Me, O sinless one. On knowing this (a man) becomes 'wise' , and all his duties are accomplished, O Bharata.

gita.Translation: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjuna saṃvāde puruṣottamayogo nāma pañcadaśo.adhyāyaḥ -15-21-
gita.Explanation: Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad-Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA, in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the fifteenth discourse ends entitled:  THE YOGA OF THE SUPREME SPIRIT

gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
abhayaṃ sattvasaṃśuddhirjñānayogavyavasthitiḥ.
dānaṃ damaśca yajñaśca svādhyāyastapa ārjavam -16-1-
gita.Explanation:
The Blessed Lord said: Fearlessness, purity of heart, steadfastness in the YOGA -of-Knowledge, alms-giving, control of the senses, sacrifice, study of the SHASTRAS, and straightforwardness.
.
.

gita.Translation:
ahiṃsā satyamakrodhastyāgaḥ śāntirapaiśunam.
dayā bhūteṣvaloluptvaṃ mārdavaṃ hrīracāpalam -16-2-
gita.Explanation:
Harmlessness, truth, absence of anger, renunciation, peacefulness, absence of crookedness, compassion to beings, non-covetousness, gentleness, modesty, absence of fickle-ness.
.
.

gita.Translation:
tejaḥ kṣamā dhṛtiḥ śaucamadroho nātimānitā.
bhavanti sampadaṃ daivīmabhijātasya bhārata -16-3-
gita.Explanation: Vigour, forgiveness, fortitude, purity, absence of hatred, absence of pride --- these belong to the one born for the Divine Estate, O Bharata.

gita.Translation:
dambho darpo.abhimānaśca krodhaḥ pāruṣyameva ca.
ajñānaṃ cābhijātasya pārtha sampadamāsurīm -16-4-
gita.Explanation: Hypocrisy, arrogance and self-conceit, anger, and also harshness and ignorance, belong to one who is born, O Partha, for a demoniac-Estate.

gita.Translation:
daivī sampadvimokṣāya nibandhāyāsurī matā.
mā śucaḥ sampadaṃ daivīmabhijāto.asi pāṇḍava -16-5-
gita.Explanation: The divine nature is deemed for liberation, the demoniacal for bondage; grieve not, O Pandava, you are born with divine qualities.

gita.Line1: द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च |
gita.Line2: दैवो विस्तरशः प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे शृणु ||१६-६||
gita.Translation:
dvau bhūtasargau loke.asmindaiva āsura eva ca.
daivo vistaraśaḥ prokta āsuraṃ pārtha me śṛṇu -16-6-
gita.Explanation: There are two types of beings, in this world, the 'divine' and the 'demoniacal; ' the divine have been described at length; hear from Me, O Partha, of the demoniacal.

gita.Line1: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुराः |
gita.Line2: न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते ||१६-७||
gita.Translation:
pravṛttiṃ ca nivṛttiṃ ca janā na vidurāsurāḥ.
na śaucaṃ nāpi cācāro na satyaṃ teṣu vidyate -16-7-
gita.Explanation: The demoniac know not what to do and what to refrain from; neither purity, nor right conduct, nor truth is found in them.

gita.Translation:
asatyamapratiṣṭhaṃ te jagadāhuranīśvaram.
aparasparasambhūtaṃ kimanyatkāmahaitukam -16-8-
gita.Explanation: They say, the universe is without truth, without (moral) basis, without a God; not brought about by any regular causal sequence, with lust for its cause; what else?

gita.Translation:
etāṃ dṛṣṭimavaṣṭabhya naṣṭātmāno.alpabuddhayaḥ.
prabhavantyugrakarmāṇaḥ kṣayāya jagato.ahitāḥ -16-9-
gita.Explanation: Holding this view, these ruined souls of small intellect and fierce deeds, come forth as the enemies of the world, for its destruction.

gita.Translation:
kāmamāśritya duṣpūraṃ dambhamānamadānvitāḥ.
mohādgṛhītvāsadgrāhānpravartante.aśucivratāḥ -16-10-
gita.Explanation: Filled with insatiable desires, full of hypocrisy, pride and arrogance, holding evil ideas through delusion, they work with impure resolves.

gita.Translation:
cintāmaparimeyāṃ ca pralayāntāmupāśritāḥ.
kāmopabhogaparamā etāvaditi niścitāḥ -16-11-
gita.Explanation: Giving themselves over to immeasurable cares ending only with death, regarding gratification of lust as their highest aim, and feeling sure that, that is all (that matters).

gita.Translation:
āśāpāśaśatairbaddhāḥ kāmakrodhaparāyaṇāḥ.
īhante kāmabhogārthamanyāyenārthasañcayān -16-12-
gita.Explanation: Bound by a hundred ties of hope, given to lust and anger, they do strive to obtain, by unlawful means, hoards of wealth for sensual enjoyments.

gita.Translation:
idamadya mayā labdhamimaṃ prāpsye manoratham.
idamastīdamapi me bhaviṣyati punardhanam -16-13-
gita.Explanation: This has to-day been gained by me --- this desire I shall obtain --- this is mine --- and this wealth shall also be mine in future.

gita.Translation:
asau mayā hataḥ śatrurhaniṣye cāparānapi.
īśvaro.ahamahaṃ bhogī siddho.ahaṃ balavānsukhī -16-14-
gita.Explanation: That enemy has been slain by me --- and others also shall I destroy --- I am the Lord --- I am the enjoyer --- I am perfect, powerful and happy.

gita.Translation:
āḍhyo.abhijanavānasmi ko.anyo.asti sadṛśo mayā.
yakṣye dāsyāmi modiṣya ityajñānavimohitāḥ -16-15-
gita.Explanation: I am rich and well-born --- Who else is equal to me? --- I will give (alms, money) --- I will rejoice.  Thus are they, deluded by 'ignorance. '

gita.Translation:
anekacittavibhrāntā mohajālasamāvṛtāḥ.
prasaktāḥ kāmabhogeṣu patanti narake.aśucau -16-16-
gita.Explanation: Bewildered by many a fancy, entangled in the snare of delusion, addicted to the gratification of lust, they fall into a foul hell.

gita.Translation:
ātmasambhāvitāḥ stabdhā dhanamānamadānvitāḥ.
yajante nāmayajñaiste dambhenāvidhipūrvakam -16-17-
gita.Explanation: Self-conceited, stubborn, filled with pride and drunk with wealth, they perform sacrifices in name (only) out of ostentation, contrary to scriptural ordinance.

gita.Line1: अहंकारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिताः |
gita.Translation:
ahaṃkāraṃ balaṃ darpaṃ kāmaṃ krodhaṃ ca saṃśritāḥ.
māmātmaparadeheṣu pradviṣanto.abhyasūyakāḥ -16-18-
gita.Explanation: Given to egoism, power, haughtiness, lust and anger, these malicious people hate Me in their own bodies, and in those of others.

gita.Translation:
tānahaṃ dviṣataḥ krurānsaṃsāreṣu narādhamān.
kṣipāmyajasramaśubhānāsurīṣveva yoniṣu -16-19-
gita.Explanation: These cruel haters, worst among men in the world, I hurl these evil-doers for ever into the wombs of the demons only.

gita.Translation:
āsurīṃ yonimāpannā mūḍhā janmani janmani.
māmaprāpyaiva kaunteya tato yāntyadhamāṃ gatim -16-20-
gita.Explanation: Entering into demoniacal wombs, and deluded, not attaining to Me, birth after birth, they thus fall, O Kaunteya, into a condition still lower than that.

gita.Translation:
trividhaṃ narakasyedaṃ dvāraṃ nāśanamātmanaḥ.
kāmaḥ krodhastathā lobhastasmādetattrayaṃ tyajet -16-21-
gita.Explanation: These three are the gates of hell, destructive of the Self --- lust, anger and greed; therefore, one should abandon these three.

gita.Translation:
etairvimuktaḥ kaunteya tamodvāraistribhirnaraḥ.
ācaratyātmanaḥ śreyastato yāti parāṃ gatim -16-22-
gita.Explanation: A man who is liberated from these three gates to darkness, O Kaunteya, practises what is good for him and thus goes to the Supreme Goal.

gita.Line2: न स सिद्धिमवाप्नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम् ||१६-२३||
gita.Translation:
yaḥ śāstravidhimutsṛjya vartate kāmakārataḥ.
na sa siddhimavāpnoti na sukhaṃ na parāṃ gatim -16-23-
gita.Explanation: He who, having cast aside the ordinance of the scriptures, acts under the impulse of desire, attains neither perfection, nor happiness, nor the Supreme Goal.

gita.Translation:
tasmācchāstraṃ pramāṇaṃ te kāryākāryavyavasthitau.
jñātvā śāstravidhānoktaṃ karma kartumihārhasi -16-24-
gita.Explanation: Therefore, let the Scriptures be your authority, in determining what ought to be done and what ought not to be done. Having known what is said in the commandments of the Scripture, you should act here (in this world).

gita.Translation: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde daivāsurasampadvibhāgayogo nāma ṣoḍaśo.adhyāyaḥ -16-25-
gita.Explanation: Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad-Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA, in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the sixteenth discourse ends entitled: THE DIVINE AND THE DEVILISH ESTATES

gita.Line3: तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तमः ||१७-१||
gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.
ye śāstravidhimutsṛjya yajante śraddhayānvitāḥ.
teṣāṃ niṣṭhā tu kā kṛṣṇa sattvamāho rajastamaḥ -17-1-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said: Those who, setting aside the ordinances of the scriptures, perform sacrifice with faith, what is their condition, O Krishna? Is it SATTWA, RAJAS or TAMAS?

gita.Line2: त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा |
gita.Line3: सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु ||१७-२||
gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
trividhā bhavati śraddhā dehināṃ sā svabhāvajā.
sāttvikī rājasī caiva tāmasī ceti tāṃ śṛṇu -17-2-
gita.Explanation:
The Blessed Lord said: Three-fold is the faith of the embodied, which is inherent in their nature --- the SATTWIC (pure) , the RAJASIC (passionate) and the TAMASIC (dull, dark).
Thus thou hear of it.

gita.Line2: श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्धः स एव सः ||१७-३||
gita.Translation:
sattvānurūpā sarvasya śraddhā bhavati bhārata.
śraddhāmayo.ayaṃ puruṣo yo yacchraddhaḥ sa eva saḥ -17-3-
gita.Explanation: The faith of each is in accordance with his nature, O Bharata. Man consists of his faith; as a man's faith is, so is he.

gita.Translation:
yajante sāttvikā devānyakṣarakṣāṃsi rājasāḥ.
pretānbhūtagaṇāṃścānye yajante tāmasā janāḥ -17-4-
gita.Explanation: The SATTWIC , or 'pure' men, worship the gods (DEVAS) ; the RAJASIC or the 'passionate,' the YAKSHAS and the RAKSHASAS; the others --- TAMASIC people, or the 'dark or dull' folk, worship the ghosts (PRETAS) and the hosts of BHUTAS, or the nature/spirits.

gita.Line1: अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जनाः |
gita.Translation:
aśāstravihitaṃ ghoraṃ tapyante ye tapo janāḥ.
dambhāhaṃkārasaṃyuktāḥ kāmarāgabalānvitāḥ -17-5-
gita.Explanation:
Those men who practice terrific austerities, not enjoined by the scriptures, given to hypocrisy and egoism, impelled by the force of lust and attachment.
.
.

gita.Translation:
karṣayantaḥ śarīrasthaṃ bhūtagrāmamacetasaḥ.
māṃ caivāntaḥśarīrasthaṃ tānviddhyāsuraniścayān -17-6-
gita.Explanation: Senselessly torturing all the elements in the body, and Me also who dwells within the body --- you may know these to be of 'demoniacal' resolves.

gita.Translation:
āhārastvapi sarvasya trividho bhavati priyaḥ.
yajñastapastathā dānaṃ teṣāṃ bhedamimaṃ śṛṇu -17-7-
gita.Explanation: The food also which is dear to each is three-fold, as also sacrifice, austerity and alms-giving. You may now hear the distinction of these.

gita.Line2: रस्याः स्निग्धाः स्थिरा हृद्या आहाराः सात्त्विकप्रियाः ||१७-८||
gita.Translation:
āyuḥsattvabalārogyasukhaprītivivardhanāḥ.
rasyāḥ snigdhāḥ sthirā hṛdyā āhārāḥ sāttvikapriyāḥ -17-8-
gita.Explanation: The foods which increase life, purity, strength, health, joy and cheerfulness (good appetite) , which are savory and oleaginous, substantial and agreeable, are dear to the SATTWIC (Pure).

gita.Translation:
kaṭvamlalavaṇātyuṣṇatīkṣṇarūkṣavidāhinaḥ.
āhārā rājasasyeṣṭā duḥkhaśokāmayapradāḥ -17-9-
gita.Explanation: The foods that are bitter, sour, saline, excessively hot, pungent, dry and burning, are liked by the RAJASIC , and are productive of pain, grief and disease.

gita.Line1: यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत् |
gita.Translation:
yātayāmaṃ gatarasaṃ pūti paryuṣitaṃ ca yat.
ucchiṣṭamapi cāmedhyaṃ bhojanaṃ tāmasapriyam -17-10-
gita.Explanation: That which is stale, tasteless, putrid and rotten, refuse and impure, is the food liked by the 'TAMASIC. '

gita.Translation:
aphalāṅkṣibhiryajño vidhidṛṣṭo ya ijyate.
yaṣṭavyameveti manaḥ samādhāya sa sāttvikaḥ -17-11-
gita.Explanation: That sacrifice which is offered by men without desire for fruit, and as enjoined by ordinance, with a firm faith that sacrifice is a duty, is SATTWIC or 'pure. '

gita.Line1: अभिसन्धाय तु फलं दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत् |
gita.Line2: इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम् ||१७-१२||
gita.Translation:
abhisandhāya tu phalaṃ dambhārthamapi caiva yat.
ijyate bharataśreṣṭha taṃ yajñaṃ viddhi rājasam -17-12-
gita.Explanation: The sacrifice which is offered, O best of the Bharatas, seeking for fruit and for ostentation, you may know that to be a RAJASIC YAJNA.

gita.Translation:
vidhihīnamasṛṣṭānnaṃ mantrahīnamadakṣiṇam.
śraddhāvirahitaṃ yajñaṃ tāmasaṃ paricakṣate -17-13-
gita.Explanation: They declare that sacrifice to be TAMASIC which is contrary to the ordinances, in which no food is distributed, which is devoid of MANTRAS and gifts, and which is devoid of faith.

gita.Translation:
devadvijaguruprājñapūjanaṃ śaucamārjavam.
brahmacaryamahiṃsā ca śārīraṃ tapa ucyate -17-14-
gita.Explanation: Worship of the gods, the twice-born, the teachers and the 'wise' ; purity, straight-forwardness, celibacy, and non-injury; these are called the 'austerity of the body. '

gita.Line1: अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत् |
gita.Translation:
anudvegakaraṃ vākyaṃ satyaṃ priyahitaṃ ca yat.
svādhyāyābhyasanaṃ caiva vāṅmayaṃ tapa ucyate -17-15-
gita.Explanation: Speech which causes no excitement, and is truthful, pleasant and beneficial, and the practice of the study of the VEDAS, these constitute the 'austerity of speech.'

gita.Translation:
manaḥ prasādaḥ saumyatvaṃ maunamātmavinigrahaḥ.
bhāvasaṃśuddhirityetattapo mānasamucyate -17-16-
gita.Explanation: Serenity of mind, good-heartedness, silence, self-control, purity of nature --- these together are called the 'mental austerity.'

gita.Translation:
śraddhayā parayā taptaṃ tapastattrividhaṃ naraiḥ.
aphalākāṅkṣibhiryuktaiḥ sāttvikaṃ paricakṣate -17-17-
gita.Explanation: This three-fold austerity, practiced by steadfast men, with the utmost faith, desiring no fruit, they call 'SATTWIC. '

gita.Translation:
satkāramānapūjārthaṃ tapo dambhena caiva yat.
kriyate tadiha proktaṃ rājasaṃ calamadhruvam -17-18-
gita.Explanation: The austerity which is practiced with the object of gaining good reception, honor and worship, and with hypocrisy, is here said to be RAJASIC, unstable and transitory.

gita.Translation:
mūḍhagrāheṇātmano yatpīḍayā kriyate tapaḥ.
parasyotsādanārthaṃ vā tattāmasamudāhṛtam -17-19-
gita.Explanation: That austerity which is practiced with self-torture, out of some foolish notion, for the purpose of destroying another, is declared to be TAMASIC.

gita.Line2: देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम् ||१७-२०||
gita.Translation:
dātavyamiti yaddānaṃ dīyate.anupakāriṇe.
deśe kāle ca pātre ca taddānaṃ sāttvikaṃ smṛtam -17-20-
gita.Explanation: That gift which is given, knowing it to be a duty, in a fit time and place, to a worthy person, from whom we expect nothing in return, is held to be SATTWIC.

gita.Line2: दीयते च परिक्लिष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम् ||१७-२१||
gita.Translation:
yattu pratyupakārārthaṃ phalamuddiśya vā punaḥ.
dīyate ca parikliṣṭaṃ taddānaṃ rājasaṃ smṛtam -17-21-
gita.Explanation: And that gift which is given with a view to receiving in return, or looking for fruit again, or reluctantly, is held to be RAJASIC.

gita.Translation:
adeśakāle yaddānamapātrebhyaśca dīyate.
asatkṛtamavajñātaṃ tattāmasamudāhṛtam -17-22-
gita.Explanation: The gift that is given at a wrong place and time, to unworthy persons, without respect, or with insult, is declared to be TAMASIC.

gita.Translation:
OMtatsaditi nirdeśo brahmaṇastrividhaḥ smṛtaḥ.
brāhmaṇāstena vedāśca yajñāśca vihitāḥ purā -17-23-
gita.Explanation: OM TAT SAT --- this has been declared to be the triple designation of BRAHMAN. By that were created formerly, the BRAHMANAS, VEDAS and YAJNAS (sacrifices).

gita.Translation:
tasmādomityudāhṛtya yajñadānatapaḥkriyāḥ.
pravartante vidhānoktāḥ satataṃ brahmavādinām -17-24-
gita.Explanation: Therefore, with the utterance of 'OM' are begun the acts of sacrifice, gifts and austerity as enjoined in the scriptures, always by the students of BRAHMAN.

gita.Translation:
tadityanabhisandhāya phalaṃ yajñatapaḥkriyāḥ.
dānakriyāśca vividhāḥ kriyante mokṣakāṅkṣibhiḥ -17-25-
gita.Explanation: Uttering 'TAT' without aiming at the fruits, are the acts of sacrifice and austerity and the various acts of gift performed by the seekers of liberation.

gita.Line2: प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्दः पार्थ युज्यते ||१७-२६||
gita.Translation:
sadbhāve sādhubhāve ca sadityetatprayujyate.
praśaste karmaṇi tathā sacchabdaḥ pārtha yujyate -17-26-
gita.Explanation: "The word 'SAT' is used in the sense of Reality and of Goodness; and also, O Partha, the word "SAT" is used in the sense of an auspicious act."

gita.Line1: यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थितिः सदिति चोच्यते |
gita.Translation:
yajñe tapasi dāne ca sthitiḥ saditi cocyate.
karma caiva tadarthīyaṃ sadityevābhidhīyate -17-27-
gita.Explanation: Steadfastness in sacrifice, austerity and gift is also called 'SAT' and also, action in connection with these (for the sake of the Supreme) is called 'SAT. '

gita.Line1: अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत् |
gita.Line2: असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह ||१७-२८||
gita.Translation:
aśraddhayā hutaṃ dattaṃ tapastaptaṃ kṛtaṃ ca yat.
asadityucyate pārtha na ca tatprepya no iha -17-28-
gita.Explanation: Whatever is sacrificed, given or performed, and whatever austerity is practiced without faith, it is called 'A-SAT, ' O Partha; it is not for here or hereafter (after death).

gita.Translation: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde śraddhātrayavibhāgayogo nāma saptadaśo.adhyāyaḥ -17-29-
gita.Explanation: Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad-Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA, in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the seventeenth discourse ends entitled: THE THREE-FOLD FAITH

gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.
saṃnyāsasya mahābāho tattvamicchāmi veditum.
tyāgasya ca hṛṣīkeśa pṛthakkeśiniṣūdana -18-1-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said:I desire to know severally, O mighty-armed, the essence or truth of 'Renunciation,'O Hrishikesa, as also of 'Abandonment, ' O slayer of Keshi (Krishna).

gita.Line2: काम्यानां कर्मणां न्यासं संन्यासं कवयो विदुः |
gita.Translation:
śrībhagavānuvāca.
kāmyānāṃ karmaṇāṃ nyāsaṃ saṃnyāsaṃ kavayo viduḥ.
sarvakarmaphalatyāgaṃ prāhustyāgaṃ vicakṣaṇāḥ -18-2-
gita.Explanation: The Blessed Lord said: The Sages understand SAMNYASA to be 'the renunciation of works with desire' ;the wise declare 'the abandonment of the fruits of all actions' as TYAAGA.

gita.Translation:
tyājyaṃ doṣavadityeke karma prāhurmanīṣiṇaḥ.
yajñadānatapaḥkarma na tyājyamiti cāpare -18-3-
gita.Explanation: That all actions should be abandoned as evil, declare some philosophers; while others (declare) that acts of sacrifice, gift and austerity should not be relinquished.

gita.Line1: निश्चयं शृणु मे तत्र त्यागे भरतसत्तम |
gita.Translation:
niścayaṃ śṛṇu me tatra tyāge bharatasattama.
tyāgo hi puruṣavyāghra trividhaḥ samprakīrtitaḥ -18-4-
gita.Explanation: Hear from Me the conclusion or the final truth, about this 'abandonment, ' O best of the Bharatas; 'abandonment, ' verily, O best of men, has been declared to be of three  kinds.

gita.Translation:
yajñadānatapaḥkarma na tyājyaṃ kāryameva tat.
yajño dānaṃ tapaścaiva pāvanāni manīṣiṇām -18-5-
gita.Explanation: Acts of sacrifice, charity and austerity should not be abandoned, but should be performed; worship, charity, and also austerity, are the purifiers of even the 'wise. '

gita.Line1: एतान्यपि तु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलानि च |
gita.Translation:
etānyapi tu karmāṇi saṅgaṃ tyaktvā phalāni ca.
kartavyānīti me pārtha niścitaṃ matamuttamam -18-6-
gita.Explanation: But even these actions should be performed leaving aside attachment and the fruits, O Partha; this is my certain and best belief.

gita.Translation:
niyatasya tu saṃnyāsaḥ karmaṇo nopapadyate.
mohāttasya parityāgastāmasaḥ parikīrtitaḥ -18-7-
gita.Explanation: Verily, the renunciation of 'obligatory actions' is not proper; the abandonment of the same from delusion is declared to be TAMASIC (dull).

gita.Line2: स कृत्वा राजसं त्यागं नैव त्यागफलं लभेत् ||१८-८||
gita.Translation:
duḥkhamityeva yatkarma kāyakleśabhayāttyajet.
sa kṛtvā rājasaṃ tyāgaṃ naiva tyāgaphalaṃ labhet -18-8-
gita.Explanation: He who, from fear of bodily trouble, abandons action because it is painful, thus performing a RAJASIC (passionate) abandonment, obtains not the fruit of 'abandonment.'

gita.Line2: सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलं चैव स त्यागः सात्त्विको मतः ||१८-९||
gita.Translation:
kāryamityeva yatkarma niyataṃ kriyate.arjuna.
saṅgaṃ tyaktvā phalaṃ caiva sa tyāgaḥ sāttviko mataḥ -18-9-
gita.Explanation: Whatever 'obligatory action' is done, O Arjuna, merely because it ought to be done,abandoning 'attachment and also fruit,' that abandonment is regarded as SATTWIC (pure).

gita.Translation:
na dveṣṭyakuśalaṃ karma kuśale nānuṣajjate.
tyāgī sattvasamāviṣṭo medhāvī chinnasaṃśayaḥ -18-10-
gita.Explanation: The abandoner, soaked in purity, being intelligent, with all his doubts cut asunder, hates not disagreeable action, nor is he attached to an agreeable action.

gita.Line1: न हि देहभृता शक्यं त्यक्तुं कर्माण्यशेषतः |
gita.Translation:
na hi dehabhṛtā śakyaṃ tyaktuṃ karmāṇyaśeṣataḥ.
yastu karmaphalatyāgī sa tyāgītyabhidhīyate -18-11-
gita.Explanation: Verily, it is not possible for an embodied being to abandon actions entirely, but he who relinquishes 'the fruits of actions' is verily called a 'relinquisher' (TYAAGI).

gita.Line1: अनिष्टमिष्टं मिश्रं च त्रिविधं कर्मणः फलम् |
gita.Line2: भवत्यत्यागिनां प्रेत्य न तु संन्यासिनां क्वचित् ||१८-१२||
gita.Translation:
aniṣṭamiṣṭaṃ miśraṃ ca trividhaṃ karmaṇaḥ phalam.
bhavatyatyāgināṃ pretya na tu saṃnyāsināṃ kvacit -18-12-
gita.Explanation: The threefold fruit of action, evil, good and mixed-accrues, after death, only to those who have no spirit of 'abandonment' ; never to total relinquishers.

gita.Translation:
pañcaitāni mahābāho kāraṇāni nibodha me.
sāṅkhye kṛtānte proktāni siddhaye sarvakarmaṇām -18-13-
gita.Explanation: Learn from Me, O mighty-armed, these five causes for the accomplishment of all actions, as declared in the SANKHYA (UPANISHAD) system, which is the end of all  actions.

gita.Line1: अधिष्ठानं तथा कर्ता करणं च पृथग्विधम् |
gita.Translation:
dhiṣṭhānaṃ tathā kartā karaṇaṃ ca pṛthagvidham.
vividhāśca pṛthakceṣṭā daivaṃ caivātra pañcamam -18-14-
gita.Explanation: The 'seat' (body) , the doer (ego) , the various organs-of-perception, the different functions of various organs-of-action, and also the presiding deity, the fifth.

gita.Line2: न्याय्यं वा विपरीतं वा पञ्चैते तस्य हेतवः ||१८-१५||
gita.Translation:
śarīravāṅmanobhiryatkarma prārabhate naraḥ.
nyāyyaṃ vā viparītaṃ vā pañcaite tasya hetavaḥ -18-15-
gita.Explanation: Whatever action a man performs by his body, speech and mind --- whether right, or the reverse --- these five are its causes.

gita.Line1: तत्रैवं सति कर्तारमात्मानं केवलं तु यः |
gita.Translation:
tatraivaṃ sati kartāramātmānaṃ kevalaṃ tu yaḥ.
paśyatyakṛtabuddhitvānna sa paśyati durmatiḥ -18-16-
gita.Explanation: Now, such being the case, verily he who --- owing to his untrained understanding ---looks upon his Self, which is 'alone' (never conditioned by the 'engine' ) , as the doer, he, of perverted intelligence, sees not.

gita.Line1: यस्य नाहंकृतो भावो बुद्धिर्यस्य न लिप्यते |
gita.Line2: हत्वाऽपि स इमाँल्लोकान्न हन्ति न निबध्यते ||१८-१७||
gita.Translation:
yasya nāhaṃkṛto bhāvo buddhiryasya na lipyate.
hatvā.api sa imā.Nllokānna hanti na nibadhyate -18-17-
gita.Explanation: He who is free from the egoistic notion, whose intelligence is not tainted (by good or evil) , though he slays these people, he slays not, nor is he bound (by the action).

gita.Translation:
jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ parijñātā trividhā karmacodanā.
karaṇaṃ karma karteti trividhaḥ karmasaṃgrahaḥ -18-18-
gita.Explanation: Knowledge, the known and knower form the three-fold 'impulse to action' ; the organs, the action, the agent, form the three-fold 'basis of action'.

gita.Line1: ज्ञानं कर्म च कर्ताच त्रिधैव गुणभेदतः |
gita.Translation:
jñānaṃ karma ca kartāca tridhaiva guṇabhedataḥ.
procyate guṇasaṅkhyāne yathāvacchṛṇu tānyapi -18-19-
gita.Explanation: 'Knowledge, ' 'action, ' and 'actor' are declared in the Science of Temperaments (gunas) to be of three kinds only, according to the distinctions of temperaments; hear them also duly.

gita.Translation:
sarvabhūteṣu yenaikaṃ bhāvamavyayamīkṣate.
avibhaktaṃ vibhakteṣu tajjñānaṃ viddhi sāttvikam -18-20-
gita.Explanation: That by which one sees the one indestructible reality in all beings, undivided in the divided, know that 'knowledge' as SATTWIC (Pure).

gita.Line2: वेत्ति सर्वेषु भूतेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि राजसम् ||१८-२१||
gita.Translation:
pṛthaktvena tu yajjñānaṃ nānābhāvānpṛthagvidhān.
vetti sarveṣu bhūteṣu tajjñānaṃ viddhi rājasam -18-21-
gita.Explanation: But that 'knowledge' which sees in all beings various entities of distinct kinds, (and) as different from one another, know that knowledge as RAJASIC (Passionate).

gita.Translation:
yattu kṛtsnavadekasminkārye saktamahaitukam.
atattvārthavadalpaṃ ca tattāmasamudāhṛtam -18-22-
gita.Explanation: But that 'knowledge', which clings to one single effect, as if it were the whole, without reason, without foundation in truth and narrow, that is declared to be TAMASIC (Dull).

gita.Translation:
niyataṃ saṅgarahitamarāgadveṣataḥ kṛtam.
aphalaprepsunā karma yattatsāttvikamucyate -18-23-
gita.Explanation: An 'action' which is ordained, which is free from attachment, which is done without love or hatred, by one who is not desirous of the fruit, that action is declared to be SATTWIC (pure).

gita.Line1: यत्तु कामेप्सुना कर्म साहंकारेण वा पुनः |
gita.Translation:
yattu kāmepsunā karma sāhaṃkāreṇa vā punaḥ.
kriyate bahulāyāsaṃ tadrājasamudāhṛtam -18-24-
gita.Explanation: But that 'action' which is done by one, longing for desires, or gain, done with egoism, or with much effort, is declared to be RAJASIC (Passionate).

gita.Translation:
anubandhaṃ kṣayaṃ hiṃsāmanapekṣya ca pauruṣam.
mohādārabhyate karma yattattāmasamucyate -18-25-
gita.Explanation: That 'action' which is undertaken from delusion, without regard for the consequence, loss, injury, and ability, is declared to be TAMASIC (dull).

gita.Translation:
muktasaṅgo.anahaṃvādī dhṛtyutsāhasamanvitaḥ.
siddhyasiddhyornirvikāraḥ kartā sāttvika ucyate -18-26-
gita.Explanation: An 'agent' who is free from attachment, non-egoistic, endowed with firmness and enthusiasm, and unaffected by success or failure, is called SATTWIC (pure).

gita.Translation:
rāgī karmaphalaprepsurlubdho hiṃsātmako.aśuciḥ.
harṣaśokānvitaḥ kartā rājasaḥ parikīrtitaḥ -18-27-
gita.Explanation: Passionate, desiring to gain the fruits-of-actions, greedy, harmful, impure, full of delight and grief, such an 'agent' is said to be RAJASIC (passionate).

gita.Line2: विषादी दीर्घसूत्री च कर्ता तामस उच्यते ||१८-२८||
gita.Translation:
ayuktaḥ prākṛtaḥ stabdhaḥ śaṭho naiṣkṛtiko.alasaḥ.
viṣādī dīrghasūtrī ca kartā tāmasa ucyate -18-28-
gita.Explanation: Unsteady, vulgar, unbending, cheating, malicious, lazy, despondent, and procrastinating, such an 'agent' is said to be TAMASIC (Dull).

gita.Translation:
buddherbhedaṃ dhṛteścaiva guṇatastrividhaṃ śṛṇu.
procyamānamaśeṣeṇa pṛthaktvena dhanañjaya -18-29-
gita.Explanation: Hear (you) the three-fold division of 'understanding' and 'fortitude' (made) according to the qualities, as I declare them fully and severally, O Dhananjaya.

gita.Line1: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च कार्याकार्ये भयाभये |
gita.Line2: बन्धं मोक्षं च या वेत्ति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी ||१८-३०||
gita.Translation:
pravṛttiṃ ca nivṛttiṃ ca kāryākārye bhayābhaye.
bandhaṃ mokṣaṃ ca yā vetti buddhiḥ sā pārtha sāttvikī -18-30-
gita.Explanation: That which knows the paths of work and renunciation, what ought to be done and what ought not to be done, fear and fearlessness, bondage and liberation, that 'understanding' is SATTWIC (pure) , O Partha.

gita.Line1: यया धर्ममधर्मं च कार्यं चाकार्यमेव च |
gita.Translation:
yayā dharmamadharmaṃ ca kāryaṃ cākāryameva ca.
ayathāvatprajānāti buddhiḥ sā pārtha rājasī -18-31-
gita.Explanation: That by which one wrongly understands DHARMA and ADHARMA and also what ought to be done and what ought not to be done, that intellect (understanding) , O Partha, is RAJASIC (passionate).

gita.Translation:
adharmaṃ dharmamiti yā manyate tamasāvṛtā.
sarvārthānviparītāṃśca buddhiḥ sā pārtha tāmasī -18-32-
gita.Explanation: That which, enveloped in darkness, sees ADHARMA as DHARMA, and all things perverted, that intellect (understanding) , O Partha, is TAMASIC (dull).

gita.Translation:
dhṛtyā yayā dhārayate manaḥprāṇendriyakriyāḥ.
yogenāvyabhicāriṇyā dhṛtiḥ sā pārtha sāttvikī -18-33-
gita.Explanation: The unwavering 'fortitude' by which, through YOGA, the functions of the mind, the PRANA and the senses are restrained, that 'fortitude, ' O Partha, is SATTWIC (pure).

gita.Line2: प्रसङ्गेन फलाकाङ्क्षी धृतिः सा पार्थ राजसी ||१८-३४||
gita.Translation:
yayā tu dharmakāmārthāndhṛtyā dhārayate.arjuna.
prasaṅgena phalākāṅkṣī dhṛtiḥ sā pārtha rājasī -18-34-
gita.Explanation: But the 'fortitude, ' O Arjuna, by which one holds fast to duty, pleasure and wealth, from attachment and craving for the fruits-of-actions, that 'fortitude, ' O Partha, is RAJASIC (passionate).

gita.Line1: यया स्वप्नं भयं शोकं विषादं मदमेव च |
gita.Line2: न विमुञ्चति दुर्मेधा धृतिः सा पार्थ तामसी ||१८-३५||
gita.Translation:
yayā svapnaṃ bhayaṃ śokaṃ viṣādaṃ madameva ca.
na vimuñcati durmedhā dhṛtiḥ sā pārtha tāmasī -18-35-
gita.Explanation: The 'constancy' because of which a stupid man does not abandon sleep, fear, grief, depression, and also arrogance (conceit) , that 'fortitude, ' O Partha, is TAMASIC (dull).

gita.Line1: सुखं त्विदानीं त्रिविधं शृणु मे भरतर्षभ |
gita.Translation:
sukhaṃ tvidānīṃ trividhaṃ śṛṇu me bharatarṣabha.
abhyāsādramate yatra duḥkhāntaṃ ca nigacchati -18-36-
gita.Explanation: And now hear from me, O best among the Bharatas, of the three-fold 'pleasure,' in which one rejoices by practice, and surely comes to the end-of-pain.

gita.Translation:
yattadagre viṣamiva pariṇāme.amṛtopamam.
tatsukhaṃ sāttvikaṃ proktamātmabuddhiprasādajam -18-37-
gita.Explanation: That which is like poison at first, but in the end like nectar, that 'pleasure' is declared to be SATTWIC (pure) , born of the purity of one's own mind, due to Self realisation.

gita.Translation:
viṣayendriyasaṃyogādyattadagre.amṛtopamam.
pariṇāme viṣamiva tatsukhaṃ rājasaṃ smṛtam -18-38-
gita.Explanation: That pleasure which arises from the contact of the sense-organs with the objects,(which is) at first like nectar, (but is) in the end like poison, that is declared to be RAJASIC (passionate).

gita.Translation:
yadagre cānubandhe ca sukhaṃ mohanamātmanaḥ.
nidrālasyapramādotthaṃ tattāmasamudāhṛtam -18-39-
gita.Explanation: The pleasure, which at first and in the sequel deludes the Self, arising from sleep, indolence and heedlessness, is declared to be TAMASIC (Dull).

gita.Line1: न तदस्ति पृथिव्यां वा दिवि देवेषु वा पुनः |
gita.Translation:
na tadasti pṛthivyāṃ vā divi deveṣu vā punaḥ.
sattvaṃ prakṛtijairmuktaṃ yadebhiḥ syāttribhirguṇaiḥ -18-40-
gita.Explanation: There is no being on earth, or again in heaven among the 'DEVAS' (heavenly beings), who is totally liberated from the three qualities, born of PRAKRITI (matter).

gita.Translation:
brāhmaṇakṣatriyaviśāṃ śūdrāṇāṃ ca parantapa.
karmāṇi pravibhaktāni svabhāvaprabhavairguṇaiḥ -18-41-
gita.Explanation: Of scholars (BRAHMANAS) , of leaders (KSHATRIYAS) and of traders (VAISHYAS) , as also of workers (SHUDRAS) , O Parantapa, the duties are distributed according to the qualities born of their own nature.

gita.Translation:
śamo damastapaḥ śaucaṃ kṣāntirārjavameva ca.
jñānaṃ vijñānamāstikyaṃ brahmakarma svabhāvajam -18-42-
gita.Explanation: Serenity, self-restraint, austerity, purity, forgiveness and also uprightness, knowledge, realisation, belief-in-God --- are the duties of the BRAHMANAS, born of (their own) nature.

gita.Translation:
śauryaṃ tejo dhṛtirdākṣyaṃ yuddhe cāpyapalāyanam.
dānamīśvarabhāvaśca kṣātraṃ karma svabhāvajam -18-43-
gita.Explanation: Prowess, splendour, firmness, dexterity, and also not fleeing from battle, generosity, lordliness --- these are the duties of the KSHATRIYAS, born of (their own) nature.

gita.Translation:
kṛṣigaurakṣyavāṇijyaṃ vaiśyakarma svabhāvajam.
paricaryātmakaṃ karma śūdrasyāpi svabhāvajam -18-44-
gita.Explanation: Agriculture, cattle-rearing and trade are the duties of the VAISHYAS, born of (their own) nature; and service is the duty of the SHUDRAS, born of (their own) nature.

gita.Line1: स्वे स्वे कर्मण्यभिरतः संसिद्धिं लभते नरः |
gita.Translation:
sve sve karmaṇyabhirataḥ saṃsiddhiṃ labhate naraḥ.
svakarmanirataḥ siddhiṃ yathā vindati tacchṛṇu -18-45-
gita.Explanation: Devoted, each to his own duty, man attains Perfection. How, engaged in his own duty, he attains Perfection, listen.

gita.Translation:
yataḥ pravṛttirbhūtānāṃ yena sarvamidaṃ tatam.
svakarmaṇā tamabhyarcya siddhiṃ vindati mānavaḥ -18-46-
gita.Explanation: From Whom is the evolution of all beings, by Whom all this is pervaded, worshipping Him with one's own duty, man attains Perfection.

gita.Translation:
śreyānsvadharmo viguṇaḥ paradharmātsvanuṣṭhitāt.
svabhāvaniyataṃ karma kurvannāpnoti kilbiṣam -18-47-
gita.Explanation: Better is one's own duty (though) destitute of merits, than the duty of another well-performed. He who does the duty ordained by his own nature incurs no sin.

gita.Line1: सहजं कर्म कौन्तेय सदोषमपि न त्यजेत् |
gita.Translation:
sahajaṃ karma kaunteya sadoṣamapi na tyajet.
sarvārambhā hi doṣeṇa dhūmenāgnirivāvṛtāḥ -18-48-
gita.Explanation: One should not abandon, O Kaunteya, the duty to which one is born, though faulty;for, are not all undertakings enveloped by evil, as fire by smoke?

gita.Translation:
asaktabuddhiḥ sarvatra jitātmā vigataspṛhaḥ.
naiṣkarmyasiddhiṃ paramāṃ saṃnyāsenādhigacchati -18-49-
gita.Explanation: He whose intellect is unattached everywhere, who has subdued his self, from whom desire has fled, he, through renunciation, attains the Supreme State of Freedom-from-action.

gita.Line1: सिद्धिं प्राप्तो यथा ब्रह्म तथाप्नोति निबोध मे |
gita.Line2: समासेनैव कौन्तेय निष्ठा ज्ञानस्य या परा ||१८-५०||
gita.Translation:
siddhiṃ prāpto yathā brahma tathāpnoti nibodha me.
samāsenaiva kaunteya niṣṭhā jñānasya yā parā -18-50-
gita.Explanation: How he, who has attained perfection, reaches BRAHMAN (the Eternal) , that in brief do you learn from Me, O! Kaunteya, that Supreme State-of-Knowledge.

gita.Line1: बुद्ध्या विशुद्धया युक्तो धृत्यात्मानं नियम्य च |
gita.Translation:
buddhyā viśuddhayā yukto dhṛtyātmānaṃ niyamya ca.
śabdādīnviṣayāṃstyaktvā rāgadveṣau vyudasya ca -18-51-
gita.Explanation: Endowed with a pure intellect; controlling the self by firmness; relinquishing sound and other objects; and abandoning attraction and hatred;

gita.Translation:
viviktasevī laghvāśī yatavākkāyamānasaḥ.
dhyānayogaparo nityaṃ vairāgyaṃ samupāśritaḥ -18-52-
gita.Explanation: Dwelling in solitude; eating but little; speech, body and mind subdued; always engaged in meditation and concentration; taking refuge in dispassion;

gita.Line1: अहंकारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं परिग्रहम् |
gita.Translation:
ahaṃkāraṃ balaṃ darpaṃ kāmaṃ krodhaṃ parigraham.
vimucya nirmamaḥ śānto brahmabhūyāya kalpate -18-53-
gita.Explanation: Having abandoned egoism, power, arrogance, desire, anger and aggrandisement, and freed from the notion of 'mine, ' and so peaceful --- he is fit to become BRAHMAN.

gita.Line1: ब्रह्मभूतः प्रसन्नात्मा न शोचति न काङ्क्षति |
gita.Line2: समः सर्वेषु भूतेषु मद्भक्तिं लभते पराम् ||१८-५४||
gita.Translation:
brahmabhūtaḥ prasannātmā na śocati na kāṅkṣati.
samaḥ sarveṣu bhūteṣu madbhaktiṃ labhate parām -18-54-
gita.Explanation: Becoming BRAHMAN, serene in the Self, he neither grieves nor desires; the same to all beings, he obtains a supreme devotion towards Me.

gita.Line2: ततो मां तत्त्वतो ज्ञात्वा विशते तदनन्तरम् ||१८-५५||
gita.Translation:
bhaktyā māmabhijānāti yāvānyaścāsmi tattvataḥ.
tato māṃ tattvato jñātvā viśate tadanantaram -18-55-
gita.Explanation: By devotion he knows Me in Essence, what and who I am; then, having known Me in My Essence, he forthwith enters into the Supreme.

gita.Translation:
sarvakarmāṇyapi sadā kurvāṇo madvyapāśrayaḥ.
matprasādādavāpnoti śāśvataṃ padamavyayam -18-56-
gita.Explanation: Doing all actions, always taking refuge in Me, by My grace he obtains the Eternal, Indestructible State or Abode.

gita.Translation:
cetasā sarvakarmāṇi mayi saṃnyasya matparaḥ.
buddhiyogamupāśritya maccittaḥ satataṃ bhava -18-57-
gita.Explanation: Mentally renouncing all actions in Me, having Me as the Highest Goal, resorting to the YOGA -of-discrimination, ever fix your mind in Me.

gita.Translation:
maccittaḥ sarvadurgāṇi matprasādāttariṣyasi.
atha cettvamahaṃkārānna śroṣyasi vinaṅkṣyasi -18-58-
gita.Explanation: Fixing your mind upon Me, you shall, by My grace, overcome all obstacles, but if, from egoism, you will not hear Me, you shall perish.

gita.Translation:
yadahaṃkāramāśritya na yotsya iti manyase.
mithyaiṣa vyavasāyaste prakṛtistvāṃ niyokṣyati -18-59-
gita.Explanation: Filled with egoism, if you think, 'I will not fight, ' vain in this, your resolve; (for) nature will compel you.

gita.Translation:
svabhāvajena kaunteya nibaddhaḥ svena karmaṇā.
kartuṃ necchasi yanmohātkariṣyasyavaśopi tat -18-60-
gita.Explanation: O son of Kunti, bound by your own KARMA (action) born of your own nature, that which, through delusion you wish not to do, even that you shall do, helplessly.

gita.Translation:
īśvaraḥ sarvabhūtānāṃ hṛddeśe.arjuna tiṣṭhati.
bhrāmayansarvabhūtāni yantrārūḍhāni māyayā -18-61-
gita.Explanation: The Lord dwells in the hearts of all beings, O Arjuna, causing all beings, by His illusive power, to revolve, as if mounted on a machine.

gita.Translation:
tameva śaraṇaṃ gaccha sarvabhāvena bhārata.
tatprasādātparāṃ śāntiṃ sthānaṃ prāpsyasi śāśvatam -18-62-
gita.Explanation: Fly unto Him for refuge with all your being, O Bharata; by His grace you shall obtain Supreme Peace (and) the Eternal Abode.

gita.Translation:
iti te jñānamākhyātaṃ guhyādguhyataraṃ mayā.
vimṛśyaitadaśeṣeṇa yathecchasi tathā kuru -18-63-
gita.Explanation: Thus, the 'Wisdom' which is a greater secret than all secrets, has been declared to you by Me; having reflected upon it fully, you now act as you choose.

gita.Line1: सर्वगुह्यतमं भूयः शृणु मे परमं वचः |
gita.Line2: इष्टोऽसि मे दृढमिति ततो वक्ष्यामि ते हितम् ||१८-६४||
gita.Translation:
sarvaguhyatamaṃ bhūyaḥ śṛṇu me paramaṃ vacaḥ.
iṣṭo.asi me dṛḍhamiti tato vakṣyāmi te hitam -18-64-
gita.Explanation: Hear again My supreme word, most secret of all; because you are dearly beloved of Me, therefore, I will tell you what is good (for you).

gita.Line1: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु |
gita.Line2: मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे ||१८-६५||
gita.Translation:
manmanā bhava madbhakto madyājī māṃ namaskuru.
māmevaiṣyasi satyaṃ te pratijāne priyo.asi me -18-65-
gita.Explanation: Fix your mind upon Me; be devoted to Me; sacrifice for Me; bow down to Me; you shall come, surely then, to Me alone; truly do I promise to you, (for) you are dear to Me.

gita.Line2: अहं त्वा सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः ||१८-६६||
gita.Translation:
sarvadharmānparityajya māmekaṃ śaraṇaṃ vraja.
ahaṃ tvāṃ sarvapāpebhyo mokṣyayiṣyāmi mā śucaḥ -18-66-
gita.Explanation: Abandoning all DHARMAS, (of the body, mind, and intellect) , take refuge in Me alone; I will liberate thee from all sins; grieve not.

gita.Line2: न चाशुश्रूषवे वाच्यं न च मां योऽभ्यसूयति ||१८-६७||
gita.Translation:
idaṃ te nātapaskāya nābhaktāya kadācana.
na cāśuśrūṣave vācyaṃ na ca māṃ yo.abhyasūyati -18-67-
gita.Explanation: This is never to be spoken by you to one who is devoid of austerities or devotion, nor to one who does not render service, nor to one who desires not to listen, nor to one who cavils at Me.

gita.Translation:
ya idaṃ paramaṃ guhyaṃ madbhakteṣvabhidhāsyati.
bhaktiṃ mayi parāṃ kṛtvā māmevaiṣyatyasaṃśayaḥ -18-68-
gita.Explanation: He who, with supreme devotion to Me, will teach this supreme secret to My devotees,shall doubtless come to Me.

gita.Line2: भविता न च मे तस्मादन्यः प्रियतरो भुवि ||१८-६९||
gita.Translation:
na ca tasmānmanuṣyeṣu kaścinme priyakṛttamaḥ.
bhavitā na ca me tasmādanyaḥ priyataro bhuvi -18-69-
gita.Explanation: Nor is there any among men who does dearer service to Me, nor shall there be another on earth dearer to Me than he.

gita.Line1: अध्येष्यते च य इमं धर्म्यं संवादमावयोः |
gita.Translation:
adhyeṣyate ca ya imaṃ dharmyaṃ saṃvādamāvayoḥ.
jñānayajñena tenāhamiṣṭaḥ syāmiti me matiḥ -18-70-
gita.Explanation: And he who will study this sacred dialogue of ours, by him I shall have been worshipped by the 'sacrifice-of-wisdom, ' such is My conviction.

gita.Translation:
śraddhāvānanasūyaśca śṛṇuyādapi yo naraḥ.
so.api muktaḥ śubhā.Nllokānprāpnuyātpuṇyakarmaṇām -18-71-
gita.Explanation: That man also, who hears this, full of faith and free from malice, he too, liberated, shall attain to the happy worlds of those righteous deeds.

gita.Translation:
kaccidetacchrutaṃ pārtha tvayaikāgreṇa cetasā.
kaccidajñānasammohaḥ pranaṣṭaste dhanañjaya -18-72-
gita.Explanation: Has this been heard, O son of Pritha, with single-pointed mind? Has the distraction, caused by your 'ignorance, ' been dispelled, O Dhananjaya?

gita.Translation:
arjuna uvāca.
naṣṭo mohaḥ smṛtirlabdhā tvatprasādānmayācyuta.
sthito.asmi gatasandehaḥ kariṣye vacanaṃ tava -18-73-
gita.Explanation: Arjuna said:Destroyed is my delusion, as I have now gained my memory (knowledge) through your grace, O Achyuta. I am firm; my doubts are gone. I will do according to your word (bidding).

gita.Translation:
sañjaya uvāca.
ityahaṃ vāsudevasya pārthasya ca mahātmanaḥ.
saṃvādamimamaśrauṣamadbhutaṃ romaharṣaṇam -18-74-
gita.Explanation: Sanjaya said:Thus have I heard this wonderful dialogue between Vaasudeva and the high-souled Paartha, which causes the hair to stand on end.

gita.Translation:
vyāsaprasādācchrutavānetadguhyamahaṃ param.
yogaṃ yogeśvarātkṛṣṇātsākṣātkathayataḥ svayam -18-75-
gita.Explanation: Through the grace of Vyasa I have heard, this supreme and most secret YOGA ,directly from Krishna, the Lord of YOGA, Himself declaring it.

gita.Translation:
rājansaṃsmṛtya saṃsmṛtya saṃvādamimamadbhutam.
keśavārjunayoḥ puṇyaṃ hṛṣyāmi ca muhurmuhuḥ -18-76-
gita.Explanation: O King, remembering this wonderful and holy dialogue between Keshava and Arjuna,I rejoice again and again.

gita.Line2: विस्मयो मे महान् राजन्हृष्यामि च पुनः पुनः ||१८-७७||
gita.Translation:
tacca saṃsmṛtya saṃsmṛtya rūpamatyadbhutaṃ hareḥ.
vismayo me mahān rājanhṛṣyāmi ca punaḥ punaḥ -18-77-
gita.Explanation: Remembering and again remembering, that most wonderful Form of Hari, great is my wonder, O king; and I rejoice again and again.

gita.Line1: यत्र योगेश्वरः कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धरः |
gita.Translation:
yatra yogeśvaraḥ kṛṣṇo yatra pārtho dhanurdharaḥ.
tatra śrīrvijayo bhūtirdhruvā nītirmatirmama -18-78-
gita.Explanation: Wherever is Krishna, the Lord of YOGA , wherever is Paartha, the archer, there are prosperity, victory, happiness and firm (steady or sound) policy; this is my conviction.

gita.Translation: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde mokṣasaṃnyāsayogo nāma aṣṭādaśo.adhyāyaḥ -18-79-
gita.Explanation: Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad-Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA , in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the  eighteenth discourse ends entitled:THE YOGA OF LIBERATION THROUGH RENUNCIATION OM TAT SAT MAMA SADGURU TAPOVANA CHARANAYOH 'At The Feet Of My Master Tapovanam.'
